title: Data Analytics Intern
description:
Eindhoven, Netherlands
Category
 Supply Chain Management
Posted Date
 06/21/2024
Job Id
 350746
  
We’re looking for a **Data** **Analytics Intern** to join our **SC Data Analytics & Automation** team.


Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.


As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!


Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.


As **Data Analytics Intern**, you will be responsible to support in designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable data models and dashboards to generate supply chain analytics insights. You will collaborate closely with project managers, data analysts, and IT to ensure seamless data flows and actionable frontend dashboards. Join us in a dynamic team at the forefront of data-driven innovation, harnessing analytics and automation solutions to shape the digital future of our supply chain..


We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!

**What you’ll do**
------------------

* Provide top-tier support and swift troubleshooting for our existing data analytics solutions
* Fuel efficiency by supporting in the design and development of cutting-edge data analytics projects that provide valuable insights into our operational supply chain performance
* Unleash your technical data analytics and automation skills to uncover valuable insights from diverse datasets
* Thrive in an intellectually stimulating environment while contributing to our data analytics and automation roadmaps
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and best practices in analytics and automation

**Your qualifications**
-----------------------

* Studying a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Supply Chain Management or a related field
* Strong programming skills in SQL and Python with curiosity about new technologies & solutions
* Basic understanding of data modeling and database management (Snowflake)
* Skilled in Power BI for data visualization with keen attention to designing visually appealing and informative dashboards
* Team player, hands-on mentality with strong communication and problem-solving skills
* Knowledge about Agile project mgmt., strong quality mindset by reliably delivering sprints according to committed user stories


Our candidate profile is just a guide. We know that many talented people only apply for jobs when there is an exact match. If you don't fit all the criteria but believe this role is for you, we would very much like to hear from you.

**What you’ll get in return…**
------------------------------

* Competitive remuneration
* Strong career development opportunities with access to a personalized learning platform, free trainings, and coaching
* Working in an international team at the forefront of Data Analytics with colleagues around the world
* Hands-on experience and opportunity to kickstart your career with Signify


We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.


See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Our employees talk trash all day, every day.**

**That’s why we love them!**

Orbisk employees **do** talk trash a lot. To be more precise, they discuss reducing food waste in the hospitality industry. How does the Orbi work in practice? Waiters scan cleared plates at Orbisk hardware stations, and our algorithms throw themselves on the leftovers to determine when ingredients were thrown away and in what quantity. Food for (actionable) thought because if we – for example – discover that guests aren’t into tomatoes but devour every last spec of avocado, restaurateurs can source smarter, reducing food waste and costs. We’ve already helped eliminate a whopping 737.520 kg of food waste, and we’re just getting started!

**As our Data Analyst,** you'll step into the role of our groundbreaking 'data detective' - the nickname we made up for the analyst who transforms complex data into clear, actionable insights for our product. Partnering with our Data & AI team, you will be responsible for transforming complex data sets into user-friendly insights that drive strategic decision-making and operational efficiency.

Additionally, we invite you to use your expertise to improve our data usability and enhance overall data quality. We want Orbisk to become a well-known name in the global hospitality business, and we believe you can help us achieve that goal.

**Our Product: The Orbisk Dashboard**  
Our product is a data-rich dashboard that shows all the waste registered by one or multiple of our Orbi’s. We can slice and dice this data in many different ways. As you can imagine, one Orbi registering waste is quite straightforward, but as we grow we now face the challenge of customers with increasingly complex environments, like waste from more than 200 different Orbis in different locations, time-zones, currencies and other (cultural) differences.

In this role, you'll become an expert in the data collected by the Orbi food waste monitor. You will frequently participate in food waste coaching sessions with our customers, assisting the Orbisk coaches in understanding customer data to maximize the value we can extract for them. Besides addressing hands-on data requests, you will also be responsible for systematically identifying common patterns in how customers successfully utilize the provided data. You will then translate these insights into new features that enhance our product's effectiveness. Do you feel like you are ready to bite down into this great international data challenge?

**The role in 6 bullets**

* Analyze data from multiple Orbi's to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for waste reduction.
* Develop and maintain intuitive, data-rich dashboards that provide clear insights into food waste metrics.
* Work closely with our product owner, developers, and other stakeholders to implement data-driven solutions.
* Continuously seek ways to improve data collection, analysis processes, and reporting accuracy.
* Conduct user research to understand the needs and behaviors of our clients, ensuring our data solutions are aligned with their goals.
* Propose and implement innovative data analysis methodologies and tools to enhance our service offerings.

**Your track record mentions**

* You've been in the data game for 3+ years.
* Masters or bachelors degree in a technical field, such as data science or computer science.
* The magic, or ability to convert questions or requirements into comprehensive data reports, dashboards, or other data solutions.
* Thorough and meticulous approach to understanding data nuances, complexities, and the necessity for accurate reporting.
* You're a "masterchef" when it comes to data analysis frameworks and tools such as SQL, Python, dashboarding solutions, and data visualization.
* Big plus: experience with data-heavy products, where extracting value from data requires innovation beyond standard reporting and dashboarding.

**Why join Orbisk?**

For a whole menu of reasons. Some lofty (reducing food waste also reduces our collective CO2 and H2O footprints), others more down-to-earth. After all, joining a scale-up that disrupts an entire industry is also just plain fun. And a great conversation starter. Especially if that team is as driven and adventurous as ours. We also offer you:

* €4.500 - €6.000 gross p/m (depending on knowledge and experience)
* Pension scheme and 30 paid vacation days (based on 40 hours per week)
* Company laptop and €250 netto home office budget per year
* Education & Alleo budget, and a travel allowance
* Free office lunch and an office dog to keep you company
* An office based in Utrecht and option to work partly remote
* A young and creative startup work environment that invests in your development
* A close-knit team with smart, enthusiastic colleagues who are happy to share their expertise with you. And on Fridays, a (non-alcoholic?) beer or two.

**Get to know us**

We can’t wait to tell you more about our plans. Reach out by clicking on that apply button or contact Doğu Colak via Whatsapp +31 6 38711496.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Pay: €4.500,00 - €6.000,00 per month

Expected hours: 32 – 40 per week

Language:

* Engels (Required)

Work authorization:

* Nederland (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Utrecht

title: Data Scientist Optimization
description:
**DHL Express - a company that connects people!**
=================================================


What makes DHL great? Our People! We know each employee’s individual contributions make us the #1 Express Delivery and Logistics Company in the world. Distinguished as No.1 World’s Best Workplace™ by Great Place to Work and Fortune Magazine DHL Express is committed to maintaining an environment that empowers every team member to make the greatest possible impact on our business. Our corporate culture is about personal commitment – to our business, to each other and to our global communities. DHL is dedicated to being a great place to work. Start YOUR career with DHL today as a **Data Scientist Optimization!**
**How will you contribute to the success of DHL?**
==================================================



The role purpose is to implement Business Intelligence, Data Analysis & Analytics plans to identify business intelligence, reporting, and data analysis needs and provide data that is accurate, congruent, reliable, and in line with overall business objectives and needs.**The location is flexible in Maastricht (NL) or Bonn (DE).**



**Key tasks:**


* Derive analytical and data requirements from business needs & objectives.
* Cleanse, analyze, and report on different datasets from any function within the company.
* Interpret and visualize analytical results for business partners and other non-technical stakeholders.
* Develop statistical and/or optimization models (e.g., machine learning, deep learning, linear programming).
* Create solution prototypes for business users to experiment. Identify new use cases for the application of advanced analytics and facilitate a data-driven culture.
* Produce accurate outcomes on analytics tasks, ensuring reproducibility and precision of results.

**Do you have what it takes?**
==============================


* Experience in applying Optimization / Operations Research techniques (e.g., Linear Programming, Metaheuristic Optimization, Swarm Intelligence, …) to complex large-scale problems.
* Experience in analyzing large and complex datasets coming from different functions.
* Knowledge of statistics, data visualization, and machine learning.
* Able to produce creative analytical solutions based on clear and thorough analyses of complex processes and business relationships.
* Experience in using our standard analytics tools such as Python / Jupyter Lab, SQL, and NoSQL, Power BI / Tableau.
* Comfortable in explaining complex analytical and technical content to various audiences.
* Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic, and international environment.
* Energetic team player with a positive ‘can do’ attitude.
* Success-oriented problem solver. Independent work ethic, integrity, and loyalty.
* As a plus: Able to write simple web applications for users to test models / visualize results (e.g., Flask).
* Able to structure an optimized (relational) database.
* Able to connect various data sources and preprocess raw data files (e.g. XML/JSON).
* Able to containerize applications for automated deployment Have software engineering skills.
* Experience with Spark / Hadoop.
* Able to write efficient, production-level Python code.
* University Degree in a quantitative field preferred (e.g., Mathematics / Statistics / Physics / Computer Science / Industrial Engineering (or comparable).


**What's in it for you?**
=========================



DHL Express is a certified Great Place To Work. This means you will work in an environment where trust and safety are core values! Next to this, we also offer:


* A competitive salary, bonus incentives and a strong pension scheme;
* A wide range of employee benefits that support your wellbeing;
* Availability of a wide range of training and development packages;
* A job within a company that pays attention to our environment and future;
* RCS Grade J.

Interested? Please apply by sending us your **CV** and **motivational letter**.



DHL is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic

title: Data Modelling and Visualisation Lead
description:
Job Description :
Europe Data Modelling and Visualisation Lead  

Location: Amsterdam, Budapest Dublin, Edinburgh or Glasgow or london  

9 - 12 Month Fixed Term Contract
Join Our Supply Team  

As the home of iconic brands such as Baileys, Guinness, Smirnoff, and Johnnie Walker, at Diageo we source, produce and deliver 6.5 billion litres of world-leading products every year across 180 markets globally. Because of this huge undertaking, we rely on highly advanced systems as well as the very best talent to make sure our businesses continue to run smoothly. To give you some idea of the scale of our operation, over half of our 30,000 employees work in our supply chains. We have teams in over 100 sites across more than 30 countries, but what matters is that wherever you work, you’re part of a diverse, inclusive team where there are opportunities for everyone. Whether you work in planning, logistics, technical teams or manufacturing, you’ll be part of an innovative, dynamic organisation. We set ourselves the highest standards, and our practices have earned us international recognition. And it’s people with energy, dedication and problem-solving skills who’ll help us get even better. In return, we offer a world of opportunities for you to explore, to shape and progress your career.  

Context  

The Data Modelling and Visualisation Lead plays a key role within the Advanced Planning System program focusing on Inventory Optimisation. The DMV Lead is responsible for transforming data as an input to the IOP application, building analytical solutions to identify and correct data and create visualisations to cater to a wide range of partners.
The DMV Lead will have deep understanding of current analytics, reporting and visualization tools, their integration with other systems and a good understand of planning processes. With direct interactions with business stakeholders will drive and deliver future analytics, reporting and data quality platform.
In addition, the DMV Lead is required to understand the design structure of OMP data model, its integration to Diageo Data Hub and advanced analytics tools (Databricks, Dataiku, Alteryx,…)
Key Accountabilities:
The DMV Lead will be expected to display the flowing amongst other skills to be successful:* Display critical thinking and digital dexterity by using data to tell a story based on fact and trends.
* Create insightful reporting and analytics suite as per Diageo digital strategy (PowerBi)
* Working closely with business stakeholder to contribute where most needed
* Create reporting solutions which are flexible to support future needs
* Prepare detailed documentation for designed suites to allow seamless handover to Diageo BAU teams
* Analyze all data feeds, frequency, granularity, completeness and quality
* Manage DevOps backlog for each project phase and area of expertise
* Test delivered solutions and provide inputs for any process improvements
* Becomes the key contact for technical errors and system issues resolution.


Qualifications and Experience* Baseline understanding of the end-to-end Supply Chain Planning processes; Supply Planning, Distribution
* Requirements Planning, Inventory Planning, Conversion, Logistics, Procurement and Customer Service
* Demonstrated proficiency advanced analytics techniques
* Strong analytical, organizational and decision making skills
* Good communication skills – verbal, written and presentation. - Proficient in MS applications e.g. Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook
* Proficient in data programming languages SQL, Python, R,…
* Proficient in data visualization tools (PowerBi, Qliksense, Tableau)
* Proficient in big data analytics and data handling (Azure Data lake/Databricks, SQL server)


Our purpose is to celebrate life, every day, everywhere. And creating an inclusive culture, where everyone feels valued and listened to, is a crucial part of this. We believe the most inclusive and diverse culture makes for a better business and a better world. We know that for our business to thrive and for Diageo to realise its ambition, we depend on having diverse talent with a range of backgrounds, skills and capabilities in each of the countries in which we operate and to reflect our broad consumer base.
Join us, and you'll be part of an organisation that embraces diversity in the broadest possible sense. This means that you'll be welcomed and celebrated for who you are just by being you. You'll be part of — and help build — an inclusive culture that celebrates people of different gender, ethnicity, ability, age, sexual orientation, social class, educational backgrounds, experiences, approaches, and more. And you'll help us champion inclusion and diversity across our entire business: with our employees, our suppliers, across our brands, and within the communities in which we operate.
About Us  

With over 200 brands sold in nearly 180 countries, we’re the world’s leading premium drinks company. Every day, over 30,000 dedicated people come together at Diageo to create the magic behind our much-loved brands.
Join us and you’ll collaborate, explore, and innovate. Challenge and be challenged. Together with passionate people from all over the world, you’ll build brands consumers love.
We value each other and celebrate different perspectives. In our inclusive culture, you’ll have the backing you need to test new ideas and learn from them. Harness your passion and desire to grow as you make your mark. Let’s unlock a brighter, more exciting future together.
Our ambition is to create the best performing, most trusted and respected consumer products companies in the world. To achieve this, we need the world’s very best people. We're looking for people with curiosity, creativity, boldness and a sense of purpose to take Diageo and our timeless, pioneering brands to the next level.
Feel inspired? Then this may be the opportunity for you.
Worker Type :
Regular
Primary Location:
Amsterdam
Additional Locations :
1HQ, Budapest, Edinburgh Park, Onyx, Glasgow, St James Gate
Job Posting Start Date :
2024-06-24
company_description: Diageo is a global leader in beverage alcohol.

title: Quantitative Analyst
description:
**Quantitative Analyst** 

As a quantitative analyst, your role involves applying advanced mathematical and statistical methods to analyze data about renewable energy certificates (RECs) and carbon credits.

**The candidate**

As a quantitative analyst, your role involves applying advanced mathematical and statistical methods to analyze data about renewable energy certificates (RECs) and carbon credits. You develop sophisticated models and algorithms aimed at forecasting market trends, assessing risks, and optimizing trading strategies. You work closely with traders, you leverage your analytical insights to identify profitable opportunities and mitigate potential losses. Additionally, you collaborate with research teams to explore emerging market dynamics and contribute to the development of innovative trading strategies. Your deep understanding of both financial markets and renewable energy systems allows you to play a pivotal role in driving our company's success in the ever-evolving renewable energy sector.

**The Company**

Caely helps companies meet their environmental goals. Caely actively trades and closes environmental commodities transactions with top-class companies (utilities, project developers, corporates, power generators, and industrials). With global ambitions, Caely is set to grow rapidly in the coming years in Europe and the United States, followed by Asia. We have a highly international team of sales traders who serve clients in their native language. Communication in the office is always in the English language.

**The Role**

You are primarily responsible for leveraging advanced mathematical and statistical techniques to analyze vast amounts of data related to renewable energy certificates (RECs), carbon credits, and other environmental commodities.

Your day-to-day tasks involve developing and refining complex models and algorithms that enable the company to forecast market trends with accuracy, assess various forms of risk, and optimize trading strategies. This involves not only understanding the intricacies of financial markets but also having a deep knowledge of renewable energy systems and the regulatory frameworks surrounding them.

Collaboration is key in your role. You work closely with the trading team to translate your analytical insights into actionable strategies, helping them identify lucrative opportunities and navigate potential pitfalls. Additionally, you collaborate with the research teams to stay abreast of emerging market dynamics and contribute to the development of innovative trading approaches.

Your role as a quantitative analyst is to harness the power of data and mathematical modeling to drive informed decision-making and maximize the company's profitability in the dynamic and rapidly evolving renewable energy sector.

The Role will consist of, but not limited to, the following actions on a daily basis:

* Utilizing advanced mathematical and statistical techniques to analyze large datasets related to renewable energy certificates, carbon credits, and other environmental commodities. This involves identifying patterns, trends, and correlations to inform trading strategies and decision-making processes.
* Developing and refining sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms to forecast market trends, assess risk, and optimize trading
* : Collaborating with the trading team to translate analytical insights into actionable trading strategies Risk Assessment: Assessing various forms of risk, including market risk, credit risk, and operational risk, associated with trading renewable energy certificates.
* Staying abreast of emerging market trends, regulatory developments, and technological advancements in the renewable energy sector.

**The Requirement**

* Bachelor's degree or higher in mathematics, statistics, finance, economics, engineering, or related quantitative field.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL
* Strong quantitative skills, including econometrics, time series analysis, and optimization methods.
* Understanding of financial markets, trading principles, and risk management concepts.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Effective communication and collaboration skills.
* Attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis and modeling.
* Willingness to continuously learn and adapt to evolving market dynamics and regulatory changes

**The Offer**

* Inspirational work environment in the fastest-growing commodity sector
* Competitive salary and bonus scheme
* Unlimited holidays
* Personal development program
* Pension Plan

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

Flexibele taalvereiste:

* Nederlands niet vereist

Rooster:

* ma-vr

Werklocatie: Fysiek

title: Senior QA Engineer - CPMS (contractor)
description:
**WE ARE SHELL RECHARGE SOLUTIONS**



We're on a mission to enable cleaner transportation for everyone, driving the way towards a lower-carbon future. We do this by designing and building solutions for charging electric vehicles at home, at work, and on-the-go.

  


With some of the most passionate and experienced minds on our side, we aim to make charging easy and accessible. Our award-winning services include charge points, a mobile app, and a charge card, providing access to 600,000 charge points in over 33 countries.

  




**THIS IS HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE**


**Your core accountabilities are to...**


Be a part of engineering efforts among enthusiastic, highly capable SDET (QA) team in the Netherlands to develop and utilize best-in-industry test automation to ensure high quality feature launches for Charge Point Management System of Shell Recharge Solutions.  

+ 

  

Apply your understanding of software engineering best practices to guide the test automation team in the development of reliable and scalable automated tests at the integration, system, and user acceptance testing levels and promote test automation to our development team at the unit test level.  
+ 

  

Promote quality assurance in your team by owning the testing process and be sure quality is built in.  
+ 

  

Participate in the team by refining and estimating user stories, planning sprints, daily stand-ups and retrospectives.  
+ 

  

Support peers in QA, through workshops, documentation, and pair programming.  
+ 

  

Design and continuously improve testing process that fits the team expectations (better CI/CD capabilities, code analytics, performance test, vulnerability tests, etc.).  
+ 

  

Conduct exploratory testing sessions or leverage experience-based testing to complement automation efforts as needed.  
+ 

  
+ Own the monitoring and alerting activity on the platform providing a strong customer support interface.

 **THE PERSON WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

  

* Bachelor’s or Master's Degree in Computer Science/ Engineering or equivalent work experience required.
* 7+ years’ experience with relevant hands-on test automation development.
* Good knowledge and experience with Python.
* Knowledge or learning eagerness of Golang to support debugging.
* Experience in testing micro-services, preferably using Consumer-Driven Contract Testing.
* Experience with logging and monitoring, preferably using DataDog.
* Knowledge of the mainstream technologies for highly scalable, reliable and functional back-end systems.
 **WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?**

  


Working at Shell Recharge Solutions means working in a fun, fast-growing international company with big ambitions.


**By joining us, you will:**

  

* Contribute to a more sustainable future;
* Become an expert in e-mobility;
* Work in an open and diverse culture with colleagues from all over the world;
* Receive a competitive salary that fits your experience + yearly bonus;
* Receive a **work from home budget** to professionally equip your home office;
* Have 28 paid days of annual leave based on a 40 hour work week;
* Be able to spend up to 5 working days a year on **volunteering**;
* Develop your skills and expertise through several training sessions. Besides this, you will receive a **personal training budget** and set your annual goals with your personal development plan;
* Enjoy our monthly fun get-togethers (drinks), our annual winter and summer outing, and lots of other events or sport teams initiated by colleagues.

 ***Please note:*** *If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed on the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups often only apply when they feel 100% qualified. We are committed to creating a more equitable, inclusive and diverse company and we strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientation, and life experiences to apply.*
company_description: Shell Recharge Solutions is unlocking the future of mobility.

title: Senior Software Engineer(Backend)
description:
**WHO WE ARE**


Choreograph is WPP’s global data products and technology company. We’re on a mission to transform marketing by building the fastest, most connected data platform that bridges marketing strategy to scaled activation.
We work with agencies and clients to transform the value of data by bringing together technology, data and analytics capabilities. We deliver this through the Open Media Studio, an AI-enabled media and data platform for the next era of advertising.
We’re endlessly curious. Our team of thinkers, builders, creators and problem solvers are over 1,000 strong, across 20 markets around the world.


POSITION OVERVIEW


Do you love getting better and better at what you do? Do you thrive in an environment with a lot of change, open communication, and rapid innovations? Then maybe we will be a match!* 

Education or work experience level: HBO, University* 

Location: Sittard and/or Eindhoven* 

Hybrid way of working; You work at least one day per week onsite in Sittard  

RESPONSIBILITIES


Our self-steering teams are building a global platform that is transforming the way our users work. Our end-users are all GroupM client teams worldwide and it helps them to execute advertising campaigns more effectively and smarter. We are looking for the person who will help us make the lives of our media specialists even better.

  

You will be part of the data connections team. Together with other full-stack engineers, product managers, UX, customer success and users you will discover and deliver new functionality. All our engineers have foundational skills to build and deliver full features and expand their skills with one or more specialties like architecture, security, etc. You can count on the enthusiasm of your fellow engineers because we like to work together.

  

The stack you will be working in includes C# (.NET Core), Python, ReactJS with Typescript. In a microservices architecture hosted using GCP cloud infrastructure (including docker, Kubernetes).

  

Would you love to collaborate with teams in other countries? Are you looking for a challenge and do you have the skills to join our team? Then we are looking for you!

  

REQUIREMENTS

* You have 3+ years' experience as a full-stack software engineer
* You have experience in multiple programming languages (language-agnostic)
* You get energy from building full features together with your mission team
* You have an optimistic mentality and the 'impossible' does not exist for you.
* You speak fluent Dutch and English
* You are communicatively strong
* Experience with Domain-Driven Design is a plus

 **ABOUT CHOREOGRAPH**:


If you are ready to be at the forefront of the AdTech industry, shaping its future, and driving success for both Choreograph and our clients, we encourage you to apply and join our team.
Choreograph is the beating heart of data inside WPP’s media investment group, GroupM, the world’s leading media investment company responsible for more than $60 billion in annual media investment.. Discover more about Choreograph at www.choreograph.com

**GroupM and all its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity.****We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more great work we can create together.**

title: Interim Cloud Engineer/ Data scientist
description:
**Gaat dit over jou?**
----------------------


Vaardigheden die je goed kunt gebruiken voor deze job.

* **Je bent analytisch.** Hoofd- of bijzaak? Dat verschil zie jij meteen. Je komt makkelijk tot de kern en houdt tegelijk het overzicht.
* **Je bent in control.** Doelen zijn er om behaald te worden, daar zorg jij wel voor. Je delegeert, houdt overzicht en plant realistisch.
* **Je spreekt begrijpelijke taal.** Als je iets zegt, zorg je dat de ander het ook begrijpt. Je spreekt duidelijk en vlot, en kunt goed presenteren.
* **Je vindt altijd een oplossing.** Jij rent niet weg voor problemen. Sterker nog: je onderzoekt ze grondig. Je legt de juiste verbanden en zoekt naar mogelijke oorzaken. 'Eerst denken, dan doen' is jouw motto.
* **Je ziet het grote geheel.** Jij bent vaak drie stappen verder dan de rest. Je ziet overal verbanden en bedenkt inventieve oplossingen.
* **Je wilt presteren.** Jij weet wat je wilt, en hoe je het wilt bereiken. Daarvoor geef je alles. Zit het tegen? Jij geeft niet op en zet een tandje bij.

**Jouw baan**
-------------


The Interim Cloud Engineer Specialist is a challenging and exciting role for engineers that want to build and maintain the cloud infrastructure for VodafoneZiggo Data and Insights group. You will join a small and growing team of engineers who constantly improve the group's bigdata platform containing Machine Learning and Data Science capabilities by providing a performant and observable platform supporting the entire analytics lifecycle, from development to production. The ideal engineer has a drive for constant improvement of both themselves and the systems that they build, manage, and support. While they may not have previous experience with Bigdata and, they are able to leverage their existing knowledge of AWS as they learn and work alongside the engineers and scientists that they support.

**Dit krijg je van ons**
------------------------


Werken als Interimmer bij VodafoneZiggo levert je meer op dan een betaalde factuur:

* Een snelle laptop met alle tools die je nodig hebt.
* Gemakkelijke afhandeling van contract, facturatie en het schrijven van je uren.
* Ruimte en vrijheid om met jouw expertise het verschil te maken.

**Dit breng jij mee**
---------------------

Technology


* Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) in production use cases.
* Experience with Linux, comfortable with Amazon Linux 2 based systems.
* Development experience with programming or scripting languages like Python, etc.
* Experience with automation tools, including Cloudformation, AWS CDK.
* Experience with various Data Science tools and/or platforms, such as Athena, Jupyter Notebooks, Anaconda, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, and AWS EMR.

Personal


* Positive and solution-oriented mindset.
* Critical thinker and problem-solving skills.
* Self-motivated and self-managing.
* Understanding of agile project management and execution.
* Stays current with new and evolving technologies via formal training and self-directed education.
* Experience with developing and maintaining design documentation in confluence.
* Effective communication skills: regularly achieve consensus with peers and clear status updates.
* English written and verbal communication skills.

Responsibilities


* Deploying, building, and configuring deployment methods for Amazon Web Services, especially utilizing the AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK).
* Write scripts and automation using Python, or Typescript.
* Constantly improve service quality, security, and performance.
* Participation in agile projects, writing user stories, and create a backlog.
* Collaborate with peers and user team members
* Make sure we deliver high quality, scalable and cost efficient solutions

Must have:


* AWS architecture, services and products
* CDK
* Apache Airflow / AWS MWAA
* API Gateway
* DynamoDB/Casandra etc databases
* Prometheus / Grafana
* CICD / GitLab / Vault
* Kafka / MSK

Nice to have:


* Bigdata skills like spark / Spark streaming
* Projen
* Cloud / platform security

We are looking for Dutch residents/freelancers with a Chamber of Commerce (KVK) registration only. This is not a call for acquisition.


#LI-IO1
company_description: With over 12,000 people supporting over 18million customers, our purpose is to connect for a better future. A more inclusive, more sustainable world. Join us to make an impact you can see and feel.

title: Postdoc Modularity in Multi-Modal Transport
description:
Postdoc Modularity in Multi-Modal Transport
 Apply Now
Job description


Come join our team as an enthusiastic research fellow to engage in multi-disciplinary research on cutting-edge rail-based freight mobility systems. A Post-doc position and a Junior research position are open at the freight and logistics lab to explore innovative and revolutionary mobility concepts, involving market-ready digital solutions and automation. We explore different related areas including designing and modelling the system for rail, road, and logistics, embedding the system in a cyber-physical framework. Candidates with related backgrounds are welcome to apply. We specifically encourage applicants with expertise in operations research with familiarity with railway scheduling, vehicle routing, and on-demand modelling of systems and knowledge of a) distributed optimization and control and b) software architecture design and digital twins. The project is embedded in the PoDs4Rail (Homepage 01 - Pods4Rail) European project which explores innovative concepts related to application of automated modular vehicles in multi-modal transport. Ideal candidates are expected to possess a strong sense of self-motivation, a clear career objective with the ambition to engage in group leadership and project management, and strong academic records. Due to the highly interdisciplinary nature of the research, the candidate should possess and welcome interfacing with related fields and communicate and collaborate effectively with other members of the research group as well as industry partners. The duration of the positions is at least 18 months with the potential to be extended.


Requirements


You are a highly motivated and enthusiastic researcher with the ambition to conduct high-quality interdisciplinary research. You enjoy thinking out-of-the-box, mentoring students, are highly innovative, communicative and enjoy team work. You are reliable, independent, and organized in delivering with respect to deadlines. You have excellent communication and collaboration skills. In addition,



For post-doctoral positions, you have


* a PhD degree in Computer science, Operations research, Transportation Engineering or a related field (with a strong background in optimization and mathematical modelling) and/or
* a strong background in distributed control, and multi-agent learning,
* You have experience with standard problems such as VRP, railway scheduling, fleet management, and similar.
* You are familiar with the areas of multimodal freight transport, railway operations, planning and related fields.
* You have strong programming skills.


For researchers, you


* are familiar with creation of modular software architectures
* have strong software development skills in relevant programming languages such as Python
* have knowledge in data management and software integration methods
* are familiar with, keen on deepening your knowledge in digital twins.


For all candidates, an excellent command of English is expected.


Conditions of employment


Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.



For international applicants, TU Delft has the Coming to Delft Service. This service provides information for new international employees to help you prepare the relocation and to settle in the Netherlands. The Coming to Delft Service offers a Dual Career Programme for partners and they organise events to expand your (social) network.


TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.



At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.



Challenge. Change. Impact!


Faculty Civil Engineering and Geosciences


The Faculty of Civil Engineering & Geosciences (CEG) is committed to outstanding international research and education in the field of civil engineering, applied earth sciences, traffic and transport, water technology, and delta technology. Our research feeds into our educational programmes and covers societal challenges such as climate change, energy transition, resource availability, urbanisation and clean water. Our research projects are conducted in close cooperation with a wide range of research institutions. CEG is convinced of the importance of open science and supports its scientists in integrating open science in their research practice. The Faculty of CEG comprises 28 research groups in the following seven departments: Materials Mechanics Management & Design, Engineering Structures, Geoscience and Engineering, Geoscience and Remote Sensing, Transport & Planning, Hydraulic Engineering and Water Management.



Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Civil Engineering & Geosciences.


Additional information


For more information about this vacancy, please contact Dr. Mahnam Saeednia, Department of Transport and Planning, e-mail: m.saeednia@tudelft.nl.


Application procedure


Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than **31 July 2024** via the application button and upload your motivation and CV.


* You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
* A pre-Employment screening can be part of the selection procedure.
* Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.


FACULTY/DEPARTMENT### **Faculty of Civil Engineering and Geosciences**

JOB TYPE### **Postdoc Positions**

SCIENTIFIC FIELD### **Engineering**

HOURS PER WEEK### **38**

SALARY### **€ 3.226,00 - € 5.090,00**

DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION### **Doctorate**

VACANCY NUMBER### **TUD05428**


Apply Now

**Dit krijg je van ons**
------------------------


Werken als Interimmer bij VodafoneZiggo levert je meer op dan een betaalde factuur:

* Een snelle laptop met alle tools die je nodig hebt.
* Gemakkelijke afhandeling van contract, facturatie en het schrijven van je uren.
* Ruimte en vrijheid om met jouw expertise het verschil te maken.

**Dit breng jij mee**
---------------------

Technology


* Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) in production use cases.
* Experience with Linux, comfortable with Amazon Linux 2 based systems.
* Development experience with programming or scripting languages like Python, etc.
* Experience with automation tools, including Cloudformation, AWS CDK.
* Experience with various Data Science tools and/or platforms, such as Athena, Jupyter Notebooks, Anaconda, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, and AWS EMR.

Personal


* Positive and solution-oriented mindset.
* Critical thinker and problem-solving skills.
* Self-motivated and self-managing.
* Understanding of agile project management and execution.
* Stays current with new and evolving technologies via formal training and self-directed education.
* Experience with developing and maintaining design documentation in confluence.
* Effective communication skills: regularly achieve consensus with peers and clear status updates.
* English written and verbal communication skills.

Responsibilities


* Deploying, building, and configuring deployment methods for Amazon Web Services, especially utilizing the AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK).
* Write scripts and automation using Python, or Typescript.
* Constantly improve service quality, security, and performance.
* Participation in agile projects, writing user stories, and create a backlog.
* Collaborate with peers and user team members
* Make sure we deliver high quality, scalable and cost efficient solutions

Must have:


* AWS architecture, services and products
* CDK
* Apache Airflow / AWS MWAA
* API Gateway
* DynamoDB/Casandra etc databases
* Prometheus / Grafana
* CICD / GitLab / Vault
* Kafka / MSK

Nice to have:


* Bigdata skills like spark / Spark streaming
* Projen
* Cloud / platform security

We are looking for Dutch residents/freelancers with a Chamber of Commerce (KVK) registration only. This is not a call for acquisition.

title: Data Analyst (Customer Data Solutions)
description:
Data Analyst (Customer Data Solutions)**At a glance**
---------------


Do you have a curious mindset? Does it excite you when you find valuable insights in data? Are you able to convey your data insights to the business? Then we are looking for you to make Customer Data Solutions a more data-driven department.  

What do you want as your next step in your career? Tell us your story. We are curious!

**Your job**
------------


As a data analyst within CDS, you will be responsible for delivering data-driven insights, performing analysis, visualising in Power BI and conveying your key insights to your stakeholders. You contribute by prioritising and giving a positive impulse to a data-driven way of working in collaboration with the business. Within CDS we focus on bringing customer data and processes in control and we help change programs by making impactful analyses.  

Projects you can think of:

* Doing deep dives on data quality
* Provide insights into the operation of customer processes such as Client Onboarding (NCTO)
* Impact analyses of new regulations
* Monitoring/self-service BI dashboards in Power BI
* Vulnerable customers (social impact)


You work together with your stakeholders for whom you are the data business partner. You are their guide for making data-driven decisions.

**Working environment**
-----------------------


Customer Data Solutions (CDS) is the end-to-end product unit responsible for generic customer processes and all customer and party data. CDS consists of 4 departments: CDS Data office, Customer Generic Processes, CDS Grid and Steering & Expertise. The data analyst will be part of the CoE BI & Data Analytics team (part of CDS Data Office).


"You can rely on us!" CDS provides the foundation for many processes within the bank, which is why it is important that we show our stakeholders that they can rely on us. When you work for CDS, you are curious and up-to-date, you do it together, you are clear and concrete, driven and proud and you want to deliver. Together, we are a team of passionate experts who strive for seamless implementation together with our stakeholders. We do this in an inclusive work environment where performance and job satisfaction come together.

**Your profile**
----------------

* You possess excellent analytical skills and you are strong in getting the message across
* Up to 2 years of relevant work experience
* Experience with one of the following programming languages: SQL, Python/PySpark
* Experience with visualising in Power BI or a similar visualization tool
* A relevant (university) degree
* Full Professional English, Professional Working Dutch
* You understand the business and can convey technical subjects in a non-technical language
* You have strong communication and interpersonal skills which helps you to collaborate with various departments
* You are able to translates data insights into effective and attractive visualisations in Power BI
* You have a curious mindset and know what is happening within the organisation with regards to projects you work on
* You take responsibility, you are self-organizing and you take initiative
**We are offering**
-------------------


Data-driven working is in full development. In fact, you can play an important role in this. We offer you the opportunity to become even better at your profession within a large organization.

* We offer you room to grow and the freedom to develop yourself professionally
* A Benefit Budget of 11% which allows you to acquire additional employment benefits
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year
* Five weeks of vacation per year
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team)
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands
* An excellent pension scheme
**Interested?**
---------------


If you are interested or have any questions do not hesitate to contact Cindy Tjong by phone at +31 6 82 364 288 or email at cindy.tjong@nl.abnamro.com for more information about the job.

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

### **Wij bieden**

* Een leergierige houding
* Analytische skills
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Data Modelling and Visualisation Lead
description:
Job Description :
Europe Data Modelling and Visualisation Lead  

Location: Amsterdam, Budapest Dublin, Edinburgh or Glasgow or london  

9 - 12 Month Fixed Term Contract
Join Our Supply Team  

As the home of iconic brands such as Baileys, Guinness, Smirnoff, and Johnnie Walker, at Diageo we source, produce and deliver 6.5 billion litres of world-leading products every year across 180 markets globally. Because of this huge undertaking, we rely on highly advanced systems as well as the very best talent to make sure our businesses continue to run smoothly. To give you some idea of the scale of our operation, over half of our 30,000 employees work in our supply chains. We have teams in over 100 sites across more than 30 countries, but what matters is that wherever you work, you’re part of a diverse, inclusive team where there are opportunities for everyone. Whether you work in planning, logistics, technical teams or manufacturing, you’ll be part of an innovative, dynamic organisation. We set ourselves the highest standards, and our practices have earned us international recognition. And it’s people with energy, dedication and problem-solving skills who’ll help us get even better. In return, we offer a world of opportunities for you to explore, to shape and progress your career.  

Context  

The Data Modelling and Visualisation Lead plays a key role within the Advanced Planning System program focusing on Inventory Optimisation. The DMV Lead is responsible for transforming data as an input to the IOP application, building analytical solutions to identify and correct data and create visualisations to cater to a wide range of partners.
The DMV Lead will have deep understanding of current analytics, reporting and visualization tools, their integration with other systems and a good understand of planning processes. With direct interactions with business stakeholders will drive and deliver future analytics, reporting and data quality platform.
In addition, the DMV Lead is required to understand the design structure of OMP data model, its integration to Diageo Data Hub and advanced analytics tools (Databricks, Dataiku, Alteryx,…)
Key Accountabilities:
The DMV Lead will be expected to display the flowing amongst other skills to be successful:* Display critical thinking and digital dexterity by using data to tell a story based on fact and trends.
* Create insightful reporting and analytics suite as per Diageo digital strategy (PowerBi)
* Working closely with business stakeholder to contribute where most needed
* Create reporting solutions which are flexible to support future needs
* Prepare detailed documentation for designed suites to allow seamless handover to Diageo BAU teams
* Analyze all data feeds, frequency, granularity, completeness and quality
* Manage DevOps backlog for each project phase and area of expertise
* Test delivered solutions and provide inputs for any process improvements
* Becomes the key contact for technical errors and system issues resolution.


Qualifications and Experience* Baseline understanding of the end-to-end Supply Chain Planning processes; Supply Planning, Distribution
* Requirements Planning, Inventory Planning, Conversion, Logistics, Procurement and Customer Service
* Demonstrated proficiency advanced analytics techniques
* Strong analytical, organizational and decision making skills
* Good communication skills – verbal, written and presentation. - Proficient in MS applications e.g. Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook
* Proficient in data programming languages SQL, Python, R,…
* Proficient in data visualization tools (PowerBi, Qliksense, Tableau)
* Proficient in big data analytics and data handling (Azure Data lake/Databricks, SQL server)


Our purpose is to celebrate life, every day, everywhere. And creating an inclusive culture, where everyone feels valued and listened to, is a crucial part of this. We believe the most inclusive and diverse culture makes for a better business and a better world. We know that for our business to thrive and for Diageo to realise its ambition, we depend on having diverse talent with a range of backgrounds, skills and capabilities in each of the countries in which we operate and to reflect our broad consumer base.
Join us, and you'll be part of an organisation that embraces diversity in the broadest possible sense. This means that you'll be welcomed and celebrated for who you are just by being you. You'll be part of — and help build — an inclusive culture that celebrates people of different gender, ethnicity, ability, age, sexual orientation, social class, educational backgrounds, experiences, approaches, and more. And you'll help us champion inclusion and diversity across our entire business: with our employees, our suppliers, across our brands, and within the communities in which we operate.
About Us  

With over 200 brands sold in nearly 180 countries, we’re the world’s leading premium drinks company. Every day, over 30,000 dedicated people come together at Diageo to create the magic behind our much-loved brands.
Join us and you’ll collaborate, explore, and innovate. Challenge and be challenged. Together with passionate people from all over the world, you’ll build brands consumers love.
We value each other and celebrate different perspectives. In our inclusive culture, you’ll have the backing you need to test new ideas and learn from them. Harness your passion and desire to grow as you make your mark. Let’s unlock a brighter, more exciting future together.
Our ambition is to create the best performing, most trusted and respected consumer products companies in the world. To achieve this, we need the world’s very best people. We're looking for people with curiosity, creativity, boldness and a sense of purpose to take Diageo and our timeless, pioneering brands to the next level.
Feel inspired? Then this may be the opportunity for you.
Worker Type :
Regular
Primary Location:
Amsterdam
Additional Locations :
1HQ, Budapest, Edinburgh Park, Onyx, Glasgow, St James Gate
Job Posting Start Date :
2024-06-24
company_description: Diageo is a global leader in beverage alcohol.

title: Consultant | Financial Services
description:
*Do you want to work with one of the most data-mature industries? Are you passionate about data, artificial intelligence and strategy within the Financial Services? This opportunity is for you!*

 **What we do:**

ADC is a Data & AI Consultancy driving the responsible adoption of data and AI to create real impact for organisations that matter. We support our clients achieve their goals through data-driven solutions with deep industry expertise. What makes ADC unique is that we work impact driven and collaboratively complementing our integrated offering. Our top talent is driven to leverage their advanced data and AI knowledge and experience for the good, working with, instead of for, our clients. We draw on our collective approach to empower pragmatic and comprehensive consultants, through inclusivity, trust, and ownership.  



  

**What you do:**

* Deliver value to our FS clients by helping them develop the best data-driven solutions/transformations, through data -modelling, -engineering or strategy
* Work on client projects that can vary from Risk/Financial Modelling, Regulatory focus or Data Engineering
* Conduct complex statistical analysis in programming languages such as R or Python and similar
* Design and implement data-solutions that suits the nature of the client’s data landscape
* Collaborate with a team of professionals with whom you are building a fast-growing company
* Develop and challenge yourself during in- and external knowledge-sharing and training sessions
* Be a brand ambassador by embracing our company values: Create Real Impact, Collective Culture and Commercial Excellence

**What you bring:**

* 0-3 years’ experience (internship or work experience) in Financial Services sector with hands-on programming
* A quantitative Master’s Degree (e.g., Econometrics, Quantitative Finance…)
* Strong desire for consultancy, intrinsic motivation for continuous learning and an ambition to grow
* Excellent English language and communication skills
* Passion for identifying patterns in data using customised, self-programmed models


**What we offer:**

* A steep learning curve by taking on responsibility from day one
* Projects in which you can immerse yourself in challenges to make a positive impact
* Freedom to realize own initiatives and implement your ideas
* A training programme focusing on your self-development, designed to transform people into trusted advisors, specialists, and ADC leaders
* A knowledge sharing culture in the form of peer groups, project presentations and Collective Lunch Sharing Sessions
* Our Collective Week, a workcation with the entirety of ADC during which we work on pro bono projects and make unforgettable memories
* A collective bonus on top of a competitive salary
* A welcoming office space in the centre of Amsterdam, with daily lunches provided by our amazing office cook
* Social events such as Friday drinks, First Friday of the Month events, sport activities…and many more.


**What to do next:**  

If you are inspired by the above, apply from the link below!
  

For questions, feel free to contact us from recruitment@amsterdamdatacollective.com

* Amsterdam Data Collective is an equal opportunity employer. To shape a better future we value diversity and promote equality. No characteristics are discriminated against, as indicated in Directive 2000/78/EC . We encourage and welcome all applications. Additional arrangements or adjustments to support your application can be discussed further.

title: Senior Business Analyst: Strategy & Improvement
description:
HelloFresh has been recognized as the #7 Best Place to Work in the list of Multinationals 2023 by Great Place to Work Netherlands! Check out our amazing team and office here and learn more on our socials On LinkedIn and Instagram! Ready to join our team?



**This is how you'll change the way people eat forever**



For our ambitious, fast growing team in Amsterdam, we are looking for a Senior Business Analyst: Strategy & Improvement. You will join the "Business Development" team, the HelloFresh Benelux Strategy & Improvement team that drives Strategy, Growth, Customer Retention and Efficiency through innovation and optimization. This team of Business Analysts and Project Managers works on strategically important, cross-functional, often data-heavy projects. In addition, this team plays an important role in defining and tracking the HelloFresh Benelux strategy. Are you up for the challenge?


**This is how you'll make an impact**



You'll define, develop and deliver strategic improvement and optimization initiatives through analysis, experimentation, business case creation, recommendation definition and project management. You may work on topics related to our box offering, preferences, menu and recipes, customer acquisition, retention initiatives, competitor/customer insights, cost efficiency, strategy, etc., (with opportunity to steer your scope based on your interests). Through this, you contribute to the success of HelloFresh and the happiness of our customers!



What makes this job challenging is that you will put on two hats: you are an "Analyst" (extracting the right insights from large datasets) and also a "Business Developer" (defining recommendations and realizing business improvement).



Potential examples of your day-to-day activities:


* Analyze large data sets to explain performance and customer dynamics, and identify areas for improvement
* Define and develop strategic and tactical ideas
* Test ideas through A/B tests, other experiments and business cases
* Translate your findings into convincing recommendations (slides, presentations) and present these to stakeholders, incl. Benelux C-level management
* Coordinate and collaborate with colleagues across the business to realize implementation
* Supporting Learning & Development of other Analysts in the Benelux organization


*"In this role you get the opportunity to lead and contribute to high profile projects that have a direct impact on our business and our customers. In our fast paced environment, you will be working together with many different teams throughout HelloFresh and see immediate results of what you do on a daily basis"* - Pauwel, CEO Benelux


**These are the ingredients you'll bring to the team**



We are looking for a motivated and purpose driven person to join our company. Our ideal candidate is someone with a quantitative and analytical mindset, who knows how to use data as the basis of decisions and who loves solving challenges in a structured manner; a strong communicator with a passion to develop themselves and who looks forward to contributing to the growth and improvement of HelloFresh.


* At least 5+ years of experience in a similar role, making business impact based on data analysis. For example as a Business Analyst or Consultant in Strategy / Business Development / Growth Strategy / Product / Marketing
* Strong quantitative capabilities: proven ability to analyze large datasets. SQL (or Python, R) skills are a plus, advanced analytics capabilities are a plus
* A University Bachelor degree at minimum
* Able to speak English on a professional level
* Working experience in/with a consumer-facing company (not a strict requirement though)


 **This is our recipe**


* Freedom to initiate, execute and implement your own ideas
* The opportunity to engage and collaborate with our colleagues across the globe
* Participation in the HelloFresh Benelux Business Analytics L&D community, where you will develop yourself through training (hard skills & business problem solving), support and knowledge sharing with other analysts
* Other learning and development opportunities including a personal development budget
* 24 holidays per year, plus 1 day per additional year of work
* A hybrid work setup, with a budget to help set up your home office
* Flexibility to work abroad
* Reimbursement of travel expenses to the office
* A discount on your weekly HelloFresh and/or Green Chef box
* Our FreshEnergy program including bootcamp, yoga, boxing, Headspace subscription, a collaboration with OpenUp for your mental wellbeing, webinars and other events
* Multiple ways of getting to a work-related appointment, for example by using our company cars or a MyWheels car
* Discount on your ClassPass subscription, and a discount for your gym membership via Bedrijfsfitness Nederland
* Discount on your additional health insurance through Zilveren Kruis
* Healthy lunches, fruit and snacks in the office
* Monthly pension scheme


 **Grow your career at HelloFresh**



A career at HelloFresh is an opportunity to make an impact in a world-leading meal-kit company. Through our Learning Never Stops core value, we empower you to take your career development to your highest potential… For the Business Development team specifically, for example, we have seen people grow to leadership or expert positions in Benelux or at our Global HQ, e.g. Director Product Ops, Sr. Director Strategic Product Development and Senior Sustainability Manager.


**Hungry for more?**


* Apply with your CV and a strong motivation to join us (in English please)
* If we see a match, you'll have a video call with one of our recruiters to share more about what you can bring to the team.
* Are both sides still positive? Then we proceed to the assessment stage to assess key skills required for the job
* Next up is an in-person interview with the team to get to know you better and dive into more detail of your skills and how you are going to make an impact
* Lastly you'll have a conversation with someone from our Senior Leadership team


#FreshTalent
company_description: HelloFresh is a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit delivery company, active in 17 countries across 3 continents. Our kits include fresh ingredients and cooking instructions.

title: Intern PX Cognitive Data Science
description:
### **Job Description**



IFF is one of the leading companies on development and production of flavors, fragrances and ingredients for food, beverage, personal care and household product industries. Our products are used by other manufacturing companies producing a wide variety of every-day consumed products (*i.e.,* beverages, detergents, cosmetics, deodorants, dairy products, soups and sauces, *etc*.). The Product Experience (PX) department deals with sensory analysis and consumer research in order to support the Creation & Design department and marketing/sales choices. It plays a key role in product development processes, through understanding of consumer needs and expectations (thanks to tools like sensory profiling, preference evaluation, product positioning, *etc*.).


**Cognitive Science group, Data Science Internship.**


With guidance from PX researchers and manager, the intern will develop an automated workflow to run routine data analysis and visualisation - this also includes:


* Participate for the development of high-quality software that aligns with user needs and business goals.
* Writing efficient code, debugging, and testing.
* Data cleaning, stacking, and analysis.
* Support in implementation and roll out of developed software into IFF’s system.
* Clear documentation of work so others can understand the code and decisions taken.


Alongside with this main project, the student will be maintaining IFF’s current panel performance and ballot creation database in PX in accordance with our Standard Operation Procedure. The student is also provided opportunity to reviewing and propose future improvements.


### **Job Requirements**


**Skills expected**


* Scientific: good knowledge in **PROGRAMMING SKILLS** (*e.g.,* R, Python), **STATISTICAL SKILLS** (*e.g.,* parametric & non-parametric analysis) are a plus.
* Computer science: **being at ease with digital environment,** familiarity with software development methodologies and principles (e.g., wrapping and distribution) is a plus.
* Language: **mandatory scientific and professional English**, written and oral.
* Personal: we are looking for a **PRAGMATIC** and **SOLUTION-ORIENTED** student with **ANALYTICAL** mindset.


**Organization**


* Duration: 5-6 months, beginning of the internship 1st of Sept. 2024 – negotiable.
* Place: Hilversum (Netherlands).

New York, NY 10019
United States
