title: HVAC Engineer
description:
Coolgradient is a fast-growing green-tech start-up with a clear vision to make our digital footprint more sustainable.

**Why?**

Every swipe, every like, every TikTok video we upload, every Zoom call we have, every Netflix video we watch, or everything we buy online is all processed and depends on… data centers. However, these data centers consume large amounts of energy due to the underlying technology we use every day all day.

**How?** 

We have developed an AI-based analytics platform that captures the entire data center (DC) infrastructure - "from roof to room" - to bring the whole DC into a more optimal state. Saving energy and increasing reliability that results in a more sustainable data center in countries like Germany, France, Switzerland, UK, Ireland and The Netherlands.

We are looking for a highly skilled HVAC Design Specialist M/F/X with a strong background in HVAC systems and/or energy technology to join our team.

**What you’ll do**

In this role you’ll work with data related to cooling, power and energy storage systems of data centers. You will use your understanding of HVAC systems to analyze the sensor data and identify areas for improvement. You will be responsible for providing valuable insights to our team and our clients, identifying trends and patterns in data sets, and communicate these to local operations teams.

**Additionally you will**

* Improve HVAC (CFD/2D/1D physics simulation) models and understand cooling layout and design options.
* Continuously monitor and evaluate data to ensure accuracy and identify areas for improvement.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements.

Job requirements

* Degree in systems engineering, energy technology or a related field.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Python and SQL.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with large data sets and identify trends and patterns.
* Pre when experience with data center design
* Pre when experience with Energy Plus, Modelica or similar.

**Perks**

* Working on making the world of data centers more sustainable
* Enjoy a competitive salary, pension scheme, holiday allowance, and disability insurance.
* Our goal is to increase our impact and grow. We want you to grow with us and offer an Employee Stock Option Plan.
* A hybrid home-office-remote policy with flexible working hours where we value your regular presence to enjoy team dynamics, but we like to support the flexibility that fits your daily rhythm and preference.
* Lots of mobility options, where we provide a lease car, public transportation subscription, or company bike, or we’ll reimburse your travels when you prefer to use your own means of mobility.
* Lots of opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Join activities like meetups or (business) events.
* Work abroad with the team, where we combine good weather, a great environment, and good food.
* And above all: a fun and enthusiastic team that values a diverse and transparent culture.

**Visa**

At our company, we highly appreciate and encourage diversity. We believe it is crucial to achieving success and being the responsible company we want to be. However, currently, *our company cannot* *sponsor any work visas.*

Apply to this link: https://coolgradient.recruitee.com/o/hvac-design-specialist

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: €5.000,00 - €8.000,00 per month

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 1062 Amsterdam Nieuw-West

title: Customer Support Engineer
description:
Here at Eternal Sun, we build high-end simulators that make sunlight. They’re used by the world’s biggest solar panel producers and leading R&D labs to assure the quality and performance of their panels. We make sure they can be sure about what they produce. With our precision, innovative mindset and determination, we make a significant impact.  



  

Solar is growing, we are growing. Over the past decade, we have grown to 65 FTE, in Europe, South East Asia, China and the USA. At Eternal Sun, team members can enjoy operational freedom and flexibility but always in close cooperation with the rest of the team. You will find an open atmosphere in an organization with safety, feedback, ownership and customer satisfaction as the core values for our success.

  

The Job



Eternal Sun is looking for a Customer Support Engineer, internally also referred to as “troubleshooting engineer”, with a strong team spirit that enjoys solving challenging technical puzzles in advanced test equipment. Are you interested in serving international customers and also traveling the globe for a few times a year, solving technical challenges with customers in solar PV factories and laboratories worldwide?

  

As a Customer Support Engineer you will be solving machine and solar panel related issues as part of the customer service team from The Hague. It is therefore important that you have a home base in or close to The Hague. Next to that, you will be going on troubleshooting or service trips several times a year, which is why it is important that you are willing to travel.


The main tasks for this job, as part of the customer service team, you will be responding to high priority customer issues, either remote from our The Hague office or occasionally on-site at our customers. Furthermore you will be:


* Performing structured problem analysis and fishbone root cause analysis to find causes of issues, which can be caused by either the solar panel itself or the machine that is testing
* Intensively cooperating with the Data engineer that analyses PV module test data and gives direction for the search of the possible causes of an issue (in case of his absence also covering for his urgent tasks)
* Maintaining fleet dashboard overviews to keep track of uptime of the machines in the field and prioritize maintenance, problem solving and in-field upgrades.
* Form the link between the field service engineers (2x US, 1x Malaysia, 1x India) and the teams in the headquarter

Occasionally joining service and installation trips of the field services engineers, to learn and support the customer service team.  
* 

  

  

  

You



You have a Bachelors or Master’s degree in Engineering and you have preferable at least 2 years of experience in an engineering problem solving related job. You are confident enough to independently travel around the world and interact with customers on a technical level. You are inventive and fast learning. You are an excellent team player and you communicate clearly and pleasantly with colleagues and customers. Your English must be fluent, both spoken and written.

  

The following skills are an absolute must-have:


* Analytic problem solver
* Basic knowledge of electrical engineering and some experience with software
* Willing to travel several times a year

Good communication and reporting skills  
* 

  

Highly preferred are:


* Experience in electrical and software troubleshooting using schematics, measurement and diagnostic tools

Experience with Software/PLC control of machines  
* 

  

The following skills are a very big plus:


* Experience in high frequency electronics measurements
Experience in solar PV and/or optical engineering  
* 

  

Offer


* An international work environment with co-workers coming from 14 different nationalities
* The opportunity to see the world when visiting customers globally
* A personal development plan
* A good salary
* 8% holiday allowance
* Commuting reimbursement at € 0.23 ct. per kilometer
* An annual bonus based on company performance
* A comprehensive pension plan with two additional modules for a secure future
* 25 vacation days with the option to purchase additional days
* Free daily lunch
* A one-year contract with the aim of transitioning to a permanent position thereafter

  

Apply



Do you believe you have what it takes to be our Customer Support Engineer? We would love to hear from you. Please say hi to Priscilla Lim and send in your cv + motivation letter. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Data Steward
description:
Data Steward**In het kort**
---------------


Aan data hebben we bij Hypotheken geen gebrek!


Als Data Steward ben je verantwoordelijk voor de business aspecten van DataManagement, conform alle regels en wetgeving, policies en standaarden. Jij bent de deskundige van alle data waarvoor je verantwoordelijk bent, zoals het creëren en onderhouden van Data producten, analyseren en oplossen van DQ issues, en definiëren en registreren van metadata inclusief data lineage en het Business Data Model binnen een specifiek datadomein.


Uiteraard werk je vanuit het klantperspectief van het data product en je hebt een end-to-end verantwoordelijkheid, van de Golden dataset, in relatie tot andere data producten tot een usecase.


**Je werk**
-----------

* Je verzamelt Data Product requirements en zorgt voor compliant Data Producten die voldoen aan alle relevante regelgeving, wet-®elgeving (zoals BCBS239).
* Je zorgt ervoor dat de golden source data wordt ge-onboard op DIAL, voor de integriteit tussen Data Producten en EDA Compliancy, Integere data voor de Data Producten, correcte requirements en implementatie van Use Cases
* Je prioriteert data issues en definieert data kwaliteits eisen en requirements.
* Je participeert in de performance dialogen met de Data Product Owner.
**Werkomgeving**
----------------


Op dit moment valt de Data Steward rol nog binnen Grid AAB Hypotheken, maar zal in de loop van dit jaar worden overgeheveld naar de Data & Analytics Organisatie, waar je onderdeel wordt van een Data Product Team.


Als Data Steward werk je onder andere samen met de Data Product Owner, Data Scientists, Data Analisten, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers en Solution Engineers.


**Je profiel**
--------------

* Je hebt minimaal HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau
* Je hebt ervaring met Data Management, en het is een pré als je hypothekenkennis hebt
* Je hebt sterke analytische vaardigheden en kunt conceptueel denken
* Je hebt een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift, en kennis van de Engelse taal.
* Je werkt graag samen met anderen om je doelen te bereiken
* Je kunt samenwerken met stakeholders op meerdere niveaus in de organisatie
* Je neemt zelf initiatief en toont verantwoordelijkheid
**Wij bieden**
--------------

* Wij bieden je de vrijheid om het beste uit jezelf te halen, flexibel en hybride te werken en veel ruimte om te groeien
* Wij helpen je om fit & vitaal te blijven
**Interesse?**
--------------


Ben je geïnteresseerd? Reageer dan nu op deze vacature. Neem voor meer informatie contact op met Dorine Hoogendam Lelyveld, senior consultant D&A, 06-52407528 of Pieter Verhoeven, Manager Systemen&Processen, 06-23361709. We maken graag kennis met je.

**Gelijke kansen voor iedereen**
--------------------------------


Het succes van onze organisatie staat of valt met de kwaliteit van onze mensen en de ideeen die zij hebben. Echt verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen voor onze klanten ontstaan door een samenspel van culturen, kennis en ervaring. Daarom is diversiteit voor onze organisatie ontzettend belangrijk. Om ervoor te zorgen dat alle collega's binnen ABN AMRO hun kwaliteiten kunnen ontplooien, stimuleren we een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen zich betrokken en gewaardeerd voelt.

**Disclaimer externe recruitmentbureaus**
-----------------------------------------


Externe recruitmentbureaus dienen een overeenkomst met ABN AMRO BANK N.V. te hebben getekend, uitgegeven door een Talent Acquisition Specialist, om cv's te mogen indienen. Acquisitie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills

### **Wij vragen**

* Een ondernemende houding
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Data Engineer – Long-Term – Amsterdam, Hybrid
description:
**Data Engineer – Long-term – Amsterdam, Hybrid**



Levy Professionals is currently looking for Data Engineers with strong experience in ETL processes and Azure technologies for one of the largest financial institutions in the Netherlands. You will be taking part in the ensurance of efficient data flows across the IT systems and enhancing the current data platform.



**Responsibilities**



As a Data Engineer, your key responsibilities include the following:


* Design, develop, and maintain robust ETL pipelines to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into data warehouses and data lakes,


* Gather clients’ data requirements and ensure data integrity, consistency, and accuracy,


* Optimize and tune ETL processes for performance scalability, and monitor and troubleshoot ETL jobs and workflows to ensure timely resolution of issues for clients projects,


* Use Azure services to implement and manage ETL processes for clients and leverage WAS services as needed to support data integration and analytics for clients projects.



**Who are you?**


* 5+ years of experience as a data engineer, wit ha focus on ETL processes,


* Hands-on experience with AWS and Azure services, Azure certifications as a proof of relevant knowledge,


* Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or Scala,


* Knowledge of data management and warehousing concepts and tools,


* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills.



**About Levy Professionals**



Since 2000, we have been delivering professional solutions to organizations ranging from tech start-ups to global players. From our offices in Amsterdam and London, we have built an international and local network of experienced salaried professionals, driven by our passion for connecting skills with projects. Over the years we have filled over 1,700 applications and today we have consistently recruited and seconded 250+ professionals from 14 countries who have been deployed on a variety of projects. Our strength is the way we see and treat people. This will always be an important factor in our strategy for the coming years.

title: Jira Administrator and DevOps Engineer
description:
#### **About the Team**



You will become part of the engineering productivity team. We enable the Miro engineering organisation to build and ship high-quality software faster by providing metrics and insight to build efficiency and effectiveness in our engineering workflows. Together, we will design and run improvement cycles to improve and innovate how we do things today and design the processes of tomorrow.


#### **About the Role**



At Miro, Analytics, Marketing, Product, Engineering and Design work hand in hand within the AMPED department. We use Jira to empower our teams to track and coordinate work according to our Miro Way of Working. In addition we are at the scale where strategic and tactical decisions need extensive data support and analytics, the Jira ecosysteem is an important source. This requires a well maintained and lean Jira setup that integrates well within our tooling ecosystem. The Jira Administrator & DevOps engineer is responsible for maintaining our Jira Cloud instance, develop surrounding solutions to integrate into our engineering processes and automate tasks to reduce toil.


#### **What you'll do**


* Maintain, administer, and optimise our Jira Cloud instance
* Provide consultation and guidance to teams on using Jira effectively to meet their workflow and reporting needs
* Co-create and execute a strategy to future-proof Jira and its ecosystem
* Complete routine Jira maintenance and cleanup activities
* Advise, implement, and maintain Jira plug-ins to enhance functionality and efficiency
* Develop and maintain integrations between Jira and other systems, such as Backstage and custom scripts
* Develop robust custom scripts and automation solutions (TypeScript and/or Python)
* Demonstrate a strong understanding of CI/CD principles and ensure seamless integration of collaboration software like Jira into our development workflows
* Work closely with the engineering productivity team to gather and analyse engineering metrics, providing valuable insights based on accurate and relevant data
* Offer support and guidance to team members, addressing their questions and concerns promptly through our helpdesk
* Communicate effectively with various stakeholders, translating technical concepts into easily understandable terms
* Maintain accurate and understandable documentation of all work performed

#### **What you'll need**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or equivalent work experience)
* Proven experience as a Jira administrator and integration specialist for at least 5 years
* Proficiency in scripting language for scripting and automation. Experience with TypeScript and/or Python is a plus
* Strong knowledge of CI/CD principles and their application in a DevOps environment where agile methodologies are applied
* Strong understanding of agile methodologies and how these translate into ways of working for teams enabled by Jira
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills can act as a consultant if needed
* Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and documentation
* Ability to work collaboratively and provide guidance to cross-functional teams
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for streamlining processes
* Prior experience with Jira plug-ins and Backstage integrations is a plus
* Familiarity with engineering metrics and the ability to extract meaningful insights from data is a plus

#### **What's in it for you**


* Competitive equity package
* Medical insurance coverage
* Lunch, snacks and drinks provided in the office
* Wellbeing benefit and WFH equipment allowance
* Annual learning and development allowance to grow your skills and career
* Travel allowance for your commute
* Opportunity to work for a globally diverse team
* Inspiring workplace in the heart of Amsterdam

#### **About Miro**



Miro is a visual workspace for innovation that enables distributed teams of any size to build the next big thing. The platform's infinite canvas enables teams to lead engaging workshops and meetings, design products, brainstorm ideas, and more. Miro, co-headquartered in San Francisco and Amsterdam, serves more than 60M users worldwide, including 99% of the Fortune 100. Miro was founded in 2011 and currently has more than 1,800 employees in 12 hubs around the world.



We are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard, and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves every day. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you!



Check out more about life at Miro:


* Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/@lifeatmiro
* Blog: https://miro.com/careers/life-at-miro/all/
* Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mirohq/


At Miro, we strive to create and foster an environment of belonging and collaboration across cultural differences. Miro's mission — *Empower teams to create the next big thing* — is how we think about our product, people, and culture. We believe that creating big things requires diverse and inclusive teams. *Diversity* invites all talent with different demography, identities and styles *to step in*, and *inclusion* invites them to step *closer together.* Every day, we are working to build a more diverse Miro, cultivate a sense of belonging for future and current Mironeers around the world, and foster an environment where everyone can collaborate and embrace differences.


**Miro handles and uses personal data of job applicants in line with its** **Recruitment Privacy Policy** **found** **here****.**
company_description: Miro is a global company on a mission to change the way the world collaborates online. Wanna be a part of the collaboration revolution?

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Zoek jij een plek waar jouw expertise in data engineering bijdraagt aan een toekomst van duurzame bankoplossingen? In ons hechte en diverse team ben je verantwoordelijk voor cruciale data pipelines, word je een speerpunt in de transitie naar Advanced Analytics en krijg je de kans om met jouw leiderschapsvaardigheden het verschil te maken. Zie jij jezelf al werken in een omgeving waar innovatie, samenwerking en persoonlijke groei centraal staan?

**Daarom is dit een topbaan**

1. Je speelt een cruciale rol in het transformeren van ruwe data naar waardevolle inzichten die onze bank helpen innoveren en groeien.

2. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen en bouwen van data pipelines met Azure Databricks, Airflow, Python en SQL.

3. Je krijgt de kans om een leidende rol te vervullen binnen het team en een speerpunt te zijn in de transitie naar Advanced Analytics.

4. Je hebt de mogelijkheid om nieuwe technologieën en toepassingen te verkennen en te implementeren voor data engineering.

5. Je wordt onderdeel van een hecht en divers team dat zich richt op innovatie, samenwerking en persoonlijke groei, waar jouw expertise in data engineering van grote waarde is.

**Solliciteer als Senior Data Engineer** *Via Formorrow leer je jezelf beter kennen. Vind je die baan waarin je helemaal tot je recht komt. En leer je om je toekomst in eigen hand te nemen. Klaar voor een telefonische intake?*

Deze vooruitstrevende bank zet zich in voor innovatie met een duidelijke focus op duurzaamheid en klantgerichtheid. Hier vind je een werkplek waar jouw bijdrage aan de veiligheid en transparantie van financiële transacties écht telt.

Je komt terecht in een dynamisch team dat zich niet alleen richt op Business Intelligence en Advanced Analytics, maar ook een omgeving biedt waar ontwikkeling en werkplezier hand in hand gaan. Samen werken we aan een toekomst waarin jouw persoonlijke groei vooropstaat.

**Dit ga je doen**

Als Senior Data Engineer bij onze Domain Data Store speel je een cruciale rol in het transformeren van ruwe data naar waardevolle inzichten die onze bank helpen innoveren en groeien. Je staat voor de uitdaging om complexe datastromen te beheren en te optimaliseren, en tegelijkertijd een leidende rol binnen het team te vervullen. We zoeken een professional met ervaring in Azure Databricks, Airflow, Python, SQL, en een passie voor het verbeteren van data gedreven processen.  
Verantwoordelijkheden:

* Ontwerpen en bouwen van data pipelines met behulp van Azure Databricks, Airflow, Python en SQL;
* Samenwerken met collega's om data requirements duidelijk te krijgen en te implementeren;
* Optimaliseren van bestaande processen en pipelines voor verbeterde prestaties;
* Monitoren van de datastromen en zorgen voor betrouwbare datalevering;
* Begeleiden en ondersteunen van minder ervaren teamleden in hun ontwikkeling;
* Onderzoeken van nieuwe technologieën en toepassingen voor data engineering;
* Stakeholdermanagement en afstemming over datalevering en gebruik.

**Jouw profiel**

✔ teamspeler

✔ communicatief

✔ flexibel

✔ analytisch

✔ zelfstandig

✔ proactief

**Herkenbaar?**

* Je hebt ervaring met het actief bouwen van complexe data pipelines met Azure Databricks, Airflow, Python en SQL.
* Minstens afgeronde hbo-opleiding richting relevant vakgebied.
* Je bent in staat om actief bestaande data processen en pipelines te optimaliseren voor verbeterde prestaties en betrouwbare datalevering.
* Je hebt de vaardigheid om anderen actief te begeleiden en ondersteunen, vooral degenen met minder ervaring.
* Het is essentieel dat je proactief nieuwe technologieën onderzoekt en implementeert voor data engineering.
* Je beheerst de Engelse taal uitstekend.

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime, Uitzicht op vast, Vaste baan, Detachering

Salaris: Vanaf €2.700,00 per maand

Verwacht aantal uur: Niet minder dan 32 per week

Flexibele taalvereiste:

* Nederlands niet vereist

Rooster:

* Dagdienst
* ma-vr

Secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden:

* Bedrijfsfeesten
* Budget voor professionele ontwikkeling
* Dienstreizen vergoeding
* Extra vakantiedagen
* Kerstpakket
* Mogelijkheid tot promotie
* Pensioen
* Reiskostenvergoeding
* Telefoonplan
* Vrijdagmiddagborrel
* Werk vanuit huis

Soorten aanvullende vergoedingen:

* Vakantiegeld

Opleiding:

* HBO (Gewenst)

Werklocatie: Hybride werken in 1082 PP Amsterdam

title: Internship Data Engineering
description:
Investigate and improve data science model output delivery.

**Background**


Within ING we make use of data science for a variety of use cases (such as improving financial health of our customers by transaction forecasting). The data science models which run in production all generate output this data needs to be delivered to different destination within ING. These destinations vary from data lakes and kafka topics to Cassandra datastores.


In the past a generic Interface format (GI) was developed as a one size fits all solution to standardize the output delivery for our data-scientists. Over time many models have adopted this interface but we are now facing challenges such as files which became too big or the throughput time is too long.

**The opportunity**


We would like to deep-dive into this topic by dedicating an intern as engineer to investigate our use cases and look for a future proof solution. This includes gathering information, do market research (buy vs built) and design / develop one or more prototypes together with our data-scientists data engineers.

**Team** **overview**


You, as an intern will join one of our data-engineering teams which support the ING data-scientists. The teams work on a variety of topics to maintain and evolve our data-analytics environment in Google Cloud.

* Located in our Amsterdam office.
* Mix of local and off-shore colleagues (so multiple nationalities)
* We work in agile teams based around Scrum and continuous delivery principles.
* Our teams work in hybrid mode, we work from home when possible and work from the office at least one day a week.
* We have 36 hour working weeks.

**Roles and responsibilities**


This assignment is about understanding and improving our way of distributing data-science model output. The current implementation of GI (Generic Interface) needs to be examined as well as our use cases and the industry standards available. The goal is to boost new alternatives and bring us further in achieving an excellent data-driven organization.

**Expected l****earnings**

You will be working in an environment with modern continuous delivery tools with people who have a continuous improvement mindset. Tools include Azure (CDaaS), Google GCP (Terraform, Vertex AI, BigQuery), NiFi for data flow management.


Working in a complex environment such as ING can be challenging and this is part of the learning and our people and teams are there to help you.


Communication and collaboration are key and this involves working closely together with domain experts such as data-engineers, data-scientists and machine learning engineers.

**Expected output**


An inventory of required features, an improved understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of the current implementation and a redesign plus implementation plan (part of this can also contain a buy vs built decision or a vendor selection).


When time allows the output also consists of the implementation of a prototype solution.

**How to succeed**


You can succeed in this role by showing:

* a “can-do” mentality
* you are a “self starter” (pro-active)
* you speak out and like to challenge yourself and the people around you
* you have a background in IT, information management or similar
* experience and affinity with machine learning is very useful
* it helps if you like programming (python, java, scala) though this is not a show stopper

**Rewards and benefits**  

This is a great opportunity to train with highly skilled people who are experts in their field. You’ll do a lot and learn a lot –  

not only about your specialist area and the bank, but also about yourself and whether this type of environment is right for you.

  

You’ll also benefit from:

* Internship allowance of EUR 700/month for 36 hours (maximum)
* Compensation of travel costs
* Your own work laptop
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Staff Software Engineer (Backend)
description:
**About JWP:**



JWP is the leading video software and data insights platform that gives our customers independence and control in today's Digital Video Economy. Founded over a decade ago as an open-source video player, JWP's technology platform now powers digital video for hundreds of thousands of businesses across NA, EMEA, APAC, and LATAM. Each month, there are over 1 billion viewers across 2.7 billion unique devices consuming video on JWP's technology.


**Remote Policy:**



At JWP, we have adopted a remote work policy, with all our employees working remotely. While we value remote work, we can only consider candidates who are currently located within the country of the job posting. Regrettably, candidates outside of the country of posting will not be considered, and JWP does not provide relocation assistance. This policy is aligned with our operational setup.


**The Engineering Team:**



Our Engineering team plays a big part in the company's success through the development of innovative technologies. Engineers at JWP are passionate about writing code and solving complex problems. Equipped with a modern tech stack, our Engineers contribute to helping drive monetization for our customers across billions of devices monthly.


**The Opportunity:**



Backend Engineers at JWP contribute to the development of innovative video-focused technology products that service clients around the world. We are looking for an experienced Backend Engineer to join our team in the Netherlands. This is a Staff level opportunity to come on board to use modern technology stacks and work on interesting products within the video space that impact clients across some of the many verticals, such as broadcasting and publishing.


**As a Staff Software Engineer for our Authorization Service, you will:**


* Build a delivery system that can deliver personalized and recommended video metadata at scale.
* Build a system that helps broadcasters to manage their OTT applications across different platforms.
* Optimize the architecture of our delivery services.
* Design the data models and data solutions that we need to power our services.
* Collaborate in a cross-functional team focused on our customers and their viewers experiences.
* Contribute to innovative technology and architecture of a global production-scale service layer.
* Work with microservices and microservice principles (Service discovery, API gateways, data transaction consistency, etc.).
* Make a material impact on our streaming products, analytics, and OTT integrations.
* Participate in code reviews with and mentor your peers.


**Requirements for the role:**


* At least 7 years of relevant experience, with an extensive background in backend development.
* Demonstrable experience of leading technical projects and architecting solutions.
* Proven record of leading cross-team technical projects and architecting and delivering high-quality and impactful technical solutions, demonstrating expertise independent of programming languages.
* Demonstrated experience in scaling systems to the next level to handle increased loads and demands.
* In-depth knowledge of database types, database design and data structures.
* Commitment to code quality, maintainability, readability, scalability, and performance.
* Ability to quickly analyze and resolve tactical issues across various areas.
* Experience mentoring junior engineers.
* Open-minded and eager to learn new technologies.


**Bonus Points:**


* Experience working with OTT apps/platforms or worked in the broadcasters' industry.
* Solid understanding of the Python programming language.
* Experience building scalable systems using cloud infrastructures like AWS or Google Cloud.
* Understand micro-services architecture: Designing, creating, deploying, testing, and monitoring.
* Contributed to open-source projects.
* Experience with K8s, Docker and Containers.


**Perks of being at JWP,** **Netherlands**



Our goal is to take care of you and ensure you will be successful in your new role. Your success is our success!

title: PhD Position on Moral Creativity and Technology
description:
PhD Position on Moral Creativity and Technology
 Apply Now
***Would you like to pursue a PhD on moral creativity and technology? Then apply for a fully funded position at TU Delft's Philosophy Section.***

  


Job description


Moral problems are often thought of as dilemmas, with two options. However, in real-life there is often a potentially infinite number of choices that a moral agent can make in response to a problem.



Coming up with these potential responses, and reflecting on what they might mean and how they might play out in the world, requires creativity. This project investigates the role of creativity (including artistic creativity) in moral decision making, especially in connection with the innovation of technologies. The envisaged outcomes of this project include a theory of the role of creativity in the responsible development and anticipation of new technologies, and the establishment of methodological tools for transdisciplinary collaborations including artists, philosophers and technology developers. The PhD project will investigate these questions by combining philosophical reasoning with participation in transdisciplinary collaborations involving artists who work at the intersection of art, technology and society. To make this possible, we have established a collaboration with Waag Futurelab, which has experience with the exercise of moral creativity in artistic practice surrounding technologies.



This PhD position will be part of the Ethics of Socially Disruptive Technologies programme, ESDiT, a ten year long international research programme of seven academic institutions in the Netherlands that has started in January 2020. This programme has a combined budget of €27 million, and is funded by the Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research in the Gravitation funding scheme for excellent research, and by matching funds from the participating institutions. The duration is from January 2020 to December 2029. The programme has the aim of achieving breakthrough research in at the intersection of ethics, philosophy, technology / engineering and social sciences, and to position its consortium at the top of its field internationally. A key objective is to investigate how new technologies challenge moral values and ontological concepts (like “nature”, “human being” and “community”), and how these challenges necessitate a revision of these concepts. The programme includes four research lines, “Nature, life and human intervention”, “The future of a free and fair society”, “The human condition” and “Foundation and Synthesis: Ethics of Technology, Practical Philosophy, and Modern Technology-Driven Societies”.



This PhD project will be embedded in the Art Track that cuts across the whole programme. Depending on the interests of the PhD candidate, the project can berelated to one or more of the programme's main research lines. More information can be found on the ESDiT website: https://www.esdit.nl/ The candidate is expected to play an active role in the project described above and to participate actively in the workshops, public events, courses and other activities of the ESDiT programme in general and the Art Track in particular. ESDiT-PhD students are encouraged to spend a semester abroad, and a budget is available to cover expenses. Furthermore, generous (conference) travel budgets are available for the position.



The supervisory team for this position will consist of dr. Mandi Astola (TU Delft), dr. Julia Hermann (University of Twente) and Prof.dr. Sabine Roeser (TU Delft). The position is based at the Ethics and Philosophy of Technology Section at the Faculty of Technology, Policy and Management (TPM) at TU Delft, which provides a stimulating and internationally oriented research environment. The candidate will participate in the activities of in the Graduate Schools of TU Delft, of the Faculty of TPM, and of the 4TU.Center for Ethics and Technology. Our PhD candidates also are expected to take on a small number of teaching tasks, under supervision.


Requirements


* You will have completed, prior to appointment, a Master’s degree or equivalent degree in philosophy, but other Master’s degrees will also be considered if you have demonstrable expertise in close connection with the themes of the research project. (Minimaal BA in philosophy; MA in e.g. STS, history of science, arts and culture, media studies, design, engineering).
* Strong conceptual and analytic skills.
* You have proven affinity with technology and the philosophy of technology.
* Relative to experience, you have excellent research skills and excellent academic writing and presentation skills.
* You can work both independently and as part of a team.
* You have a high level of proficiency in English.


Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.


Conditions of employment


Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.



Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, increasing from € 2770 per month in the first year to € 3539 in the fourth year. As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills.



The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.



For international applicants, TU Delft has the Coming to Delft Service. This service provides information for new international employees to help you prepare the relocation and to settle in the Netherlands. The Coming to Delft Service offers a Dual Career Programme for partners and they organise events to expand your (social) network.


TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.



At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.



Challenge. Change. Impact!


Faculty Technology, Policy and Management


The Faculty of TPM provides an important contribution to solving complex technical-social issues, such as energy transition, mobility, digitalisation, water management and (cyber) security. TPM does this with its excellent education and research at the intersection of technology, society and policy. We combine insights from both engineering and social sciences as well as the humanities. TPM develops robust models and designs, is internationally oriented and has an extensive network of knowledge institutions, companies, social organisations and governments.



Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Technology, Policy and Management.


Additional information


For more information about this vacancy, please contact dr. Mandi Astola m.astola@tudelft.nl.


Application procedure


Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply before **30 August 2024** via the application button and upload:


* A 1 page cover letter stating your motivation to apply for this specific position
* A 1 page research note setting out your ideas for this project
* A CV
* Academic grade transcripts
* An academic writing sample, in English
* Names and contact details of two referees


The intended starting date for this PhD position is December 1st 2024.



Interviews with selected candidates will presumably be held on the following dates: 1st round: 19 September 2024 (online), 2nd round: 24 September 2024 (in person at TU Delft).



Please note that there are other vacancies in the Ethics of Socially Disruptive Technologies programme at different participating universities. In case several are of interest to you, we want to encourage you to apply to them simultaneously. In our research as well as in the composition of our teams we strive to for diversity and inclusivity. We especially encourage candidates from underrepresented groups in academia to apply. And we also encourage candidates to bring in novel perspectives, e.g. grounded in non-Western philosophical approaches or approaches from underrepresented perspectives.



Also note:


* A pre-employment screening can be part of the selection procedure.
* You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
* Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.


FACULTY/DEPARTMENT### **Faculty of Technology, Policy & Management**

JOB TYPE### **PhD**

SCIENTIFIC FIELD### **Behaviour and Society**

HOURS PER WEEK### **36-40**

SALARY### **€ 2.770,00 - € 3.539,00**

DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION### **University graduate**

VACANCY NUMBER### **TUD05550**


Apply Now

title: PhD Position on Intercultural Perspectives on the Ethics of Existential Risk
description:
PhD Position on Intercultural Perspectives on the Ethics of Existential Risk
 Apply Now
***Would you like to pursue a PhD on intercultural ethics of existential risk? Then apply for a fully funded position at TU Delft's Philosophy Section.***


Job description


Philosophers are increasingly concerned with the impact of socially disruptive technologies on our existing concepts as well as new ones. One such concept that has recently emerged as a response to changing socio-technical circumstances is that of existential risks. Most discussions in the field don't pay attention to intercultural philosophical perspectives. For instance, the concept of existential risk finds its roots in a specific brand of Western-centric normative thinking, thereby influencing how we frame and approach what we find valuable and important for the purposes of preventing existential risks from materializing. The primary goal of the project is to study existential risks as part of broader conceptual cluster disrupted by socio-technological developments through the lens of general intercultural philosophy or a specific non-Western ethical framework. The resulting approach of ‘intercultural ethics of existential risks’ would be operationalized to explore whether and how insights and perspectives from under-represented philosophical traditions bear upon understanding existential risks (and related concepts), and subsequently, normative and practical questions associated with why their mitigation matters, for whom, and so on.



This PhD position will be part of the Ethics of Socially Disruptive Technologies programme, ESDiT, a ten year long international research programme of seven academic institutions in the Netherlands that has started in January 2020. This programme has a combined budget of € 27 million, and is funded by the Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research in the Gravitation funding scheme for excellent research, and by matching funds from the participating institutions. The duration is from January 2020 to December 2029. The programme has the aim of achieving breakthrough research in at the intersection of ethics, philosophy, technology / engineering and social sciences, and to position its consortium at the top of its field internationally. A key objective is to investigate how new technologies challenge moral values and ontological concepts (like “nature”, “human being” and “community”), and how these challenges necessitate a revision of these concepts. The programme includes four research lines, “Nature, life and human intervention”, “The future of a free and fair society”, “The human condition” and “Foundation and Synthesis: Ethics of Technology, Practical Philosophy, and Modern Technology-Driven Societies”.



This PhD project will be embedded in the Foundation and Synthesis line, as well as in the intercultural track that cross-cuts through the whole program. More information can be found on the ESDiT website: https://www.esdit.nl/ The candidate is expected to play an active role in the project described above and to participate actively in the workshops, public events, courses and other activities of the ESDiT programme in general and the “Foundation and Synthesis” research line and intercultural track in particular. ESDiT-PhD students are encouraged to spend a semester abroad, and a budget is available to cover expenses. Furthermore, generous (conference) travel budgets are available for the position.



The supervisory team for this position will consist of dr. Kritika Maheshwari (TU Delft), dr. Gunter Bombaerts (TU Eindhoven) and Prof.dr. Sabine Roeser (TU Delft). The position is based at the Ethics and Philosophy of Technology Section at the Faculty of Technology, Policy and Management (TPM) at TU Delft, which provides a stimulating and internationally oriented research environment. The candidate will participate in the activities of in the Graduate Schools of TU Delft, of the Faculty of TPM, and of the 4TU.Center for Ethics and Technology. Our PhD candidates also are expected to take on a small number of teaching tasks, under supervision.


Requirements


* You will have completed, prior to appointment, a Master’s degree or equivalent degree in moral or theoretical philosophy, but other Master’s degrees will also be considered if you have demonstrable expertise in conceptual problems and approaches to normative justification, in close connection with the themes of the research project.
* Familiarity with ongoing discussions in existential risk research is greatly valued.
* Strong conceptual and analytic skills.
* You have proven affinity with technology and the philosophy of technology.
* You have acquaintance with intercultural philosophy approaches.
* Relative to experience, you have excellent research skills and excellent academic writing and presentation skills.
* You can work both independently and as part of a team.
* You have a high level of proficiency in English


Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.


Conditions of employment


Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.



Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, increasing from € 2770 per month in the first year to € 3539 in the fourth year. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills.

This service provides information for new international employees to help you prepare the relocation and to settle in the Netherlands. title: Quantitative Engineer - AMD Public MAS Strats - Analyst - The Hague
description:
Quantitative Engineer - AMD Public MAS Strats - Analyst - The Hague**Job Description**
  

  

**Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management:**
  

  

As one of the world's leading asset managers, our mission is to help our clients achieve their investment goals. To best serve our clients' diverse and evolving needs, we have built our business to be global, broad and deep across asset classes, geographies and solutions.
  

  

Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management is one of the world's leading asset management institutions. AWM delivers innovative investment solutions managing close to Two Trillion US Dollars on a global, multi-product platform. In addition to traditional products (e.g. Equities, Fixed Income) our product offering also includes Hedge Funds, Private Equity, Fund of Funds, Quantitative Strategies, Fundamental Equity and a Multi-Asset Pension Solutions Business. Software is engineered in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, adapting to market and customer needs to deliver robust solutions in an ever-changing business environment.
  

  

**What We Do**
  

  

Multi-Asset Solutions, "MAS" is an investing group within the Asset Management Division at Goldman Sachs. MAS is responsible for managing customized multi-asset class portfolios and funds, including discretionary mandates for US and international public pension plans, sovereign wealth funds and insurance companies and providing outsourced CIO services. The team is comprised of professionals with deep and varied investment backgrounds who specialize in designing and implementing customized multi-asset class portfolios.
  

  

Our Engineering and Strategist teams are responsible for building portfolio management and asset allocation tools to help our portfolio managers and clients make critical investment decisions for multi-billion dollar portfolios. We also build quantitative models that underpin our investment philosophy and process.
  

  

**Who We Look For**
  

  

We are looking for quantitative engineers to join our Strats team to help with core initiatives to deliver our next-generation digital experience to internal and external users using open source tools and frameworks. Our goal is to build scalable, extensible tools that have immediate impact on a growing user base and will serve our needs in the long term to outperform our competitors. We are a fun, entrepreneurial team that loves coding, investing, and turning our ideas into reality. We are looking for creative, self-driven developers who want to grow and learn from others in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate has a strong mix of software engineering and quantitative backgrounds. You have a track record with JavaScript front and back-end frameworks or Python. You enjoy working with end users to understand the problem at hand and help design the solution, and are excited to learn about investment finance and portfolio management concepts. You will engineer software across all phases of the software development life cycle: partnering with MAS investing professionals to design new features, building those features, creating, and running tests, receiving feedback, and delivering enhancements.
  

  

**Requirements**
  

* Bachelors, Masters or equivalent experience in computer science, mathematics or engineering
* Meaningful experience in, but not limited to, any of the following: Javascript frameworks (React/Angular/Node), MongoDB/NoSQL, SQL, Python
* Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and object oriented programming
* Strong communication skills, ability to work on a fast-paced team and collaborate with stakeholders and end users
* Knowledge of or interest in learning investment finance, portfolio theory and analytics (portfolio optimization, simulation or glidepath)
* 1-2+ years of relevant work experience

  

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
  

  

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.
  

  

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.
  

  

We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html
  

  

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.
  

  

Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: IT Area Lead - WB Tech, Cross Product Services
description:
IT Area Lead - WB Tech, Cross Product Services
If you want to work at a place where you will make an impact on developing ING Wholesale Banking strategic service offerings, where we endorse a proper engineering culture, and where we believe that the sky is the limit to where we can be in the future, please read on.
  

  

**Our people make all the difference to our success!**
  

  

**ING is looking for** an experienced IT Area Lead (ITAL) to strengthen its Digitalization and Workflow Management organization.
  

  

In this exciting role, you will work at a place where you will make a lasting impact by driving digitalization and innovation, streamlining processes, and elevating our Pega System implementation across ING Wholesale Banking. As the IT Area Lead, you'll be the driving force behind our Pega initiatives, collaborating with cross-functional teams, guiding development efforts, and ensuring seamless integration of Pega applications. Your leadership will shape the future of our digital landscape and WB strategy on Digitalization.
  

  

**The team**
  

  

In this role, the IT Area Lead will be responsible for managing PEGA FlowForce for Wholesale Banking users across 40+ locations including several SaaS solutions for Wholesale Banking KYC.
  

  

This is a challenging area due to the high degree of complexity, delivering excellent PEGA capabilities and engineering squads to all WB Tribes. The engineering community is set up centrally with you while the business side is decentral, delivering POs/CJEs for the squads. The squads deliver a wide range of business deliverables from end-to-end 'Digital Journeys' which are directly exposed to our clients, operations workflows and regulatory journeys, including KYC.
  

  

**Your Key Responsibilities**
  

* You will be overseeing an area of around 110 people globally (Netherlands, Manila and India), with 8 Chapter Leads reporting directly to you - you will be managing the manager of engineers. This a growing area so the number of engineers is expected to grow further.
* Provide technical leadership, and growing craftsmanship on the part of IT Chapters in your area with an emphasis on:
	+ Agile customer-centric software development
	+ Analytics and metrics of customer and systems' behavior
	+ People-oriented management and growth of Chapter leads and engineers
	+ IT automation & Continuous Improvement
* Engage and develop ING and external staff, steering on craftmanship to maintain a highly skilled and motivated workforce.
* Work with Product leads, other IT Area Leads, business users and external partners to ensure the feasibility of Product Roadmaps in line with the Bank's strategy and KPIs.
* Ensure predictable delivery of our software by Squads in your area, adhering to our promises concerning quality, allocation of resources, timelines, and features.
* IT Custodianship of our applications with an effective practice to keep IT Risk within Risk Appetite.
* Manage budgets - software expenses, work packages, people and service costs.
* Ensure reliable operation of our IT assets where KPIs including availability and other Service Level Objectives are met.
* Define and execute the WB Tech strategy (Nexus program) for PEGA FlowForce.
* Collaborate closely with our ING Hubs across the globe and our SSI partners in India

  

**Your Profile (Desired Skills & Experience)**
  

* Master of Science in Computer Science or an equivalent field.
* Experienced IT leader with 5+ years of experience in an IT management role.
* PEGA background is a plus
* You have a strong hand at architecture with knowledge of workflow orchestrations and digital journeys
* You are genuinely interested in and understand the Wholesale Banking business and how our customers use our products. You stay up-to-day on how the business and demands change and can think together with our business colleagues about how best to evolve our proposition.
* Vendor management both for software and consulting services is important
* Senior Stakeholder management skills are critical for success
* While not mandatory, knowledge of banking is a big nice-to-have
* You are passionate about growing and developing technical people
* You possess excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills
* You love technology and naturally stay up to date on relevant new developments
* You value a multi-cultured environment where English is the working language, and you easily get on with people from different cultural backgrounds.
* You enjoy to collaborate with architects and engineers to design and implement solutions.

  

**Your benefits**  

  

A job from 36 to 40 hours and a unique offer that fits in with the times of today. We take into account your home situation and your ambitions and help you to balance work and private life. Discover yourself our employment conditions.
  

  

To give you an idea, we will tell you about the benefits of working at ING:
  

* A job from 36 to 40 hours that fits your schedule to balance work and private life
* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* Travel reimbursement
* 24 vacation days with 36-hour work week (or 27 days with 40)
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
* Work Agile, so new ideas come to life faster

  

**About us**
  

With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

title: Change Manager Tech DBNL
description:
Change Manager Tech DBNL
ING is one of the most innovative banks in the world. We are empowering people to stay a step ahead in life and in business and encourage you to 'do your thing'. We are a global company with an agile way of working. Our technological platform is at the heart of ING's strategy, providing rapidly capabilities that enable our business to provide scalable business applications while safeguarding our security and operational resilience. With technology changing in a fast pace, we as Domestic Bank Netherlands are the enabler for Tech NL.
  

  

The change manager is one of the crucial roles in the Domestic Bank Netherlands and plays a key role in ensuring that changes are managed compliant with the global and local standards and guidelines.
  

  

In the Global Job Profile, the roles mentioned as Process Experts which cover the summary job description as: "designs and supports achieving the organization's vision by improving efficiency and effectiveness, quality and time, and customer and employee satisfaction of ING's end-to-end processes to enable the delivery of easy and uniform processes across the organization that are compliant".
  

  

This role participates in:
  

* the change management board of Tech/DBNL
* the Global Change Management Guild
* the Cross Domain Control Board
* the walkthroughs with the First Line Risk team
* audits such as CAS, KPMG, or ECB

  

In a nutshell, this role is the go-to-person for topics related to Change Management.
  

  

If you are excited about the role, then please apply for this position.
  

  

**Roles and Responsibilities:**
  

  

Do you feel attracted by the type of roles mentioned above? Then read on!
  

  

As change manager, together with the existing 5 DBNL Change managers, you will be one of the spokespersons for the change management and the point of contact for (senior) management. This will be approximately 60% of your time as Change manager. You will align with (senior IT) management (CLs, IT(A)Ls, and CIO) and might regularly participate in the management meetings, but also go into discussions with Domain engineers related to the change management request. We do get our hands dirty, meaning we are not dictating to squads what to do, but we try to understand them and enable them by putting in the effort to solve the challenges the squads run into. When the squads experience issues they cannot solve themselves and it impacts progress on the initiatives that you drive, they might come to you for help. You do not always have to solve it yourself, but you will take it on and make it happen, you will involve the right people and make sure the issue is solved.
  

  

Next to that, for 40% of your time, you will be working for the Area Mortgages NL focusing on quality improvement and supporting the Mortgages Tribe to get to a higher level. These can be topics like improving the approach to ITSM (IT Service Management) processes, providing insights and guiding major improvements and migrations, or other quality oriented topics.
  

  

**How to Succeed**
  

* An all-round self-starting change professional with experience in driving and delivering complex change initiatives
* High resilience, the ability to deal with ambiguity and a focus on collaboration
* Proactive, a can-do mentality, a positive mind-set and organisational sensitivity
* Ability to coach colleagues on-the-job
* Excellent level of English & communication skills
* Analytic mindset
* You have a passion for Continuously Improving (always looking for how to improve our way of working and processes)
* High quality standards

  

This position covers two parts (responsibilities). Please kindly find the roles and responsibilities.
  

  

**(Operational) Change Management** for the **Products** /Investments/Consumer Loans and Insurance domains and for **Core Bank&Advisory** /Mortgages NL/Business Lending and Real Estate Finance domains
  

* Helping squads to manage their changes to be compliant with the global and local standards and guidelines
* Checking quality of the changes
* Educating engineers/squads regarding the Change Management process
* Reporting to MT on Change Quality and Process
* Participating in the DBNL Change Control Board (
* Participating in the DBNL Cross Domain Control Board
* Participating in (preparation of) Walkthroughs
* Participating in internal (e.g. CAS) and external (e.g. ECB) audits

  

**Process expert role** at Core Bank&Advisory/Mortgages NL
  

* Advising management on ITSM process issues and improvements
* Primary contact point to all ITSM related support
* Participating in ITSM process task forces with the aim to improve the quality and reliability of our services
* Guiding Major Improvement and Migrations within the Tribe Mortgages
* Continuous Improvement

  

If you have experience in a change management role and the role definition matches your ambitions, Then please apply!
  

  

You report to Mortgages NL IT Area Lead
  

  

**Further details**
  

* Start date August 22, 2024
* Location is Amsterdam, a.o. ING Haarlerbergpark. You will be able to do much of your work from home.
* No need to write a lengthy application letter. Though it is allowed of course and might help to get our conversation-starting, it is also OK if you apply simply by submitting your CV.
* If you have questions or just want to have a short chat or talk about this position, please contact the hiring manager at mark.nijssen-gerichhausen@ing.com

We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm

title: Senior Front Office Quantitative Developer
description:
Senior Front Office Quantitative Developer**Financial Markets**  

  

ING Financial Markets (FM) is the Bank's gateway to the professional markets of the world. Our primary function is to service the needs of ING's clients with products, services and advice. FM aims to be a leading market player in our home markets, with an additional presence in all the major international markets and specialist expertise in selected emerging markets and products.
  

  

**Your new team**  

  

The FM Quant team is a global team within the FM organization that provides quantitative expertise required to price and risk manage derivatives products. The main tasks of the team are in the area of model analytics and development.
  

  

The team based in Amsterdam consists of about 20 professionals that develop pricing and risk models that are used globally by different trading locations and risk departments, with a special emphasis on xVA, (counterparty credit) and market risk models. We are closely interacting with IT DevOps engineers In integrating to libraries into Front and Back-Office systems.
  

  

**Responsibilities**  

* Act as a specialist within the FM Quantitative Analytics team regarding development and implementation of pricing and risk models and applications following principles of good software design and parallel computing.
* Closely collaborate with the IT model integration team following the SCRUM methodology for software development.
* Co-operate with business users such as trading desks and risk departments.
* Maintain tools, programming libraries and test environments that are set up to support the model development and integration cycle including new product development.
* Perform quantitative analysis on market data, trade requests and pricing & risk functionality to support the business.

  

**How to succeed**
  

  

We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we'll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  

  

We are looking for enthusiastic quantitative developers with excellent analytical and programming skills. You have a keen interest in quantitative finance and risk modelling.
  

  

Furthermore, you have:
  

* A university degree (MSc or PhD) in a quantitative field (computer science, mathematics, physics or engineering)
* 5-7 years of relevant experience in building, preferably pricing and risk libraries for trading and/or risk purposes with preferably specific knowledge of xVA
* Strong knowledge of object oriented programming (preferably in C++) including design patterns, parallel programming (e.g. MPI or CUDA), design of efficient numerical applications, API design and software development based on (automated) regression and unit tests
* Excellent knowledge of financial instruments and the financial markets, including risk and pricing models

  

**Rewards & benefits**  

  

We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions here.
  

  

The benefits of working with us at ING include:
  

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 36 or 40 hour workweek
* Individual leave: 24+2 individual holiday days based on 36 hr workweek
* Diversity leave: 3 days per year (1,5 paid, 1,5 unpaid)
* CSR days: up to 2 days per year to actively engage in society by volunteering
* 13th month salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* Mobility card
* Attractive pension scheme
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation

  

**Want to apply directly?**  

  

Upload your **CV and motivation letter** by clicking the "Apply" button.
  

  

Please note, multiple interview steps involving various business stakeholders will be part of the selection process.
  

  

**About us**
  

  

With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? title: Customer Journey Expert - Assisted Channels NL
description:
Customer Journey Expert - Assisted Channels NL
Working in the Assisted Channels NL area within our tribe means working in in a dynamic environment. With thousands of employees using our services every day, we are responsible for stable, secure, user-friendly and innovative tooling in all assisted channels including call- and chatbots. We ensure that our customers and employees always have the best experience supported by one generic global assisted channels toolkit. Therefore, we work closely together with the Global Assisted Platform (As global provider of the assisted toolkit), our Belgian Assisted Channels colleagues (for CRM), and Global Analytics (for our current chatbot and GenAI), and many other Tribes that contribute to the assisted channels for NL users. And of course with all employee user groups, from branches and ISPs to the advisors and relationship managers serving our different product and segment needs. The purpose of our area is: "We are passionate about our employees so they can delight our customers.". From UX designer to IT engineer, we all work towards the same goal.
  

  

Iris is the global platform for all advisory, contact centers and back-offices employees to handle every customer demand with ease. Iris should provide an seamless and reliable experience supporting our employees in their daily work interacting with customers. And while the core of Iris is run by our Global Assisted Platform Area, The Iris NL Product team is responsible for:
  

  

the local implementation of Iris in NL incl support to other tribes and NL user groups the development and improvement of specific NL-owned Iris features such as the NL Product Overview and Product Details tiles in IRIS as well as Financial Overview a.k.a. Plan Ahead, our omnichannel tooling to provide overviews and insights on how a household is doing financially, now and in the future the CRM roadmap for ING NL, where the aim is to integrate the required CRM capabilities in IRIS (currently partially in Salesforce) in order to offer a better user experience (no more 2 applications with data sync issues).
  

  

We are looking for a CJE with broad affinity with Assisted Channels in NL, its users and their end-2-end journeys. But a special interest in CRM journeys across the different user groups and how these translate to (future) needs for the development of the new CRM capabilities.
  

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
  

  

These elements will surely be part of your work:
  

* Understanding both the user group journeys and needs in the context of CRM as well as a thorough understanding of CRM capabilities (e.g. Lead management, Reporting, 360 view, etc.), processes and how these should work together
* Creating the requirements for the solution to be developed, based on your thorough understanding of business needs and technical possibilities
* Proactively collaborating with other squads - mainly outside our area - to ensure timely deliveries of high-quality CRM features
* Maintain good relations with stakeholders within and outside our tribe

  

**Do you recognize yourself in this profile?**  

  

  

* You're passionate about providing employees the highest standard of tooling we can offer
* You have strong affinity with the value and complexity of CRM capabilities
* You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals.
* You love to challenge the status quo and propose creative solutions.
* You are always a step ahead leveraging strong planning and analytical thinking skills
* You have strong experience delivering end to end customer journeys based on PACE methodology into specific patterns, requirements and user stories
* You have strong agile delivery skills
* You have strong experience working in a bus-dev-ops environment: you are able to work together with colleagues with different IT skills to translate requirements into proposed solution design and make sure IT-development can be properly done
* You strive to bring improvement everyday: whether it is in (y)our journeys or in (y)our own way of working. In doing so, you show strong self-reflection and follow-up
* You are analytical and driven by data rather than gut feeling
* Master's or bachelor's degree with relevant experience
* You are fluent in English

We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm

title: Product Manager ING Analytics
description:
Product Manager ING Analytics
As Product Manager you will originate and build data-driven algorithmic ESG/sustainability products. This is an entrepreneurial and global role in an innovative international team.
  

  

**The team**
  

  

Wholesale Banking Analytics (WBA) has the purpose to build data-driven products that benefit ING's clients and the bank. With a team of about 60 engineers, data scientists, UXers and product managers we build solutions that make the wholesale bank more data driven.
  

  

**Role & Responsibilities**
  

* Product discovery: identify (data) problems, prioritize idea backlog and design and execute experiments to determine what problems need solving
* Work with a squad of Data Scientists, UXers, and Engineers to discover the potential of a product idea, the user problem (user research) and validate and prototype
* Manage data-driven products so that they generate significant value for ING and its customers
* Create value propositions, vision and product strategy
* Good understanding of innovation and product management methodologies such as Lean, Agile and Design Thinking
* Ability to develop structured product concepts from abstract ideas and lead prototyping
* Demonstrate thought leadership internally and externally
* Understanding and enthusiasm for technology, advanced analytics and data science methods

  

**What could your day look like?**  

  

Any given day will be different, but one of them might look like this: Start off the day with the daily standup with your product squad. Afterwards you work with them planning and defining the upcoming experiments. The next meeting is with UX, who wants to run through his latest research results with you. This will be important input for you to prioritize the backlog for upcoming sprint.
  

  

You go for lunch with the hot AI Fintech that is using voice data to predict trading behavior, who you spotted coming out of a Startup Accelerator. Then, you run a workshop with a team that has been thinking about an AI-related idea and help them work it out into a concrete AI challenge. This could be a project for our upcoming experiment week.
  

  

This evening you are presenting at an AI Meetup that attracts the best AI minds in the city... or you call it a day and spend some quality private time to keep a healthy balance between focus, rest and other things.
  

  

**How to succeed**
  

  

We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.
  

* 3 - 5 years of relevant experience
* University degree
* Written and spoken fluency in English

  

**What do we offer?**
  

  

Working at ING Analytics means working in a dynamic and international setting. Individual well-being and development of our employees is important, which is why ING offers excellent courses and programs. You will become a member of the Wholesale Banking Analytics team, a prestigious, no-nonsense, and high-output team.
  

  

**Rewards and benefits**
  

  

We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm
  

  

The benefits of working with us at ING include:
  

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation
