title: FP&A Analyst Financial Planning and Analysis Amsterdam
description:
*We offer an opportunity you simply won’t find anywhere else. In less than four years, Mileway has grown into Europe’s leader in last mile logistics real estate, with a 450-plus team across more than twenty offices in ten countries.*  

We are looking for a proactive and skillful Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) Analyst to join our international team. As a pivotal member reporting directly to the FP&A Manager, you will spearhead crucial financial initiatives, contributing significantly to annual budgeting and monthly liquidity forecasting processes.
You will serve as a linchpin within our Amsterdam-based finance division while extending your influence across multifaceted teams including Treasury, Portfolio Management, Asset Management, IT, C-Suite, and the esteemed Blackstone team. You will be challenged to work towards best-in-class reporting standards, overseeing a portfolio of over 1,800 assets.  


**Working at Mileway**  


We offer an opportunity you simply won’t find anywhere else. Only launched in 2019, Mileway has grown into Europe’s leader in last mile logistics real estate, with a 500-plus team across more than twenty offices in 11 countries. Mileway set out to be a different kind of real estate company from the beginning, like our cloud-based IT infrastructure and our team’s ability to flex across borders, combining the best of local knowledge with the pooled expertise of a pan-European business.  


While we have already achieved a lot – our international, “can do” team, is only just getting started – we want to reshape our industry for the better. Our mission is being the most customer and environment focused last mile real estate company in Europe, creating space for businesses to grow sustainably. To get there, we live our values: Drive, Trust, Grow, Together.  


At Mileway, we believe company growth comes from supporting the growth of our combined capabilities. This is why we have our own inhouse learning & development programme, where personal, professional and business development go hand in hand - helping you carve out your own bespoke career path. We know that the way people work has changed over the last few years. So while your base will be the Amsterdam office, we will give you flexibility to work some of the week from home. We’ll also equip you with the best technology package that helps you keep in touch, wherever you are.  

  

**What you’ll do**  


* Lead monthly liquidity update process including full ownership of the liquidity model and outputs
* Collaborate closely with Treasury counterparts to co-pilot the cash distribution process, delineating quarterly distributable amounts while prognosticating future liquidity trends
* Develop mastery of the Yardi Voyager Advanced Budgeting and Forecasting (ABF) platform, leveraging expertise to orchestrate budget forecasts and meticulously align outcomes with established financial modeling methodologies
* Collaborate cross-functionally including Portfolio Management, Asset Management and FP&A cohorts to curate assumption data sourced from asset managers and finance counterparts, leading to budget / forecast outputs and able to present the budget and explain variances
* Pioneer the development and maintenance of intricate Excel models, fortifying data integrity and facilitating the seamless flow of budget inputs
* Leveraging appropriate technology and systems (Datawarehouse, Yardi, Power BI), to champion the collection, organization, quality and analysis of data
* Oversee the implementation and managing of data-driven processes to optimize decision-making, including data visualization, performance dashboards, and other business intelligence tools
* Provide indispensable support to Manager FP&A and Head of FP&A, diligently preparing financial presentations and undertaking ad hoc projects commissioned by C-Suite and Blackstone
* Lead strategic initiatives related to systems implementation by partnering with IT and senior leadership to drive business growth and commercial value
* Manage internal and external stakeholders such as C-Suite, asset managers, transactions, finance and customers

  

  

**What you will bring**  


* Up to three years’ experience in a relevant area, and preferably with a focus on real estate
* Eye for detail and strong numerical and analytical skills and ability to work with large data sets and preparing meaningful analysis
* A strong academic background in a relevant area, for example in Accounting, Finance or Real Estate studies
* Strong organizational skills, you are able to work on multiple projects at the same time and you don’t miss deadlines
* You are competent with tools such as Excel, PowerQuery, and Tableau/Power BI
* Your ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You’re motivated by short deadlines and can move quickly when timings are tight
* A great team attitude. You are dynamic, highly motivated and friendly. Able to build relationships with people across various cultures and backgrounds
* Your head for data. You have experience in handling large data sets and preparing meaningful analysis, including identifying and extrapolating errors in the data
* You’re a hands-on self-starter who works confidently and independently. You’re not afraid to jump in and get things done. You are happy to flex your responsibilities when you see something that needs done and can effectively manage time and priorities within a fast-moving environment
* Fluent in English, both written and verbal
* You’ll be able to digitize and track new data, and take it all in your stride

  


*Our vision is to be the number one gateway to urban communities. To get there, we live our values: Drive, Trust, Grow, Together.*

title: Data & AI Thesis Internship
description:
**Internship details**

* Period: 4 – 6 months
* Hours a week: 40
* Location: Gustav Mahlerlaan, Amsterdam
* Start date: September '24
**The work**


If you like getting to the core of things, you’ve found the right place. At Marketing – Data & AI, we’re a bunch of bright, optimistic individuals that work together to turn data into digestible insights. From collecting, data engineering and analyzing, to modelling, visualizing and pitching; we do it all. During your thesis internship, you will become a true member of our team, having the chance to tap into the experience of our experts in many fields, and join us on our engagement events.

* **Team** As a Data&AI intern, you'll join our innovative crew focused on leveraging Marketing Technology platforms and strategies to enable the infrastructure that drives relevant brand experiences and campaigns. You will collaborate with our consultants, who strategize, ideate, implement, help to adopt, and bridge the gap between business and tech for our clients.
* **Daily tasks** Defining problem statement: Connect with stakeholders to understand their needs, understanding the correct and complete research question to be addressed. Dive in data collection: Gathering, cleaning, and organizing relevant data from various sources, ensuring data integrity and quality for analysis. Data engineering: Perform data preprocessing tasks such as data cleaning, transformation, and feature engineering to prepare the data for modeling and analysis. Modeling and data analysis: Sharpen your research by applying statistical techniques, machine learning algorithms, or other analytical approaches to uncover patterns, trends, and insights within the data, and iteratively refine models to improve accuracy. Data visualization: Make your insights digestible by creating informative and visually appealing data visualizations, utilizing tools such as Tableau or Google Data Studio, to effectively communicate findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* **Research** As a research intern at the Marketing – Data & AI team, your primary objective will be to explore an effective approach to improve results for lead generation. You’ll have the freedom to dive into what you find to be an effective approach. Our suggestions are towards: Artificial Intelligence for personalization, Customer segmentation, Forecasting techniques, such as propensity modeling, Natural Language Processing, such as sentiment analysis.
* **Interested?** If you are interested, please provide us with a motivational letter where you propose a research topic. You can upload your motivation letter together with your resume in our Workday system.

**Song Talent** **Factory** **(STF)**  

As part of your internship, you will also take part in Song Talent Factory. This program will be leading you through your path at Accenture Song and will provide additional engagements, activities and projects to enhance your intern experience. Being part of the Song Talent Factory, you will:

* Get professional guidance on finding the next step in your career;
* Get expert support on your thesis topic while leveraging all Accenture resources;
* Be part of one Song program where you are required to collaborate with other interns at Accenture Song from our different offerings (Commerce, Design & Digital Product Creation, Marketing and Consumer Services);
* Work on a large internship long consulting project together with your STF group. This will allow you to not just get a glimpse of one of the four capabilities, but you will really get to see everything Accenture Song has to offer;
* Be part of the Accenture Song community through companywide and intern specific engagement events
* Enjoy the wide variety of training opportunities;
  

From building an app for coffee catch-ups to dinners after work, the Song Talent Factory will make your experience at Accenture Song even more enjoyable!

**Who we are**


Accenture Song accelerates growth and value for our clients through sustained customer relevance. Our capabilities span ideation to execution: growth, product, and experience design; technology and experience platforms; creative, media and marketing strategy and campaign, content and channel orchestration. Join us and bring to life bold ideas with the biggest impact through the unlimited potential of creativity, technology, and intelligence. Visit us at: www.accenture.com/song.


Song is one of five services that make up one Accenture – the others are Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, and Industry X.


#LI-EU


  

**Here's what you'll need**

* You are currently enrolled as a bachelor (HBO/WO) or master student in a Dutch educational institution throughout the entire duration of the internship.
* You have affinity with (big) data. Analytics, data science and/or machine learning are key areas that interest you. Experience with Google Analytics, BigQuery, Python or SQL would be a plus. However, don’t hesitate to apply if you’re new to any of these.
* You are naturally curious, eager to learn and willing to learn new tools, techniques, and technologies.
* You’re able to extract meaningful insights from data and communicate them in a digestible manner.
* You have a willingness to deepen or develop skills in presenting and pitching research outcomes.
* The bigger picture is important to you. Context and goals of business processes are important to you as you help align data science with business goals.
* Fluent in Dutch (spoken and written) and comfortable with English (spoken and written).

**What's in it for you?**


Accenture is a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Our people are Change Makers, and to support them as an employer, we make five promises:

* Work with flexibility, in a culture based on trust
* Embrace a sustainable growth mindset
* Live a human-led culture of Inclusion & Diversity by caring deeply for all our people.
* Lead and transform our clients with technology
* Connect with our global network of 700.000 colleagues.


These promises are reflected through our excellent employee benefits, including:

* Career guidance (and academical support) facilitated by your individual appointed People Lead.
* You will receive internship allowance and a laptop
* Social activities like Friday Drinks, sport events and parties
* Unique chance to experience the real-life job of a consultant Accenture from the inside
* Membership of our Internship Community which will give you the chance to attend lunch lectures, classroom workshop and build your network within Accenture
**What we believe**


Accenture is an equal opportunity employer. Our leaders are committed to building a better, stronger and more equitable company for future generations to create positive, long-lasting change. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities.

  

Our position as partner to many of the world’s leading businesses, organizations and governments affords us both an extraordinary opportunity and a tremendous responsibility to make a difference. Sustainability is one of our greatest responsibilities, which we embed it into everything we do and for everyone we work with.
company_description: Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success.

title: Data & AI Strategist - Amsterdam, NL
description:
**Role** - Data & AI Strategist/Data Strategist  

**Location** – Amsterdam, NL  

**Compensation** – Competitive (including bonus)  

  

**Why Infosys Data and AI Strategy Practice:**  

The Data and AI Strategy practice enables business transformation for the survival and excellence in an AI-first world, by framing the opportunities of the future and structuring the pathway for engineering and execution. The data and AI strategist enables CEOs and head of businesses to amplify the power of data through AI.
  

We are a group of modern strategists, who distinguish ourselves by spearheading business transformation driven by these six (6) cores principles:  

* Drive AI First business transformation and industry disruption enabling clients to go from a .com world to a .ai world.
* Enable modern business models, which eliminates boundaries between “business” and “technology”.
* Enable science driven business decision making informed by “best-practices” powered by Data and Mathematics
* Create Dynamic Actionable Measurable near-term business Impact.
* Be a culture carrier and define the strategy aligned to an Empowered Organization that amplifies existing strengths and leverages winning business practices of the past.
* Define all strategies with a common goal of creating a social impact for an improved planet.

  

**Your role:**  

Infosys is seeking a dynamic, strategic, and innovative Data and AI Strategy leader to facilitate the organization’s mission to grow and evolve Infosys’ Data and Analytics business unit.
  

  

The successful candidate will distinguish herself or himself by being a coach to the CEOs of Infosys’ client-base to navigate business transformation using the power of data and AI. S/He will be leading and contributing to strategic master plan and advisory engagements with the client to develop data and AI led initiatives for transformation, S/He can also be involved in the execution and delivery of such engagements in a leadership role. S/He will act as the brand-ambassador for Infosys and represent Infosys’ thought leadership in public forums and media.  

  

**Required:**  

**Business Empathy:**  

* Have had experience in performing and leading business functions and/or units in one of the following industries:


o Healthcare and Life Sciences  

o Telecommunications
  

o Energy, Utilities and Sustainable Ecosystem  

o Financial Services and Insurance  

o Retail and Consumer Packaged Goods  

o Manufacturing and Supply Chain  

* Have a deep Alumni and Industry Network
* Have managed a P&L or owned a balance-sheet in a business unit.
* Have led change management and/or managed mergers and integrations and/or led impactful enterprise initiatives.

  

**Data and AI Savvy:**  

* Programmer
* Experience in Applied Mathematics, including but not limited to Statistical analysis, Machine Learning, Neural Networks, etc
* Experience in modern data engineering technologies including but not limited to cloud-native data estates, data pipelines, data virtualization, data as a product, data privacy, micro-services architecture, access management, data locality.

  

**Storyteller:**  

* Ability to engage CEO and COO of Fortune 500 companies.
* Developed formal business cases and business narrative, and is schooled in techniques such as Value Analysis, Market Research
* Strong presence and excellent communications skills to lead and motivate peers and leaders.

  

**Preferred:**  

* Ability to manage and execute technology projects, preferable using Agile Methodology
* Awareness and Research on the emerging technology differentiators to enable AI such as Quantum Computing, GPUs, Block-Chain Technology (BCT)
* Ability to perform Financial Analysis and create Value propositions for Investments.
* Proficient in Visualization techniques to articulate business cases and Return-On-Investments
* Entrepreneurial experience as a startup co-founder is a big plus.

  

**Leadership:**  

* Leads by example, conveys, and instills integrity, and is capable of inspiring dedicated professional at all levels. Possess a confident, seasoned, engaging and personable style.
* Ability and willingness to roll-up his/her sleeves, drive consistent execution of strategic plans and strategies and, “make it happen” in a fast-moving, lean, and entrepreneurial environment.
* Multi-dimensional thinker who operates not only from important past experiences, but with new approaches and developments that occur in a changing and competitive marketplace.
* Demonstrated success in recruiting, developing, and retaining a top-notch team. Possessing clear skills in forming and developing cohesive teams of strong, diverse individuals.
* Sound business judgment and prudent risk-taking, balanced by an innovative, courageous, entrepreneurial style.
* Proven ability to influence, collaborate, build consensus, and resolve conflict while maintaining an enthusiastic and approachable leadership style.

  

**About Infosys**  

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through the many next of their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.  

  

Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys can help your enterprise navigate your next.  

  

All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence, and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
company_description: Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation.

title: Data & Analytics Director Benelux
description:
**DATA AND ANALYTICS DIRECTOR BENELUX**

 **About L’Oréal**


L'Oréal has been a world leader in the cosmetics business for more than 100 years and has grown into one of the largest FMCG companies in the world. With international brands such as L'Oréal Paris, Garnier, Kérastase, Lancôme, Giorgio Armani and Vichy, we offer relevant products for every consumer.

 ***Who am I?***


As Data & Analytics Director, you lead a team of data specialists and shape the present and future of data-driven decision-making at L'Oréal Bénélux. You are responsible of one of the most strategic & transformative topic in the L’Oreal Group for the Bénélux scope.  

  

 In your role, working hand in hand with the Division’s business (business analysts, business development, CDO…) and IT stakeholders, you will be responsible for defining and implementing the data strategy in line with the global data strategy and governance, overseeing all data-related activities, and fostering a data-driven culture across the company. Working across all functions and all divisions, the Data and Analytics Director plays a key role in carrying the data deliveries and transformation at the Benelux level.  

  

 You report to the CDMO of the Benelux Hub, and you are in close contact with the European Zone head of data.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Strategy & Vision:**
	+ Design and implement L'Oréal's overall data strategy, encompassing data governance (centralization), data quality management, and data architecture following the international frame & rules.
	+ Roll-out data local or international data solution to enhance the performance of the business, increase efficiency and simplicity in domains like supply, commerce, market intelligence (sell-out data) and CDMO topics (like Media, CRM, Advocacy, part of the O+O data domain).
* **Project Leadership & delivery accountability:**
	+ Lead the company's data transformation and simplification project, ensuring its successful implementation and adoption across all divisions. Lead one of the most strategic corporate projects on simplification & rationalization of the analytics eco-system, internal code name “Sunrise”.
	+ Oversee the development, delivery/roll-out and quality of critical dashboards used by various teams, including but not limited to marketing, supply and commercial teams.
	+ Champion data innovation initiatives, identifying and evaluating new technologies and approaches to enhance L'Oréal's data capabilities : data science for marketing, commercial, supply cases…
* **Stakeholder Management & Collaboration:**
	+ Work closely with stakeholders across all divisions and métiers to understand their specific data business needs and translate them into actionable solutions.
	+ Foster strong collaboration with both Zone and Global data teams, ensuring alignment on data strategy, shared insights, and best practice implementation.
* **Team Leadership & Development:**
	+ Lead and inspire a high-performing team of 5 data specialists, including data analysts, a data scientist, a data engineer, and a product manager.
	+ Foster a collaborative and innovative team spirit, providing opportunities for growth and development.
	+ Cultivate a thriving tribe of data enthusiasts across the company, fostering cross-functional collaboration and knowledge sharing.

 ***Our ideal candidate has******:***

* **Technical Expertise:**
	+ Foundations & understanding of big principles at least in data warehousing, ETL processes, data modeling, and visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
	+ Experience with cloud-based data platforms and Big Data technologies is a plus.
	+ Intuition and critical eye on easy-to-read data dashboard is a plus.
* **Leadership & Management:**
	+ Proven ability to lead and manage high-performing data teams, fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation.
	+ Excellent stakeholder management skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex data concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences. This ability to explain complex topics in a simple manner is critical.
	+ Strong communication, organizational skills, crisis management capabilities, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. Given the data delivery high expectations, this agility & crisis management is critical.
* **Strategic Thinking & Business Acumen:**
	+ Strategic thinker with a hands-on mentality, able to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
	+ Deep understanding of business processes and challenges, with the ability to identify opportunities for data-driven solutions.
* **Experience**
	+ 8+ years of work experience and preferably some years in a data-driven role, direct business-related role(s). Business transformation role(s) is a plus. Management role required too.
	+ Mandatory to speak fluent English ; Dutch & French capabilities are a plus.

 **What do we offer?**

* An inspiring work environment with ambitious colleagues, where working Agile is the norm Broad career path possibilities within and outside of the corporate CDMO team, both in The Netherlands and internationally
* A competitive salary and good secondary employment benefits (profit sharing, retirement, healthcare, etc.)
* Discount on our products
* Broad and professional training offerings

  

Finally, a great added value of working at L'Oréal is that you will be working with so many different people and functions. This offers you the opportunity to broaden your knowledge about different stakeholders.

 **Diversity**


L’Oréal would like their personnel to represent the diversity of the Benelux society. We welcome everyone regardless of origin, gender, age, sexual orientation, philosophical or political conviction, disability, etc.

  

“*A diversified workforce in every function and on all levels strengthens our creativity and our understanding of consumers and it enables us to develop and market products that are relevant*“


(Jean-Paul Agon, Chairman of L’Oréal)

 **How to apply**


Are you ready for this challenge and do you meet the conditions?


Then apply quickly!

 **Do you want to know what it's like to work for L'Oréal Benelux?**


Check out our LinkedIn page: https://www.linkedin.com/company/loréal/life/


  
* **You can apply to up to three jobs within a rolling 30-day window.**
* **You cannot withdraw your application once you applied, so please make sure to choose a job that matches your dreams.**
* **Please visit "Your Application Space" to see the jobs you have already applied to.**
* **Please don’t create another account with a different email. If you do so, your account might be merged and your application record will be deleted.**

title: Sales Intelligence Analyst Off Trade NL
description:
Seniority Level: Associate
#Ownership  

Sales Intelligence Analyst Off Trade NL  

As Sales Intelligence Analyst you are responsible for the development of tools, reports and extensive analysis to support the off-trade leadership team to measure their performance, validate their business strategy or adjust where needed to reach company targets. You are an important sparring partner of the Off Trade management team and therefore highly contributing to the business cycle and monthly performance meetings with sales managers. This function reports to Sales Intelligence Manager Off Trade BNFL and implies daily collaboration with National field sales manager (M3).
At AB InBev, dreaming big is what we do. Brewing the world’s most loved beers, building iconic brands like Bud, Stella Artois, Corona and crafting meaningful moments are what inspire us.
We’re a team of passionate owners who aren’t afraid to dream big because we know that together, we can achieve anything. To build a more sustainable, inclusive and rewarding future. Turning any challenge into an opportunity. So let’s take on the challenge together. Cheers to dreaming big!  

The role:* Define actionable recommendations for field sales team based on data analytics and business intelligence (BI) visualization
* Build an accurate and measurable target setting model to steer the field sales team direction
* Implement at country level the BU strategy defined with the Sales intelligence manager during business cycle
* Implement transformation and digitalization initiatives to capture, report, analyse and audit data
* Determine the best sales structure, contact model and field roles & responsibilities


Examples of daily tasks you would perform in the job:* Tracking and monitoring of KPIs evolution at M1, M2 and national level vs. budget: distribution, shelf-share, displays, POCE results and other KPIs (vs targets)
* Target setting for M1s on monthly/quarterly basis: definition, calculation, reporting and close-the-gap plan.
* Managing dotted line GCC (global capabilities center, India) analyst in charge of reports and targets, ensuring accuracy of deliverables (e.g. WPR)
* Creation and management (frequency / accuracy) of sales reports & dashboards to verify if sales teams are acting in line with business objectives and provide recommendations to help sales managers make data-driven decisions via action plans & hitlists.
* Set up and improvement of sales related processes: POC visits, audits, ...
* Project management of initiatives linked to digitalization and transformation to improve our way of working: sellfi online, Sales BI, shelf-recognition, etc together with Sales Intelligence Manager
* Market analysis & identification of commercial opportunities: translation of this these opportunities into target setting for field teams.
* Participate in strategic discussions with national field sales manager (M3) and (your) sales intelligence manager about e.g. sales structure, contact model (what retailers to visit, what not)
* Collaborate with other departments (TM, KAMs, CatMans, Finance, RM, etc.) on diverse projects.
* Best practice sharing with BU Sales Intelligence team with a focus on simplifying, harmonizing and standardizing reports.


Profile:* Strong analytical, communication, presentation and stakeholder management skills
* Knowledge of Dutch and English language is essential
* Result driven, solution oriented and can-do spirit
* Continuous drive for improvements, standardization & automation
* Off Trade (sales) experience is a pro
* MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint), Qlik sense, Nielsen, Power BI, Sellfi, Salesforce

  

Next to our competitive base salary, we put our people first by providing on-top benefits:* Competitive Bonus
* Customized CAO a la carte options like bike, transportation, Fitness, travel & personal development
* Compensation & additional holidays (44 Days total)
* A unique birth & pregnancy leave set up
* Option to sign in on an ANW-hiaat insurance (specific for NL market)
* Great pension arrangements
* End of year bonus (13th month)
Learning & Development opportunities (LinkedIn Learning/ Workday Learning/Mentoring)  
* 

  

What you can expect from us:
In this role, you’ll have the potential to transform our business and your career. You’ll get the support and mentor you need to succeed. We’re a meritocracy, with plenty of room for growth and development, so you know your hard work will be rewarded. We encourage you to think big and go after your goals. You’ll get to be creative, work with international teams so you can build a global network and have direct control over your career and where it takes you.
We are building a team that’s more supportive, more inclusive and more collaborative. A team that’s diverse in background, skills and experience.
So if you dream big but are concerned you’re not a perfect fit against the job description, we’d still encourage you to apply. You may just the right candidate to help us create a future with more cheers.
As the leading global brewer, we are committed to bringing people together for a better – and more equal – world. A more equal world starts when everyone can thrive. At AB InBev we value the diversity of cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce, and we strongly encourage women, people of colour, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.
#LI-ABI ZoneEUR

title: Applicatiespecialist BI / Datawarehouse
Data Analyst III
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Office**Job Description**

**About us**
============


In our part of Thermo Fisher Scientific we provide innovative solutions for electron microscopy in scientific and industrial lab environments. With these solutions Thermo Fisher Scientific aims to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.


We are looking for a new member of the global Digital Transformation team based in France, Czech Republic, the Netherlands and the USA. We strive to bring digital technology into our products, solutions and services, enabling connectivity, data extraction and data analysis in order to change the way how we do business and to help science progress through the data!


Are you curious about the potential of data and information to transform how we innovate and make scientific discoveries?

**Responsibilities**
====================


You will develop insights into how our products and services are helping our customers achieve their goals in cooperation with fellow analysts, engineers, product managers and product owners.

### **Typical tasks:**

* Develop analytics (models, metrics, algorithms), prepare data pipelines and model deployments (both for statistical analysis and machine learning) while helping to scale the data infrastructure.
* Help teams identify data analytics and assist in defining intuitive visualizations and prepare, evaluate, extract and qualify data for analysis.
* Communicate on plans and outcomes and document to provide context and understanding of the results.

**Who do we look for**
======================

* A degree in Engineering, Master, PhD in science, mathematics or related subject is required.
* Two years or more of experience in data analytics, data science, and/or statistics.
* The ability to quickly understand a variety of topics and recognize areas where data can provide business value, while bringing a curiosity and self-starter mentality.
* Skills in communication (English), cooperation and critical thinking will help you succeed in your role.
* The ideal candidate enjoys working in a multi-cultural, collaborative high-tech environment

### **Experiences in the following tools are considered a plus:**

* Deep learning frameworks and model platforms: Keras, Tensorflow, Pytorch, Hugging Face.
* Dashboarding visualization: Grafana, PowerBI, Superset.
* Experience in programming languages and tools (e.g. Python, Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, SQL, Plotly, Git, Jira).

**Your benefits**
=================

* Opportunity to join Thermo Fisher Scientific – world leader in serving science, company culture which stands for integrity, intensity, involvement, and innovation.
* Being part of technological breakthroughs of the future.
* Annual bonus.
* Company stocks program.


Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

**Accessibility/Disability Access**
-----------------------------------


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
**About HousingAnywhere**



HousingAnywhere is Europe's largest mid-term rental platform. With Kamernet and Studapart under its umbrella, it represents three fast-growing brands with over 30 million yearly unique visitors combined, 160,000+ properties available for rent and 100,000+ tenants securing their new homes, based on the 2022 performance. HousingAnywhere serves young professionals and students, primarily aged between 18 and 35, connecting them with accommodation providers. Through its advanced technology platform, tenants rent accommodation for 3 to 12 months outside of their country of origin. Headquartered in Rotterdam, HousingAnywhere operates in most European cities and recently expanded to key cities in the US, establishing a presence in over 125 cities. Driven by the mission to enable people to live wherever and however they choose, thanks to a flexible renting experience, the technology scale-up employs 340 professionals globally.

  


**Our mission**



Rent Easy, Live Free.



We are empowering people to live wherever and however they choose. To find comfort and peace of mind on the other side of the world or the other side of town. All while feeling confident and totally at ease, whatever their adventure might involve. We are doing it by creating a new standard of renting. Safe. Harmonious. More options. Less hassle. With the help of our trusted networks of landlords and partners.

  


**Our** **Values**


* Ownership
* We are Enablers
* We are Changemakers
* We are Connectors

  


**The team**



This role will be part of the Analytics Engineering team, which is part of the Data Science & Engineering organisation. This organisation also consists of Data Engineering and Data Science teams. The Analytics Engineering team has the mandate to democratise access to insights by building Data Models in our Enterprise Data Warehouse.

  


**Our Stack**



At HousingAnywhere, our data warehouse is powered by Snowflake. Our data pipelines are built using Stitch and dbt cloud and Airflow. We use Rudderstack as our preferred CDP. We use Tableau as our Visualization tool and Mixpanel for Product Analytics.

  


**Your role & Impact**



Analytics Engineers are responsible for translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


* Partner with our business stakeholders, BI analysts and other engineering team members to collect data needs - and translate this into functioning pipelines and data models
* Build, and maintain efficient & reliable data models and pipelines for both external and internal data in partnership with data engineering
* Perform root cause analysis in case of issues in data production processes
* Ensure our colleagues are able to optimally use the data models via documentation, training, and monitoring of best practices

  


**Your profile**


* At least 5 years of experience in building data marts/data models and performing adhoc analysis on large datasets
* At least 2 years of working experience working with dbt
* Strong knowledge in SQL, Data Modelling
* Good business modelling skills to transform stakeholders requirements into an actual data model.
* Software engineering experience in a programming language, preferably in Python.
* Experience using code repositories is highly desirable.
* Experience using a data visualisation tool is a plus.

  


**What's in it for you**


* Diverse international community (46+ nationalities).
* Hybrid working policy.
* Unlimited paid holidays, minimum-based not maximum.
* 1,000 EUR personal development budget.
* Complete coverage for commuting.
* Personal equipment, including laptop and ergonomic setup.
* 30% ruling application assistance.
* Gym membership discount with GoVital or OneFit.
* Variable pension scheme.
* Dutch/English classes budget.
* Fun team-building and after-work drinks every Friday.

  


*If you have further questions, please email* *y.kaboorappan@housinganywhere.com*


*By applying to work at HousingAnywhere, you agree to our* *Candidate Privacy Policy*
company_description: We have the mission to help with housing, anywhere. We want to build a safe, efficient and global rental marketplace for anyone looking for or renting out a place. We Care. We Perform. We Evolve.

title: Marketing Data Trainee
description:
Position Summary
Are you a recent graduate looking to kickstart your career in Marketing and Data? Do you have a passion for technology and innovation? Samsung is seeking ambitious, commercial-minded, and collaborative individuals to join our dynamic organization.  

  

About the Traineeship:  

Our 3-year Traineeship is designed to equip you with the skills and experience necessary to excel in the competitive world of Marketing and Data. Working for a major international global player like Samsung offers you, as a trainee, huge opportunities for hands-on experience. During this program, each year you will have the opportunity to make a difference and learn from the best in different key positions at Samsung that match your area of expertise. Besides hands-on experience, you also get the opportunity to personally develop yourself during our various learning tracks imbedded in the trainee program together with your fellow trainees.  

  

Don't limit your talents! Give them the freedom to grow with us. So what are you waiting for? #DoWhatYouCant and become our next Samsung trainee.
Role and Responsibilities
Representing the brand, you radiate confidence and professionalism in an inspiring way. In this way, you actively contribute to the further growth of Samsung.
This means that you are responsible for the following:
Consumer Market Insight* Insight generation by “connecting the dots” across various data sources to create comprehensive consumer insight.
* Tracking brand equity and attributes, campaign effectiveness test, and marketing performance
* Consumer (survey) research to uncover the “why” behind consumer behavior


Marketing Data Analysis* Generate and deliver comprehensive and actionable insights
* Creating overview & recommending improvements across various marketing channels: web, digital/social media, CRM, PR/Influencer, and e-commerce data.
* Data visualization and data-driven storytelling for marketing and e-commerce strategy development


Data-driven Personalization through CRM, Digital Media and Web Analytics* Loyalty insight such as performance on acquisition, retention and churn using various data sources and tools.
* Advise optimizing the customer journey on Samsung.com using Adobe Analytics and GA4 data
* Manage, analyze and report A/B tests to optimize the customer journey
* Connects the dots between .com analytics, Ads platforms and CRM data
* Ensure tag implementation allows for correct dataflow and GDPR/Privacy requirements


Stakeholder Engagement to make insights actionable* Stakeholder engagement to have insights actionable using various communication and engagement channels
* Tracking the impact of insights based on the Insight tracking framework


Responsibility Expansion: As you develop and demonstrate your capabilities during the traineeship, your responsibilities will increase accordingly, providing you with more opportunities to take on greater challenges and responsibilities.
This traineeship position is part of our specialized Marketing Data Analytics Track. Meaning that within the three-year traineeship program you will develop yourself on the following topics to become a well-rounded Marketing & Data professional:* Year 1: Consumer Market Insight (CM – D&A)
* Year 2: MI/BI Data Analysis (Sales Division)
* Year 3: Marketing Data Analysis (CM - D&A) for Web, CRM, Digital Media, and MarTech


Skills and Qualifications* You hold a master's degree, preferably in Marketing, Strategy, Business Administration, Econometrics, Economics (Business economics), statistics, or a related field
* Knowledge of Statistics or Econometrics
* You are enterprising, ambitious, like to take initiative and you stand firm in your shoes
* You are innovative (we move fast and take big risks)
* You are passionate (we reveal in what we do)
* You are collaborative (we recognize that we are all in this together)
* Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions.
* You are communicative, customer-oriented, and proactive.


What do we offer?* A competitive salary: As a trainee, you deserve a good start and a good salary which is yearly reviewed.
* Time for a bonus: Have you really done well? Then we can reward you with a quarterly bonus.
* Let's get healthy: With our wellbeing programs, initiatives and office gym, you are well on your way to a healthy lifestyle.
* Health Insurance & Pension: You can participate in our well-regulated collective health insurance and pension scheme.
* Develop your talents: Work on all your talents with our dedicated and tailored training program.
* Events & Extras: Get discounts on our Samsung Employee Webshop and get ready for epic events throughout the year.

  

How to Apply
Ready to take the next step in your career with Samsung? Apply now by submitting your resume explaining why you’re the perfect fit for our Traineeship kick starting per September 1st.

title: Advanced Analytics Trainee
description:
Position Summary
Are you a recent graduate looking to kickstart your career in sales, marketing or data? Do you have a passion for technology and innovation? Samsung is seeking ambitious, commercial-minded, and collaborative individuals to join our dynamic organization.  

  

About the Traineeship:  

Our 3-year Traineeship is designed to equip you with the skills and experience necessary to excel in the competitive world of sales, marketing or data. Working for a major international global player like Samsung offers you, as a trainee, huge opportunities for hands-on experience. During this program, each year you will have the opportunity to make a difference and learn from the best in different key positions at Samsung that match your area of expertise. Besides hands-on experience, you also get the opportunity to personally develop yourself during our various learning tracks imbedded in the trainee program together with your fellow trainees.  

  

Don't limit your talents! Give them the freedom to grow with us. So what are you waiting for? #DoWhatYouCant and become our next Samsung trainee.
Role and Responsibilities
Representing the brand, you radiate confidence and professionalism in an inspiring way. In this way, you actively contribute to the further growth of Samsung.
This means that you are responsible for the following:
Data Engineering* Collect and connect data from different sources according to business needs, use cases, potential exploitation and deployment, and technology possibilities: GCP, Azure, and on-premise servers
* Model raw data into clean, tested, and reusable datasets, make it easier for business analysts and other stakeholders to view and understand data in DB
* Apply various transformations (ETL, ELT) to different data pieces to ensure they correspond to given tasks


Data Science and Machine Learning* Develop data science and machine learning models with the goal of improving revenue from marketing campaigns
* Identify key customer segmentation and support the personalization of marketing communication for precision audience targeting
* Support pricing strategy and manage pricing models


BI dashboard development* Support simulation and data visualization projects
* Convert data into a suitable graphic format including - dashboards, graphs, charts, and reports using BI tools
* Support automated/self-serving data visualization projects by building the foundation layer for dashboard reporting.


Stakeholder engagement to make insights actionable* Map requirements and projects from stakeholders, including business divisions and Marketing Channels, and Marketing Strategy teams.
* Evangelize the data-driven decision-making to the stakeholders while communicating in a plain and intuitive language so that stakeholders easily follow even the sophisticated and technical concepts.
* Establish collaboration with European and global teams working on projects as mentioned above.


Responsibility Expansion: As you develop and demonstrate your capabilities during the traineeship, your responsibilities will increase accordingly, providing you with more opportunities to take on greater challenges and responsibilities.
This traineeship position is part of our specialized Advanced Analytics Track. Meaning that within the three-year traineeship program you will develop yourself on the following topics to become well-rounded analytics professional:* Year 1: Data Engineering (CM – D&A)
* Year 2: Data Science (CM – D&A)
* Year 3: BI development (CM - D&A)


Skills and Qualifications
Are you the one we are looking for?* You hold a master's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics (Business economics), Quantitative Marketing, Business Informatics, or a related field
* Knowledge and skills in data engineering, API and cloud computing (GCP, Azure and Databricks)
* Knowledge and skills in SQL/Big Query and Python for data processing and data mining (modelling)
* Knowledge and skills in statistical modelling: Machine Learning and Data Science
* You are enterprising, ambitious, like to take initiative and you stand firm in your shoes
* You are innovative (we move fast and take big risks)
* You are passionate (we reveal in what we do)
* You are collaborative (we recognize that we are all in this together)
* Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions.
* You are communicative, customer-oriented, and proactive.


What do we offer?* A competitive salary: As a trainee, you deserve a good start and a good salary which is yearly reviewed.
* Time for a bonus: Have you really done well? Then we can reward you with a quarterly bonus.
* Let's get healthy: With our wellbeing programs, initiatives and office gym, you are well on your way to a healthy lifestyle.
* Health Insurance & Pension: You can participate in our well-regulated collective health insurance and pension scheme.
* Develop your talents: Work on all your talents with our dedicated and tailored training program.
* Events & Extras: Get discounts on our Samsung Employee Webshop and get ready for epic events throughout the year.

  

How to Apply
Ready to take the next step in your career with Samsung? Apply now by submitting your resume explaining why you’re the perfect fit for our Traineeship kick starting per September 1st.

title: Project Financial Controller
description:
**Job ID:** 248300


**Date posted:** 09/07/2024


**Who you are**  

  

Do you want to be part of Financial Controlling within IKEA NL Retail? We are looking for a Financial Controller for projects!  

  

Your background:
  

* Have a bachelor/master degree in Accounting & Control, Business Administration, Finance or a related field with 1-4 years work experience within Accounting/Controlling/Business Navigation.
* Have knowledge of Dutch GAAP, statutory and regulatory reporting and knowledge to provide support in an auditing process.
* Have knowledge of financial and operational processes (the interdependencies and how to manage them) and tools for accounting and reporting.
* Have knowledge of measuring, processing and communicating financial information in compliance with internal and external regulations and ensuring value for money in reaching business objectives and profitable growth.
* Are experienced with applying new organizational policies and procedures to assess, mitigate, ensure appropriate internal controls and communicate risks to the organization.
* Show good knowledge of project management processes including methods and tools; and how to integrate them in everyday work.
* Show good understanding of data science, analytics, data visualization tools and new technologies to secure a predictive and value-adding finance and accounting function.
* Are motivated to work agile, open to the change and apply learning to perform successfully under new or first time conditions
* Are able to create and implement change initiatives and energized to manage stakeholders to achieve goals in a changing environment
* Are able to communicate confidently and clearly in English & Dutch
* Pre but not a must: knowledge of SAP Ariba Guided Buying

  

**Your responsibilities**  

  

We are looking for a Financial Controller that will be the driver for financial insights in different projects in the country, including construction projects, Digital projects, Transformation projects and Country initiatives. You like to interact with people and want to take the lead. You take initiative and pro-actively engage with project managers. With your insights, you will help project managers, portfolio owners and the management team to keep control over costs which is crucial for steering our business. As a Financial Controller for projects, you will be in the lead for reporting and follow up on the financial performance of these projects working closely together with the business stakeholders, business navigation and accounting.  

  

Next to this, you will also be in the lead for improving our procure to pay process. This involves the onboarding of PO compliance and SAP Ariba in the country. You will work closely with Procurement and the Accounting team to improve our current way of working. You will interact and meet many people in this role and guide them in this process. Furthermore, you will set up and guide the accounting team to enhance a proper follow up process. This also includes creating Power BI dashboards to follow up on KPI’s.  

  

**Our team within Ikea**  

  

The Finance department is the spider in the web when it comes to receiving, processing, and delivering all kinds of financial information. The team consists of 14 direct colleagues. The company is in transformation and continuous improvement and embracement of change is of great importance in this role. You enjoy working in a changing environment, you take initiative and have the ability to adapt your ways of working rapidly.  

  

**Questions and support? Let's connect!**  

  

Whatever we are doing today, we will do a little better tomorrow. If we work together we can care for people and planet. And IKEA will take good care of you too.
  

  

Start as Project Financial and expect the following:  

- The salary indication of this role gross a year including holiday and 13th month is between €56.063,00, and €76.780,- depending on experience.
  

* A 13th month and 8% holiday pay. These will be paid out in December and May as standard, but you can also choose to receive them monthly.
* A collective bonus scheme. This is determined annually and amounts to a maximum of 150% of your gross monthly salary.
* Travel expenses for public transport are reimbursed 100%. Do you live within a radius of 5 to 20 km from the IKEA store? Then you can also opt for a lease bicycle. Are you traveling by car? Then you will receive a travel allowance up to a maximum of 200 euros per month.
* 15% employee discount at all IKEA stores in the Netherlands.
* Various arrangements that suit your personal situation. Think of transition leave and equal (100% paid) birth leave regardless of the composition of your family. You may also exchange the public holidays applicable in the Netherlands with non-Christian holidays.

  

**What else is important**  

  

Due to holiday period the first interviews will be conducted during week 29 & 30. Second interviews will be in week 33.
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Internship - Commercial Data Analytics
description:
Internship - Commercial Data Analytics


Do you have a data-driven mindset? Do you want to work on commercial business cases powered by analytics?


HEINEKEN is looking for you!



Every day we work with pride on our great products that you have certainly had in your hand at a party, during a work meeting or at home on the couch. HEINEKEN is much more than just beer. What about brands Heineken and Desperados. We actively work to create a pleasant work environment where everyone feels respected and has equal opportunities. Your personality, knowledge and skills are the success of our organization.


The internship



What do we offer?


* The opportunity to develop your analytical skills in a commercial environment
* Formal Power BI trainings and on the job support
* Learn from professionals in using analytical tools
* You will work together with colleagues in the field of Trade Marketing, E-commerce and Digital & Technology


What are you going to do?


* Perform (advanced) analyses on retail sales data and provide your colleagues with insights
* Design and create data visualization by building Power BI dashboards
* Support the data-driven transformation of Heineken Retail


During your internship you will get the opportunity to get to know HEINEKEN as a company, also outside your department. We give you the trust and freedom, so you can work like a real entrepreneur. We like to bring the outside world inside and therefore we embrace new, fresh ideas with enthusiasm. Of course always with the guidance that is right for you.



The department



You will be part of the Data Driven Sales team, which operates within the Retail department of Heineken the Netherlands and consists of six professionals. The team drives the data-driven transformation at Heineken and acts as the insights partner to many stakeholders within the organization. The team works on projects upon requests as well as on more long-term projects that are key to become more data-driven. In our team we use various tools such as Power BI to create accessible dashboarding and clear visualizations, Python for in-dept analyses/visualizations and SQL to retrieve data.



The terms of employment


* Your starting date is flexible, but around 1st of September 2024
* The internship is fulltime (in consultation also 4 days a week possible)
* The duration of the internship is 5 or 6 months (in consultation with your internship supervisor)
* You are registered at an educational institution
* We work from the office in Leiden and remote
* You will receive an internship fee of €500
* If you do not have a student OV product, your commuting expenses will be fully reimbursed


The start of your internship



Together with a diverse group of interns from different departments you will start your internship at HEINEKEN. Together you will be introduced to the organization. Furthermore, you can organize fun activities with your fellow interns.



The unique you!


We believe that everyone has unique talents and are therefore looking for you! The ideal candidate:


* Follows or just finished a WO education in the field of Business Analytics, Economics or Econometrics
* Has some experience with data analysis and/or visualization tools
* Has great communication skills


Interested?  

Great! For more information about this vacancy or about the application process, please contact werkenbijheinekennederland@heineken.com. You can also apply right now by clicking on the "apply now" button. After that we ask you to fill in some data, write a short motivation for the internship and upload your most recent CV.



The company  

HEINEKEN has been a market leader for more than 150 years. We have a family history and Dutch heritage that we are proud of. This pride is reflected in our entrepreneurship and we take it with us in everything we do and where we go. We are brand builders and the indispensable link between the breweries and the perfect beer in people's homes or on the terrace.


Together we stand for our core values: passion for quality, enjoying life and respect for people and the environment. We always advocate responsible alcohol consumption, feel closely connected to Dutch society and local communities, and constantly strive to improve our impact on the planet.


Embracing and celebrating diversity is at the heart of the purpose of HEINEKEN to "brew the joy of true togetherness to inspire a better world." We believe that people as diverse as our brews - including and not limited to gender, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religious beliefs, nationality, social background, disability and thinking style - enrich our lives and strengthen our business. We welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, as we advocate for a culture of belonging that provides fair and equal opportunities for all.



Do you have feedback on this job posting? If so, please email werkenbijheinekennederland@heineken.com

title: Internship Business Intelligence Logistics
description:
Are you a master student with a passion for data visualization, process improvement and logistics? Then apply for our internship within the Logistics BI team of PostNL and support our complete international business!  

  

**Uitdagingen**  


At PostNL, our business unit “Cross Border Solutions” (CBS) makes it easy for people and businesses to communicate and trade across international boundaries. CBS aims to become the most respected service provider by supporting the cross-border e-commerce market through creative and innovative distribution solutions. In this international business unit we have 13 offices worldwide with 1.200 employees, being agile, customer focused and reliable. CBS serves customers over 190 countries. Within CBS, the department called “Business Intelligence & Analytics” (BI&A) provides insights for the entire CBS organization. We aim for the whole of CBS to have the knowledge and tools to be capable to make data driven (fact based) decisions.

  

  

During your Logistics BI internship, you will work together with BI&A and other IT and business colleagues from CBS to automate one of our most labor-intensive processes managed in MS Excel to a master data application. In this project you will analyse the current process, conduct stakeholder interviews and create a proposal to maximize the efficiency. As a next step, you ensure the successful implementation of the accepted proposal by implementing new cross-team ways of working, integrations and conducting trainings where applicable. You are not in it alone! You will get guidance from a team member and have many opportunities to fine-tune your ideas and action plan with colleagues.

  

  

Besides this core project, you will also be invited to participate in the team’s agile rituals and other activities, contribute to the maintenance of existing and building of new reports and can also get your hands dirty in our ongoing dashboard migration and data modelling projects. We also have a number of initiatives running to improve the way we handle unplanned work; have better overview and reporting capabilities about our data and service quality; implement new standards and tools for our engineering framework and experiment with generative AI solutions to make our work smarter. You are, of course, as a Logistics BI intern, invited to play a role in this important transformation journey, and share your own ideas and views!

  

**Je verantwoordelijkheden**  

**Visible work:** You help our (internal) customers with new information and insights, so that they can run the operations and planning efficiently, and make decisions based on the best quality data. Your improvements will allow us to understand performance of our international business even better!  

**Challenge:** You dive into a complex data management process that supports our reporting capabilities. This allows you to really experience what it means to provide insights to the Netherlands' favorite delivery service!  

**Good atmosphere:** You work together with motivated colleagues from 22 nationalities who dare to seize opportunities and help each other move forward.  

**Freedom:** You will work from home and in a flexible workplace in our vibrant, modern office in the historic Stationspostgebouw (next to Holland Spoor station).  

**Development opportunities:** You will be given plenty of opportunities to follow training courses and grow into other positions or departments. Besides working on a central project, you will also have the chance to contribute to various other activities in our end-to-end team of data analysts and engineers, and leave your mark with improvement ideas on all areas of our daily work.  

  

**Wat breng jij mee?**  


With your analytical skills and curiosity, you know how to convert complex data into useful insights. You also have a keen eye and fresh perspective for continuously improving our way of working. With your 'can do' mentality, you connect the different teams in the data flow from source to dashboard to speed up the generation of insights for all the important business decisions we make every day, based on reliable data. You are able to independently tackle various human and organizational issues, from data collection to managing of expectations.  



**In addition, you bring the following with you:**


* You are currently following a relevant university education, such as a Master in IT, Business Administration, Data Science or Statistics;
* Strong working knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel;
* Knowledge of programming languages (e.g. SQL) and data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI) is a big plus;
* Good communication skills in English (Dutch is extra);
* You are available for at least 32 hours a week during your internship;
* You are interested in PostNL, the logistics e-commerce industry and our services;
* You can do an internship with us from September 2024 to January/February 2025. The exact start and end dates will be determined in consultation.

  

**Wat bezorgen we jou?**  


An internship full of innovation and work that you literally see in every street in the Netherlands. At PostNL we want to grow into the logistics e-commerce platform of the future. So that we can deliver special moments even smarter, faster and better. Your mentality and our challenge. With us you bring it together.


**You can count on the following benefits:**


* A monthly internship allowance of €500,- based on 40 hours and a travel allowance if applicable;
* A company laptop;
* Office location in The Hague with excellent public transport accessibility (within walking distance of Holland Spoor) and the possibility to work independently of location and time.
* Your colleagues are ready to help you and provide you with the right guidance.
company_addresses: PostNL Holding BV Waldorpstraat 3 • 2521 CA • Den Haag
company_description: Wij zijn PostNL. Je favoriete bezorger. Dagelijks bezorgen we 1,1 miljoen pakketten en bijna 7 miljoen poststukken. Een hele uitdaging die we iedere dag weer samen aangaan.

title: Ice Cream Digital Commerce Data & Analytics Analyst
description:
**UNILEVER IS LOOKING FOR AN ICE CREAM DIGITAL COMMERCE DATA & ANALYTICS LEAD**

Location: Weena, Rotterdam with intent to move to Amsterdam in 2025


Full time


Salary: 48-65 K gross per year depending on background and experience.

*A job at Unilever means working with purpose in an inclusive and diverse culture. We think all roles can be made flexible and believe in an approach to getting work done that allows any employee to work anytime, from anywhere.*

**ABOUT ICE CREAM:**

We spark moments of happiness for people and within the communities where we operate. As ice cream makers we are serious about happiness. With warm hearts, we create the coolest products. We are the proof that an unbroken chain of happier people works – for a happy planet and winning smiles. As the largest ice cream company in the world, we have over 100 years of experience in delivering smiles, and we plan to continue this for many more years to come, with our people and planet first.


We have 35 brands, including 3 one billion Euro brands (Magnum, Wall’s, Ben & Jerry’s), in over 60 countries. All driven to spread happiness through indulgent yet responsibly made and marketed products. We have a well-developed strategy to deliver growth and value creation which is clear on our where to play and how to win.

**JOB PURPOSE**


Unilever is the place where you can bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. If you are a data whiz with a business brain and a desire to be at the forefront of change in Qcom, then this is the role for you.

**WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE**

Strengthen the future-focused capabilities by:

* Define and execute the data product strategy and roadmap with business stakeholders and development teams.
* Lead the development, maintenance and optimization of scalable data visualization tools and tech solutions.
* Lead the expansion of product analytics: from opportunity sizing to post-launch impact.
* Build strong relationships with stakeholders across tech, development, and business teams.
* Collaborate with external partners on data roadmaps and establish data maturity frameworks.
* Provide data-driven support to internal stakeholders for informed decision-making.
* Guide business key stakeholders on leveraging data to achieve goals.

 **WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:**

* Minimum 4+ years of experience of experience delivering actionable insights in a data-driven environment. Prior experience in a global tech / food / FMCG company is a plus.
* Analytical skills: Extensive experience with complex modeling and conducting quantitative analysis.
* Digital Commerce knowledge (a plus): Understanding of the digital commerce space and the biggest food delivery partners.
* Communication skills: Strong communication and presentation skills to present analysis


clearly and concisely to executives and management.

* Relationship building: Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders and influence  

them with concrete recommendations across all levels (local, central, and external teams).
* Problem-solving: A resourceful problem-solver with a proactive approach who can drive  

alignment even in ambiguous situations.
* Project Plan: experience creating and following project plans. Prior experience as a project  

lead is a plus.
* Technical skills: Proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI. Understanding of Azure,  

Databricks is a plus.
* Programming skills (a plus): Skilled in SQL, Python, R, or similar programming languages.
* English fluency: Fluent in written and spoken English.

**SKILLS**

* Data expertise & management
* Business engagement
* Information delivery
* Demand & delivery
* Product management
* Stakeholder management
* Effective communication

**WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?**

  

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting & dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!

* Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus, share scheme.
* Flexible cross-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities & wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.
* Plenty of company-paid holidays to further ensure your work-life balance is maintained.
* We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.
* We are working under the Hybrid Working principles. You will be expected to  

to be in the office for 3-4 days per week (Amsterdam in 2025). For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped.
* Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.
* My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription).
* Home work allowance
* Company laptop and mobile phone
* Green Mobility Policy.

 **EXCITED?**


Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.


Looking forward to meeting you!


Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.


Unilever embraces diversity and encourages applicants from all walks of life! This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.

*By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply.*

*Please save a copy of this vacancy for personal use as it will disappear from the website after closing of the role.*
