title: FULL-TIME FRONTEND DEVELOPER
description:
AMSTERDAM, THE NETHERLANDS
**JOIN OUR TEAM**
-----------------



BrainCreators is an innovative technology firm that specializes in Software as a Service (SaaS) products. Our flagship software products, INSPECH Digital Road Inspection and SEAGULL Surveillance, are designed to solve real-world problems and revolutionize industries globally. Our SaaS products are centered around visual inspection tasks, utilizing the latest and most advanced ML technology.

  

As a frontend developer, you’ll be part of the **IN****SPECH** product team. You'll work with talented colleagues who have a sharp focus on scalable products for a worldwide market.


**Interests:**
--------------


+ You must have a product-oriented mindset, care deeply about the product, and demonstrate keen attention to detail in your work.
+ An interest in the application of ML technologies
+ A sense of humor and a desire to interact with people
+ Stay up-to-date with the latest trends, tools, and technologies
+ An attitude of taking responsibility and ownership
**Core responsibilities:**
--------------------------

  

* Design and build highly usable user interfaces, using Typescript and React
* Optimize frontend performance to deliver fast and efficient applications
* Strong debugging skills to identify and resolve issues in existing codebases
* Stay up-to-date with the latest frontend trends, tools, and technologies and proactively propose improvements to the existing codebase
**Team responsibilities:**
--------------------------

  

* Collaborate with the product manager and design team to understand requirements and create responsive, intuitive, and visually appealing user interfaces (knowledge of UX/UI design principles is a bonus)
* Collaborate with backend developers to integrate frontend components with server-side logic.
* Collaborate with ML engineers to create visual representations for innovative features.
* Contribute to the team spirit with a constructive attitude by giving and receiving feedback
* Contribute to code reviews and provide constructive feedback to your peers
* Enhance the team's collective knowledge and become a highly valued participant in frontend chapter meetings, write articles for our internal blog platform
* Join the effort to contribute to the shared components' library across teams
**Qualifications:**
-------------------

  

* A relevant completed higher education or equivalent working experience
* Proven experience of at least **4 years**as Frontend Developer or in a similar position
* Develop highly composable, readable, testable, and efficient code
* Fluency in standard frontend technologies such as proficiency in React, TypeScript, (S)CSS and HTML
* Have a good understanding of the git version control systems and package managers such as npm and yarn
* Have an understanding of the fundamentals of the HTTP protocol
* Have experience with React Testing Library and Jest to proficiently write tests, ensuring the quality and stability of your codebase
* Have an experience with at least one of UI components libraries (Material UI, Ant Design, Bootstrap, Chakra UI) or eager to learn
* Have an experience or Interested in learning data visualization frameworks (e.g., deck.gl)
* A plus is familiarity with frontend build tools and preprocessors (e.g., Webpack, Babel). Experience with scrum and agile development

Having experience with ergonomics and UX design is welcomed too  
* 
**What we offer:**
------------------

  

* An open culture with many opportunities to work with cutting-edge technology
* Inspiring colleagues from all over the world
* A cutting-edge office environment with LED walls, gym, sauna, nightclub, and a fantastic view of the Amsterdam Houthavens
* A delightful opportunity to enjoy drinks together after work
* A budget for team outgoings
* Room for personal growth and initiative
* Competitive salary package, participation in the pension plan, and 25 days of paid leave
* All the benefits of a scale-up company and a future option to participate in our success
**Ready to apply?**
-------------------


Upload your CV and cover letter here and we'll be in touch with you shortly.
ABOUT US
**OUR MISSION AND VISION**
--------------------------


**We are here** to automate highly skilled repetitive inspection work and present the results as actionable insights in cutting edge user experiences to empower the industries that make the most positive impact on our common future and contribute in closing the skills gap.  

  

We allow expert human inspectors to clone their knowledge in a digital counterpart and share the resulting digital inspector with others as a software service.
**We help create a future** where human beings focus on drawing conclusions from consistent inspection results and turn their interpretation into concrete action to eliminate waste, reduce cost and accelerate innovation.  

  

In the future the application of technologies like deep learning and AI will allow us to spend less time on repetitive tasks and shift our attention to making changes that impact the sustainability of our environment and natural resources.
### **GROW PERSONALLY AND PROFESSIONALLY**


Join **BRAINCREATORS** and be part of creating products that shape the future of work.

title: Internship: Process Mining IGT-Devices
description:
Job Title
Internship: Process Mining IGT-Devices
Job Description
Start date: Q3 2024
Duration: 5-6 months
Type: Non-Thesis
Weekly presence: 40 hours per week
You will have an opportunity to learn, play a key part in, and drive supply chain analytics and process mining initiative to structurally improve our End-to-End flows and performance. Working closely with data and process specialists and various stakeholders to gain actionable insights and stimulate knowledge sharing and lessons learned.
Your role:* Process Mapping and Visualization: Create visual representations of the contracting and quoting processes, including data flows and decision points.
* Data Integration and Connectivity: Establish connections between the IT-tools to support these processes, ensuring a unified view of customer interactions and equipment offering processes.
* Process Mining Analysis: Apply process mining techniques to analyze the process flow, identify deviations, and measure key performance indicators.
* Recommendations and Conclusion: Propose recommendations for process optimization by identifying and elimination of waste and reducing cycle time of the entire E2E process. This may include automation opportunities and improved data connectivity between IT-tools, based on the findings from the analysis.
* Share your knowledge and insights to educate the organization, ensuring professional communication and timely updates.


You're the right fit if:* Studying towards your Bachelor or Master University degree study in: Business Administration, Business Management, Industrial Engineering.
* Good knowledge of English language both verbally and written
* Self-starter, not afraid to look for information and reach out to new people.
* Analytical thinker, with a detail and process-oriented mindset
* Ability to digest and organize large amounts of data.
* Ideally experience with power point and excel skills and knowledge in data analytics/management and process mining.


IMPORTANT:
Part of our selection procedure is a HireVue Assessment. We are not able to correspond the outcome of this HireVue Assessment but will use this as an extra selection criterion.
Our intern remuneration package:* Monthly full-time allowance between €500 - €700 gross, depending on educational level and if you would need to relocate to The Netherlands. If you perform a part-time internship, you will receive an allowance pro-rata.
* Housing compensation, in case of relocating to the vicinity of the office, €300,- net if location is in the vicinity of Amsterdam, €255,- net for all other Philips locations. You need to provide a rental contract of the landlord, and your normal home-work travel distance need to be more than 50 km or travel time (one way trip) need to be more than 1.5 hours.
* Travel compensation, if you are not eligible for a free public transport card; you will receive max. €192,- net
* Paid holidays per internship term.
* The opportunity to buy Philips products at our Philips shop


Notes
Required documents for us to continue with your application:* Resume


Please note that to be considered for an internship, you need to be registered as a student during the entire internship period. Formal documentation of which may be requested at any time. Students from outside the EU need to fill in a NUFFIC agreement, which needs to be signed by the student and the university.
Please note that the contents of our regular internship assignments are not suitable for professionals (and/or MBA students) with professional work experience.

title: Test Architect
description:
Introduction


We are ASML, the world market leader in scanning lithography technology. Within the Data and Digital Platform it is our mission to create a big data application platform tailored for wafer fab applications. Our scope is analytics and visualization of big data as it is generated in the semiconductor fab, and our challenge is how we can enable our customers to gain a deeper understanding into their vast datasets. We believe that data has a story to tell and a proper visualization is the means to achieve that. On our application platform full-stack software products can be developed that run in the most modern semiconductor fabs in the world, where we together with our customers always keep pushing the boundary of what is possible.


Are you eager to ensure and improve the quality of the software of our application platform? Then this might be your next challenge !


Job Mission


As Function Cluster Test Architect you are a member of the software development group responsible for developing our application platform. In this role you take the lead in implementing the ART(Agile Release Train) test strategy in close cooperation with the Quality Assurance/Test Engineers and the Quality Manager.


You are able to determine whether we have tested enough to fulfil the level of quality needed by our (internal) customers. You keep track of the newest test technologies which may be useful to optimize the Function Cluster test strategy. Together with the Quality Manager you act as a gatekeeper for the quality gates in the test strategy, and you always stand for quality.


You will have access to world class engineering facilities and be at the core of our mission to create the big data analytics platform tailored for Wafer Fab Application. You will work in a fast-paced and agile development environment using the latest software development technologies and infrastructure. Moreover you will be inspired by and collaborate with a group of highly skilled and talented colleagues.


Job Description

* Define, refine and optimize the ART Test Strategy ranging from unit testing to E2E Testing
* Responsible for implementing the ART Test Strategy in our function cluster
* Lead the function cluster test community: act as a lead and coach for the QA/Test Engineers from test competency perspective, working together to optimize quality
* Own the software test environment setup of the functional cluster
* Assure the quality gates as defined in the ART Test Strategy are met
* Be the first point of contact for the test architects of the consumers of our application platform to align and optimize the test strategies over different ARTs and the quality and integration department
* Based upon a risk assessment enable QA/Test Engineers to define together with other relevant stakeholders the test cases that need to be executed to verify and validate the functional and non-functional quality characteristics
* Determine whether we have tested enough to fulfil the level of quality needed by our (internal) customers
* Motivate and guide the scrum teams in our functional cluster to deliver high quality
* Act as reviewer for test plans/test approach and test cases
* Challenge and advice other architects on implementing new technologies and improvements
* Drive Common Test Library (CTL) improvements and changes together with the CTL component owner
* Responsible for implementing test management tools together with the Quality Manager
* Keep track of the newest test technologies which may be useful to optimize the function cluster test strategy


Experience

* Extensive experience (> 8 years) in the field of software testing in a complex environment
* Experience in defining a software test architecture
* Experience with defining and implementing a test strategy
* Excellent understanding of automated software test tooling and how to use them to test in an efficient and effective way (e.g. Cypress, Cucumber, Playwright, etc.)
* Experience with frontend test automation
* Knowledge of and experience with code quality tools like Gherkinlint, SonarCube or comparable
* Experience with build tools and automation systems (e.g. npm, Webpack, Maven, Gradle)
* Experience in solving complex design and usability problems and translating them into modern, elegant and simple web interfaces
* Experience with development methodologies such as Agile and Scrum
* Fluency in English


Education


Master Degree in computer science, software engineering or equivalent


Personal skills

* First of all, you are passionate about software quality and testing technology and are excited by the idea that your work will impact millions of end-users worldwide;
* You have an unstoppable drive to deliver high quality software solutions;
* You like to investigate (complex) issues, and you are a creative problem solver;
* You have a clear drive for quality and are constantly highlighting prioritizing testing and quality with key stakeholders
* You are open open-minded, you like to discuss technical challenges, and you want to push the boundaries of technology;
* You are an innovator and you constantly seek to improve your knowledge and your work;

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------


ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.
company_description: ASML provides chipmakers with hardware, software and services to mass produce patterns on silicon, helping to build the electronic devices that keep us informed, entertained and connected.

title: Working Student - Data Analyst
description:
**Internship / Working Student:** **Development and Optimization of R&D KPI Reporting for NXP**  

  

Become part of the startup of a dynamic team that is leading NXP on a digital transformation journey. There is a lot of room for new ideas and innovations and you will be supported to have a continuous focus on development, coaching and creating a supportive environment for your team.


**Your Responsibilities**

The objective of this assignment is to design, develop, and optimize a comprehensive reporting format for internal R&D data, focusing on key performance indicators (KPIs) and ongoing project metrics. The system should facilitate effective communication of R&D performance and progress to various stakeholders within the company. You will work with the R&D departments & Analytics and Program Support Team to gather requirements, analyze current reporting methods, and propose improvements or new methodologies for reporting R&D data. The focus will be on creating a user-friendly, insightful, and actionable reporting format that aligns with the strategic goals of NXP.


You can find a detailed description below.


**Tasks and Deliverables**

Understanding Current Reporting Processes:


* Review existing R&D data reporting methods and tools used within NXP
* Identify key stakeholders and their reporting needs.
* Document current challenges and limitations in the existing reporting system

Data Collection and Analysis:


* Collect data on running R&D projects, including project milestones, budget, timeline, resource allocation, and performance metrics.
* Analyze R&D data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement on current way of reporting

Designing the Reporting System:


* Propose a reporting framework that addresses the identified needs and challenges.
* Design interactive dashboards and reports that provide clear insights into R&D performance.
* Ensure the design allows for easy updates and scalability as new data becomes available.

Implementation:


* Work together with the teams to select appropriate tools and technologies for implementing the reporting system (Power BI, Python, AWS).
* Develop prototypes and conduct user testing to gather feedback and refine the reporting system.
* Collaborate with IT and R&D teams to ensure data integration and system compatibility.

Documentation and Training:


* Document the reporting processes, including data sources, transformation logic, and visualization techniques.
* Create user manuals and training materials for stakeholders.
* Conduct training sessions to ensure smooth adoption of the new reporting system.

Evaluation and Continuous Improvement:


* Implement a feedback mechanism to gather user input post-implementation.
* Analyze the impact of the new reporting system on decision-making and project management.
* Propose ongoing improvements to enhance the system’s effectiveness and efficiency.

**Expected Outcomes:**

* A detailed report outlining the current state of R&D reporting, identified challenges, and proposed solutions.
* A functional, user-friendly reporting system for R&D KPIs and project data.
* Recommendations for future enhancements and sustainability of the reporting system.

**Note**

Please note that the information involved in this assignment is highly confidential. Both the student and the supervisor must be willing to sign a confidentiality agreement. Additionally, the final report and any associated materials may not be published.


**What's in it for you:**

* Experience in collaborating with international teams and stakeholders
* Ability to develop your project management and communication skills.
* Working together with experienced members of the team

**Your Profile**

* Bachelor degree in Software Engineering, Information Science, Data Science, Data Engineering or similar studies
* Good communication skills in English (both verbal and written)
* Structural way-of-working with interest for the detail
* Pro-active, open-minded and flexible person
* Experience with or willingness to learn on MS Office (Office 365, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint)
* Experience with Power BI or similar visualization platforms (e.g. Tableau) Programming skills in VBA or DAX or scripting (e.g. Python)

**Duration**

The duration of the assignment will be a minimum of 6 months (20h/week) and will take place in NXP Nijmegen/Eindhoven. Please note that to be considered for this position, you **need to be registered as a student during the entire period** .


**Creating Secure Connections and Infrastructure for a Smarter World**

NXP Semiconductors N.V. (NASDAQ: NXPI) makes products and environments safer, more sustainable, and more secure with innovative connectivity and edge processing solutions for a smarter world. We are in the business of better. Not just better technologies, but better innovations to improve society. As the world leader in secure connectivity and processing solutions for embedded applications, NXP is solving the world’s most complex technology challenges to accelerate business innovation, enhance how we work, and advance how we live. If you are as excited about this opportunity as we are, we kindly invite you to apply. After a screening based on your profile you can be expected to have a video interview with our Talent Acquisition Consultant followed by business.


**What Can You Expect?**

Development opportunities: We believe that a key component to growing our business is to develop our people. To enable you to grow your career at NXP, we provide you with a mix of learning through on-the-job experiences, learning from industries bests, and learning through education to help you develop your core and professional skills.


Our offices: The Netherlands is home to our global headquarters (Eindhoven) along with two additional sites (Nijmegen, Delft) and includes a diverse team of over 2000 employees with 51 different nationalities focused on R&D, manufacturing, product development, business operations, legal and sales.


Hiring process: Applying only takes a minute! Fill in the online application and share your CV with us. After a positive screening based on your CV you will have an initial video conversation with our Talent Acquisition Consultant followed by several business interviews. Here are some useful tips to help you prepare.


And more: Life at NXP is more than work alone. Join one of the many social activities that are organized by and for employees in the Netherlands, such as our Christmas parties and International Walking Day. We have a YOUNG community that organizes a mix of social and professional events for our young professionals and an active Women in NXP. We also take time to give back to our communities by engaging young girls to learn about Technology during Girls Day or participating in several volunteering activities.  

  



**What’s Next?**

If you’re excited about this opportunity, we kindly invite you to apply! If you have any questions, we are happy to answer them. Please contact, Chanchal Sharma, Talent Acquisition Specialist on chanchal.sharma\_1@nxp.com


More information about NXP in the Netherlands...
company_description: NXP Semiconductors enables secure connections and infrastructure for a smarter world, advancing solutions that make like easier and safer.

title: Reporting Specialist
description:
Amsterdam Headoffice Full time IT Other

Stage Entertainment is one of the world's leading theater producers and owners. We have offices and theaters across Europe and produce the world’s biggest titles, such as &Juliet, MJ, the Blue Man Group, Moulin Rouge, Disney's The Lion King, Alladin and Frozen as well as in-house developed productions such as TINA-The Tina Turner Musical on Broadway and West-End and are touring in several countries with it.



Stage Entertainment is owned by Advance Publications Inc. based in New York. Advance is a family-owned company that operates globally and invests in a wide range of media, communication, and technology businesses globally.



Passion connects us  

Our strong passion for live entertainment, musicals and first-class theater performances is what connects us at Stage Entertainment. This common bond turns a colorful mix of people from a wide variety of professions into one dedicated team: a true "we". A team that does exceptional work by always striving for the best. A team that knows how to thrill millions of spectators with extraordinary shows on all our stages across Europe. We want to share our passion with you, too. That’s why we’re looking for you!  



Reporting Specialist here is where your journey starts:  

At Stage Entertainment, we are committed to continuous evolution as a data-driven company. As a key member of our Intelligence Center, the Reporting Specialist plays a vital role in our operations by creating, maintaining, and supporting dynamic dashboards tailored to the unique needs of each department. This pivotal role bridges the gap between business requirements and actionable insights, empowering informed decision-making at every level of our organization.



The Reporting Specialist is integral to our shared IT strategy, which prioritizes quality, synergy, agility, and efficiency. By adopting a collaborative approach and fostering a culture of innovation, we leverage these principles to drive excellence across all aspects of our operations.



This role reports to the Team Lead Intelligence Center. In the absence of this role, the Reporting Specialist will report to the Group IT Director.

  


Specific responsibilities:


* Collaborate with stakeholders from finance, marketing, ticket sales, digital commerce, and venue operations to understand their reporting needs, both explicit and implicit.
* Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards using the full Power BI stack, ensuring alignment with business objectives and scalability for future growth.
* Translate complex data requirements into intuitive visualizations and insights, providing clarity and actionable recommendations to stakeholders.
* Act as a trusted advisor and sounding board for business stakeholders, offering expertise in dashboard design, data visualization best practices, and reporting solutions.
* Work within an agile framework, participating in scrum ceremonies to iteratively develop and refine dashboards, responding effectively to changing business needs.
* Collaborate with data engineers to ensure timely and accurate data integration from our BigQuery data warehouse into Power BI, maintaining data integrity and reliability.
* Conduct thorough testing and validation of dashboards to ensure accuracy, reliability, and usability, addressing any issues promptly.
* Create comprehensive documentation for dashboards, including data sources, calculations, and usage guidelines, enabling efficient knowledge transfer and support.
* Provide training and support to end-users on dashboard usage, empowering them to leverage data insights effectively in their decision-making processes.
* Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in reporting and data visualization, continuously seeking opportunities to enhance our reporting capabilities.
* Mentor and guide colleagues, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation.



Qualifications and experience:


* Bachelor's degree (Master is preferred) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Marketing or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Minimum of one year relevant work experience.
* Proven experience in developing and maintaining reports and dashboards, preferably in a live entertainment or similar industry.
* Strong knowledge of Microsoft Power BI and proficiency in the Microsoft technology stack.
* Proficient understanding of data warehousing concepts and experience working with BigQuery or similar data warehouse platforms.
* Experience working in an agile environment, familiarity with scrum methodologies preferred.
* Proficient knowledge of one or more of the following domains: Finance, ticket sales processes, digital commerce and human resources.
* Experience working with Senior leadership on developing & delivering data-driven insights and dashboards
* Ability to work effectively in projects.
* Fluent in English. Working knowledge of German, Dutch, Spanish or French will be a plus.
* Strong knowledge of one of more of the following domains: finance, ticket sales processes, HR and digital commerce will be a plus.

  


What does Stage Entertainment offer?


* 25 vacation days, 1 D&I day and 2 designated days off from Stage Entertainment.
* Competitive salary.
* Good pension scheme and travel allowance.
* Great if you work in the office, but we also offer the opportunity to work partially from home.
* The opportunity to work remotely for two weeks at a destination of your choice.
* Opportunities for training and education.
* Your work makes an impact both Stage Entertainment headquarters and internationally. You will work with diverse, passionate colleagues all over Europe.



Are you excited to join us as a Reporting Specialist?
  

Let's arrange a meeting to discuss the exciting opportunities that await you!



We encourage you to apply for this vacancy, even if you don’t fit all qualifications. We are looking for candidates of all backgrounds and the candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or disability. We realize that a diverse mix of colleagues gives us access to a wide range of ideas, perspectives and insights that allow us to touch hearts and create memories. Please find more information about our D&I initiatives: https://www.stage-entertainment.com/dei
company_description: Touching hearts, creating memories. We are the leading musical theatre production company, showing titles as Mamma Mia! and Disney's The Lion King.

title: Senior Frontend Engineer
description:
**What you should know about Truvity**
--------------------------------------


Truvity was born out of the idea that there must be a better way to manage, verify, and share data and credentials. That there must be an alternative to facing millions in compliance fees, the administrative panic for an audit, or even the shockingly complex process of verifying that a customer is truly who they claim to be.

  

We found the solution in Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI) technology. Our architecture is among the first to make it to market fully realized, and accessible to everyone. Unlike traditional database infrastructure, our architecture is ready to deploy in a complete API, backed up with clear and concise developer documentation, and is scalable to meet the needs of international finance KYC, to a neighbourhood bakery’s rewards program, and every use case in between.


We allow the establishment of instant trust between any entities, the ease of regulatory compliance with immutable, instantly verifiable, and machine-readable documentation, and GDPR and eIDAS 2.0 integration right out of the box. Join us, and help to build the future of trust in digital identity.

**What you will do**
--------------------

* Build and improve our web applications and SDKs for our customers using well-known and widely used frameworks and libraries.
* Ensure the application architecture allows for easy maintenance and support.
* Test and document the product you develop.
* Improve engineering practices, standards, tools, and processes.
* Work with the Product Manager and QA to analyze requirements, search for, and prepare options for their solutions.

**What you will need to have**
------------------------------

* 6+ years of professional work experience, ideally within a start-up/scale-up environment.
* Solid knowledge of TypeScript and JavaScript.
* Understanding of modern frontend architecture principles, design practices, and patterns.
* Experience with developing Single Page Applications.
* You are familiar with modern build systems (especially code generation).
* You are a self-learner. You can analyze the code and documentation yourself, and you are not afraid to ask questions when needed.
* You know how to manage your time, even if you have a busy schedule.
* *Unfortunately, we are not able to support relocation to the Netherlands and can only consider candidates who are already living in the Netherlands.*

**What are some nice-to-have skills (but not required)**
--------------------------------------------------------

* Experience of working in fully remote companies.
* Experience with SSI (Self-sovereign identity), LegalTech, or FinTech.
* Experience with unit and e2e testing.
* Experience with building complex interactive forms.
* Experience with JSON Schema and its application for data validation and visualization.
* Experience with graphs. How to visualize relations and data.
* Experience with JSON-LD.
* Experience with building client-facing SDK.
* Experience with React.js, CSS, HTML.
* Experience with Jest, React Testing Library.
* Experience with Nest.js.
* Experience with Material UI.

**Why Truvity**
---------------

* We have successfully proved that our product is (and will be) required worldwide.
* Work directly with an experienced start-up team in a very hot industry.
* Work with cutting-edge technology.
* Explore challenging projects with endless possibilities for personal development.
* Flexible hours gives you freedom and increase productivity.
* Work in a team of veteran senior developers with high standards, who strive for the most efficient solutions.
* Work in an open learning environment with a budget, we offer support for continuing education and growth.
* Cutting edge work equipment and resources.
* Vacation and holidays in accordance with your country of residence.
* Be a part of an international team of outstanding talents.
* Remote work is fully supported.

**We encourage you to apply**
-----------------------------


We at Truvity pride ourselves on our commitment to transparency and diversity. Our hiring process welcomes people from all backgrounds, ethnicities, genders, sexual orientations, ages, abilities, religions, and experiences, and we know that the best work comes from a meeting of unique minds.


Our goal is to find the most unique and talented people to join our team, so that we can compliment each other’s strengths and build the future through our technology. The best insights can come from the most unexpected places, so we encourage you to apply even if you think you aren’t an absolute match for all the listed qualifications. Let’s build Truvity together.


Compensation Range: €90K - €150K

title: Marketing Operations Data Intern
description:
Bynder goes far beyond managing digital assets. Our digital asset management platform enables teams to conquer the chaos of proliferating content, touchpoints, and relationships in order to thrive.

  



With powerful and intuitive solutions that embrace the way people want to work, and a richly integrated ecosystem, We are the brand ally that unifies and transforms the creation and sharing of assets, inspiring teams, delighting customers, and elevating businesses.

  



Our 500+ employees, known as 'Byndies', together constitute the world's most extensive pool of digital asset management expertise. We enable more than 1.7M users across more than 3,700 organizations, including Spotify, Puma, Five Guys and Icelandair.

  

Founded in 2013, we have eight offices around the globe, including the Netherlands, USA, Spain, UK, Australia and UAE. For more information, visit www.bynder.com.

**About the role:**



As Marketing Operations Data Intern you will be part of the Bynder Revenue Operations team. Which is responsible for helping the Marketing, Sales and Customer Success teams achieve their goals & targets. Their purpose is to increase efficiency, effectiveness, and business contribution by aligning revenue impacting teams. The team focuses on both strategic and tactical projects relating to Forecasting, Data Analysis, Process Design, Technology, and Data Governance.



As a Data Intern within the Marketing Operations team you will help set up and maintain the marketing data landscape. This involves data documentation, data cleaning & visualization and enabling marketers to use our BI tool for data analysis.


**What you will do:**


* Data Analysis
* Data normalization
* Support marketers with their day-to-day data needs
* Assist with the administration of multiple marketing tools
* Help out with ad-hoc projects to improve marketing processes
* Develop the framework to solve challenges


**What you have:**


* You need to be available for a 6 month long full-time internship from ±August/September 2024.
* You currently follow an education in a related field (Business, Marketing, Data Analytics, etc.)
* You are not afraid to work with numbers
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word
* Knowledge of a BI tool (Sisense, ThoughtSpot, Tableau or similar) is a plus
* Knowledge of a data programming language (Python, R, Matlab) is a plus
* You need to be fluent in English
* You need to be enrolled in a school/university throughout the whole duration of the internship


**Nice to haves:**


* You have a self starter mentality
* You need to have top-notch communication skills in speaking and in writing
* You have a strategic mindset, and you're eager to learn


**Why you'll love Bynder!**



At Bynder, innovation is in our DNA. We've worked hard to build an environment that promotes creative thinking and self-initiative within a culture of fun. It's common to find colleagues hanging out after work - if you believe in "be nice, work hard, have fun", you'll have an office full of friends.


**What we offer:**


* Work experience on a global level
* Paid internship
* The chance to be part of a young and ambitious team
* On-the-job training
* Personal development
* A broad scope of responsibilities
* Free lunch available every day


**Our commitment:**



Bynder Love is the principle that guides the way we grow our teams, support our employees, and celebrate our differences. At Bynder we strive to create a culture that embraces every Byndie because differences in background, experience, and perspective make Bynder even better. At Bynder a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace is one where all employees, whatever their ethnicity, color, sex, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or physical and mental ability are valued and respected. Our commitment is for all Byndies to have the freedom to be their true authentic selves.



Just as we are never finished innovating, Bynder's commitment to being An Even Better Bynder is a constant, evolving commitment that includes education, listening, and action.

title: Data Engineer
description:
### **About Us:**


Paebbl is a founder-led start up in the emerging field of climate technology and the new “carbon economy”. Our mission is to permanently sequester CO2 and repurpose it into products that the world needs. Inspired by natural CO2 mineralization, our technology accelerates this process by a factor of a million and is now ready for scale-up. We are privately financed by supportive, long-term oriented institutional and private investors, and our diverse team includes experts from technology, industrial engineering, digital innovation, waste management, finance, and academia.

### **Overview**


Join our team at Paebbl as a Data Engineer and take a central role in developing cutting-edge digital systems essential for our innovation and growth. This position involves providing technical leadership to acquire, process, and make our data accessible to ensure that our digital platforms help us deliver market leading products consistently. You will lead significant projects to contextualise our data, and make it accessible and useful for strategic decision-making and technology development across the organization. The role is perfect for a dynamic professional with a strong background in handling a broad range of data types, especially scientific and IoT data, who is adept at navigating start-up-like environments and making autonomous decisions. As a leader, you will also drive the growth of new capabilities and provide supervision for our expanding team, shaping the future of Paebbl’s data infrastructure on our greenfield platform

### **Required Skills and Qualifications:**

* Strong proficiency in data architecture, software engineering (ideally with Python), and cloud engineering.
* Strong proficiency in data engineering, including data visualization and IoT data handling (ideally on AWS).
* Good communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical details to non-technical stakeholders.
* Demonstrated leadership in technical project management, agile working, and strategic decision-making.
* Experience with data science, simulation, machine learning, and handling unstructured data is highly desirable.
* Ideally 3 years experience in business or industrial settings

### **Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead the iterative design and implementation of a data platform to support the needs of critical business projects.
* Develop and manage cloud-based systems to ensure scalable and efficient data processing and storage.
* Utilize advanced data engineering techniques to handle both structured and unstructured data.
* Collaborate with data scientists, modellers, platform, and software engineers to create integrated solutions that drive knowledge-driven decision making.
* Provide technical supervision for new data engineers, which is seen as a key capability in the fast-growing digital team
* Drive the adoption of best practices in data security, data quality, and data governance.

### **What We Offer:**

* Market-rate salary.
* Stock option program participation.
* Private healthcare insurance.
* Annual training and development budget.
* Annual wellness budget.
* 25 days of paid vacation.
* Up to 6 months of compensated parental leave.
* Standard pension scheme support.
* Remote first digital team, based across Europe.


We believe in fostering a constructive, inclusive work environment that respects all stakeholders, including our team, collaborators, customers, and partners. Our Code of Conduct reflects our commitment to cultivating a positive workplace culture. Join us and be part of a pioneering company shaping the future of CO2 removal and CO2-negative materials industries. Ready to make a real impact? Apply today and help us shape a sustainable future!

title: PhD position in 'Effects of Pollution at the Ecosystem Level'
description:
Vacaturenr.
14994
Functie-categorie
PhD-posities
Omvang (fte)
0,8-1,0
Extern/intern
Extern
Locatie
Leiden
Geplaatst op
2 juli 2024
Sluitingsdatum
18 augustus 2024


The Faculty of Science and the Institute of Environmental Sciences (CML) are looking for:

**PhD candidate | Environmental impact assessment of pollution at the ecosystem level (0.8-1.0 fte)**

**Vacancy number: (14994)**


**Background**


The freshwater system and its adjacent ecosystems host countless species because of their need of water. These are the earths’ natural capital and drivers of many ecosystem services we humans depend on. At the same time, the presence and effects of anthropogenic stress in the aquatic environment are multitude and ubiquitous. These include the omnipresence of chemical pollution such as the use of agricultural chemicals.


To relatively quickly assess the impacts of chemicals a standard risk assessment framework is in place. While valuable, the frameworks often lacks ecological realism. Researchers from Leiden University therefore experiment in outdoor freshwater experimental systems with natural food webs such as the “Levend Lab” (EN: “Living Lab”, https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/livinglab) to identify how biodiversity responds to the impacts of pesticides, fertilizers, invasive species and nanomaterials.


Using ecological theory, a large array of different experimental and statistical analytical methods are currently in practice to perform and analyze such experiments. The key challenge for the PhD candidate is to test these different forms of experimental and statistical analytical methods to identify stressor - ecosystem function relationships. The research will likely entail measuring different forms of aquatic biodiversity and ecosystem functionality followed by statistical modelling to infer causality of stressor impacts and their propagation through the ecosystem.


We invite prospective candidates to unravel the intricate network of species interactions between each other and their environment. The candidate will use new analytical methods and develops models and interpretation scenarios to identify how pollution impacts species and their role in ecosystem functionality.

**Key tasks:**

* *Perform* mesocosm pollution experiments in the ‘Levend Lab’ facility of Leiden University
* *Further develop* and test different types of statistical analyses at the community to ecosystem level
* *Advance* ecological theory by identifying the anthropological and natural drivers of species and their roles in ecosystems

**Selection criteria:**

* You should have an M.Sc. in a relevant field (environmental science, biology, ecology and/or ecotoxicology), but we also consider candidates from other related scientific fields.
* Experience with experimental field and laboratory skills and (aquatic) organism identifications are highly valued
* Strong background and interest in statistical analyses, data management, visualization and coding skills (in R, but Python also applies) is highly valued.
* You must be proficient in spoken and written English.
* You are a team player and have a collaborative attitude.


**Research at our Institute/Faculty**  

The Faculty of Science is a world-class faculty where staff and students work together in a dynamic international environment. It is a faculty where personal and academic development are top priorities. Our people are driven by curiosity to expand fundamental knowledge and to look beyond the borders of their own discipline; their aim is to benefit science, and to make a contribution to addressing the major societal challenges of the future.


The research carried out at the Faculty is very diverse, ranging from mathematics, information science, astronomy, physics, chemistry and bio-pharmaceutical sciences to biology and environmental sciences. The research activities are organised in eight institutes. These institutes offer eight bachelor’s and twelve master’s programmes. The faculty has grown strongly in recent years and now has more than 2,800 staff and almost 6,000 students. We are located at the heart of Leiden’s Bio Science Park, one of Europe’s biggest science parks, where university and business life come together.


The environmental science research in CML is organized around two major research areas: ‘Industrial Ecology’ and ‘Environmental Biology’. This makes CML one of the few institutes covering both the circular, sustainable economic use of natural resources and natural capital, as well as assessing the environmental impacts of economic activities on natural resources, biodiversity and natural capital. Presently, over 150 FTE (including postdocs and PhD candidates) are employed at CML. CML collaborates with the TU Delft and Erasmus University (Rotterdam) in the Leiden-Delft-Erasmus Centre for Sustainability (LDE-CfS).

**Terms and conditions**  

We offer a 1-year position with the possibility of extension to 4 years based on performance. Salary ranges from € 2.770 gross per month in the first year to € 3.539 gross per month in the fourth year based on a full-time position (pay scale P in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities).


Leiden University offers an attractive benefits package with additional holiday (8%) and end-of-year bonuses (8.3 %), training and career development and sabbatical leave. Our individual choices model gives you some freedom to assemble your own set of terms and conditions. For international spouses we have set up a dual career programme. Candidates from outside the Netherlands may be eligible for a substantial tax break.


**Diversity**  

At the Faculty of Science we value inclusiveness and strive for a diverse community with equal opportunities for all. We give full support to our staff in achieving their potential to become independent academic researchers and teachers. For more information about our policy on diversity and equality please go to the diversity page on our website. Female researchers are also welcomed to join the Researchers In Science for Equality network of the Faculty if Science (rise.nu).

 **Information**  

Enquiries can be made to Dr. S. Henrik Barmentlo, s.h.barmentlo@cml.leidenuniv.nl


**Applications**  

Please submit your application via the online recruitment system, via the blue button at the top or bottom of this page. **Applications received via e-mail will not be taken into consideration**. Please ensure that you upload the following additional documents quoting the vacancy number:

* CV
* A motivation letter
* The names and phone numbers of two referees


Only applications received **before 19th of august** will be considered. Interviews will be conducted in September 2024.

title: Senior BI Specialist
description:
(Sr.) Professional Job Netherlands, Delft Corporate Functions Netherlands
As a Senior BI Specialist, you participate and provide input for data integration, transformation of multiple data source systems, develop data warehouses with a combination of business intelligence, data visualization and reporting tools. Next to this, you advocate self-service analytics and will give training sessions to empower the business to build their own reports, dash boards and power BI models. At Exact, your technical skills and “dare to” mentality, can lead to the best innovations. And where is your career heading? That’s up to you. The career opportunities are unprecedented. 2000 enterprising colleagues have already paved the way. Are you on board?

 **This = the job you are looking for:**

* Provide expert guidance on Business Intelligence (BI) skills and technologies.
* Develop scalable and maintainable BI applications to meet business objectives.
* Develop security and authentication standards for the department.
* Maintain accurate and complete technical architectural documents.
* Define BI standards, guidelines and best practices for business groups and technical teams.
* Support BI tools upgrades in development, testing and documentation.
* Perform maintenance and troubleshooting activities for BI tools.
* Diagnose and resolve BI tool capacity issues.
* Recommend strategies to improve performance and capacity of BI tools.
* Address customer queries and issues in a timely manner.
* Provide technical training on BI tools to team members.
* Collaborate with BI Administrators, Developers and Analysts for successful development of BI reporting and analysis solutions.
* Work with business groups and technical teams to develop and maintain data warehouse platform for BI reporting.
* Design and build tabular models writing complex DAX formulae.
* Build scalable data warehouse solutions using PaaS and SaaS services in Microsoft cloud.
* Address master data issues and provide data solutions to manage them.


You will join the 6 colleagues in the Corporate BI department. They are known for their great technical knowledge and smooth cooperation. Asking for help if necessary and offering help if possible is part of their DNA. We have few predefined paths, which gives you plenty of room to choose your own.

**The main responsibilities of the department are:**

* Key operations of the business intelligence team begin with the design and deployment of the BI architecture, which includes source systems, data warehouses, and a combination of business intelligence, data visualization, and reporting tools.
* Advocate self-service analytics and train to empower Business to build their own reports, dash boards and power BI models.
* Agree to SLA’s for providing front line support to the business users on the BI cubes and deliver big fixes and enhancements on a timely basis.


**This = what you bring**


With us, you can be yourself, and we would love to discover what sets you apart. For the position of Senior BI Specialist, it’s helpful if you have analytical skills and that you have good communications skills. What’s more, you bring:

* Microsoft suite of BI tools (Both On-premises and Cloud)
* Relevant experience in building data warehouse solutions in cloud using PaaS and SaaS services.
* Around 10 or more years of experience
* Reporting tools, mainly Power BI
* Data modeling, data warehousing, data visualization & analytics
* Programming languages like Python, .net, R would be added value.

**This = what you get**


At Exact we value the balance between work and relaxation. You can work up a sweat in our own gym or take a break at the coffee bar. Empty your head and then tackle your daily tasks with renewed energy. And, of course, that's not all. As a Senior BI Specialist, based on 40 hours per week, you can also count on:

* A competitive salary package incl. a 13th month and of course 8% holiday allowance
* An international, innovative and hybrid working environment, with the flexibility to work from home or any of our offices
* Over 2000 colleagues worldwide of which more than 500 in technology.
* 27 vacation days and in addition, loyalty days; one for each year in service with a max of 5
* 3 Giving back days, which can spend on giving back to (local) community
* A modern pension scheme
* All the room your ambition needs and to further develop your skills we facilitate training via our learning and development center to help you to fulfill your career potential
* Friday afternoon drinks at our bar “Bits & Bytes”

**About Exact**


Exact develops cloud software for small and medium-sized companies and their accountants. The products automate business processes in areas such as Finance and HR and provide specific ERP solutions for wholesale distribution, manufacturing, projects and construction. This saves time and provides insight. It enables customers to work efficiently, make informed decisions and continue growing. More than 675,000 companies primarily in the Netherlands, Belgium and Germany already rely on Exact's software.


Exact was founded in 1984 in Delft, the Netherlands, which is still the location of our head office. Every day, more than 2,000 ambitious professionals work on innovation. Driving responsible business, with respect for each other, the environment and society is central to this. For more information, visit www.exact.com.


  
##### **Vragen?**


Contact Arthur Fransen  

  



+31 15 711 5000

title: Senior Specialist, People Analytics
description:
South Pole is an energetic, global company offering comprehensive sustainability solutions and services. With offices spanning all continents across the globe, we strive to create a sustainable society and economy that positively impacts our climate, ecosystems and developing communities. With our solutions, we inspire and enable our customers to create value from sustainability-related activities.


Our Corporate Functions team is the “enablement engine” of South Pole. Behind the scenes, we provide the business with world-class solutions and best practices that sustain business growth and success. We cover key areas such as Finance, HR, Office Management, Legal, IT, Operations, etc. If you are a smart, ambitious and dynamic professional with a strong passion to make a real difference in the fight against climate change, the below position may be right for you!

**Job summary:**


As the Senior Specialist, People Analytics, you will lead the effort to generate and integrate data-driven insights into HR practices, aligning them with business goals. You will be responsible for implementing a people analytics roadmap, managing user-centric people / HR reporting and self-service systems, and ensuring high standards of data governance. Your focus will also include enhancing operational efficiency with automated, scalable solutions.

**Main tasks & responsibilities:**

**Reporting and Self-Service:**

* Develop, optimize, and maintain HR reporting and dashboards to meet business needs.
* Manage the creation of self-service reporting solutions, focusing on delivering a pleasant user experience.

Provide support to HR in the definition and usage of data, reporting, and dashboarding tools.  
* 

**Strategic Planning and Development:**

* Execute a comprehensive People Analytics roadmap to drive HR strategy and align with business objectives.
* Contribute to the development of HR strategies and roadmaps, and provide insights to refine the strategic alignment of HR and the business.

Foster a culture of evidence-based decision-making and automation within HR to improve efficiency and upskill the way of working.  
* 

**Analytics and Insight Generation:**

* Conduct People Analytics research and analyzes to derive actionable insights, and validate predictive models for business problem-solving.
* Translate complex analytical findings into understandable and actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.

Implement and validate cutting-edge analytical methodologies with rigorous statistical validation to ensure precise and reliable insights.  
* 

**Data Governance and Management:**

* Ensure the highest standards of data governance are upheld, ensuring accurate data collection, tracking, and adherence to best practices.
* Oversee data storage and sharing protocols, ensuring compliance with GDPR and other data protection regulations.

Collaborate with central data and insights teams to establish a robust people data warehouse and streamline data structures.  
* 

**Operational Efficiency, Automation and Product Development:**

* Apply a product development framework to engineer scalable, automated solutions aimed at boosting operational efficiency.
* Oversee the selection, implementation, and management of HR systems and third-party suppliers, focusing on the integration and optimization of these technologies

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Data Science, Statistics, Business Administration,or a related field (Master’s preferred).
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in People analytics, HR analytics, or a related field.
* Strong proficiency in data analysis and statistical software (e.g., SQL, R, Python).
* Experience working with REST APIs to access cloud-based services.
* Proven experience with HR systems and tools (e.g., Hibob, Workday, SAP SuccessFactors).
* Experience building dashboards with Power BI or similar data visualization tools.
* Experience with strategic workforce planning, and staff cost forecasting is a plus.
* Excellent understanding of data governance, data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR), and best practices.
* Strong project management skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
* Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and influence decision-making at all levels of the organization.


This role offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the strategic direction of the organization by leveraging data-driven people insights, to improve workforce performance and drive business success.

 **What we offer:**

  

At South Pole, we care about our employees as much as we care about the planet. South Pole is not just an employer, we are a Team. South Pole does not just offer people a job, we offer you a career. By joining our team, you will find strong purpose and deep meaning in everything you do. You will have the chance to make a real difference for our clients and for the planet, working alongside a passionate team of like-minded colleagues, while building your knowledge/skills and developing your career in a fun, dynamic, international and fast-growing organisation.


We’re a planet of 7.5 billion unique and different people. We all have a contribution to make and South Pole is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, marital status or disability. Our recruitment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

title: Enterprise Data Manager
description:
+ > 5 years

+ 36 - 40 uur
+ Data, Digital & Tech

+ €80.000 - €103.000


* You will focus on Eneco's journey to becoming a data-driven company, ensuring overall data maturity, aligning with corporate digital transformation goals.
* Maintaining our data academy, enhancing data literacy and fostering a culture of innovation across Eneco.
* Collaborate extensively with various departments, ensuring an integrated and comprehensive approach to data education and strategy within Eneco.

Why choose for Eneco?
At Eneco, we are diligently working towards a smarter, cleaner, and more sustainable future. We have an ambitious "One Planet" strategy, aiming to achieve climate neutrality for both our organization and all our customers by 2035. This entails providing innovative digital capabilities and smart solutions to realize these goals. Simultaneously, we focus on maintaining a good balance between work and personal life, fostering personal growth, and prioritizing customer orientation. At Eneco, our goal is to collectively make a difference and create a more sustainable future for everyone.


We believe in job satisfaction, personal development, and removing barriers for customers to adopt sustainable practices. As pioneers in the energy transition, we embrace new technologies and strive for an exceptional online customer experience. Collaborating with our team of digital experts, we modernize our chat, app, and web environments to deliver a superior digital customer experience. At Eneco, you are not only part of an inspiring mission but also have the opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future!


What you’ll do
Eneco has defined ‘Digital Transformation’ as a main goal in its corporate strategy. Consequently, we envision a data driven company where we serve our customers and suppliers based on up-to-date, secure, and accurate data.  

  

Your role is multifaceted, encompassing strategic responsibilities to lead the Data Academy and embed data management in the organization. This initiative is crucial in supporting Eneco’s ambition to become a data-driven company. Your main tasks are:

* Lead the Data Academy as a mature, company-wide body, promoting data literacy and awareness across Eneco, aligning it with Eneco's digital transformation goals.
* Help business in identifying correct roles and responsibilities (data owners/data stewards) and get them onboard. Guide them on adopting our policies, processes etc.
* Identify and measure data maturity KPIs (Eneco wide) and create insights on the results to the management team. Work on the results and come up with concrete plans and actions.
* Collaborate with data teams and departments to build a comprehensive training curriculum, deciding what to develop in-house and what to source externally.
* Oversee the content, events, and collaboration within the data community, fostering a data-driven culture.

Is this about you?* 5+ Years experience in data management and training, learning & development.
* In-depth knowledge of DAMA-DMBOK, i.e. data-architectural principles and guidelines.
* A broad knowledge of common architectural standards and principles.
* Strong knowledge of data-related topics such as data analysis, data visualization, data management and able to translate the needs to suitable trainings.
* Experience with change management methodology (e.g.: ADKAR).
* Organisation skills for inspiration - and knowledge sessions (e.g., Hackathons, Data Insights, peer-2-peer sessions with other organizations).
* You know how to work with different stakeholders and overcome conflicting interests.

Excellent communication skills and good command of the Dutch and English language in speaking and writing.  
* 

You’ll be responsible for* Formulate a strategic vision for the Data Academy, staying abreast of market innovations and informing relevant departments of opportunities.
* Work closely with HR and other departments (like privacy and security) to ensure a broad and aligned educational approach.
* Contribute to the vision and policies of data management.
* Business adoption of data strategy: data literacy awareness sessions, conducting roadshows etc.
* Responsible for data management within the allocated domains (business units).

This is where you’ll work
You will be joining our diverse and inclusive team. Your team consists of 2 Data Management Specialist, a Data Quality specialist and 3 Enterprise Data Managers. You'll also work with a lot of stakeholders throughout the company.


What we have to offer
Gross annual salary between €80.000 and €103.000


Including 8% holiday allowance, a good pension and parental leave.
FlexBudget on top of your gross salary


Have it paid out, use it to buy extra holiday days or save it up for something nice - it's up to you.
Personal and professional growth


Eneco is fully committed to help you in your personal and professional development.
Hybrid working, at home or in the office


You work 40% at the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide what works best for you.
View more
Work that works for you and the climate
If you decide on a career at Eneco, you are choosing ambition, growth and opportunities. You will have all the space you want to improve yourself and do your job the way that suits you best, which includes having a good work-life balance. You can work to a flexible schedule and work partly from home if your role allows it.
That is how you can work on your own future and on the future of the world. After all, you and your 4,000 colleagues are committed to our mission: climate neutrality by 2035. We assist customers to accelerate their sustainability efforts, devise innovative solutions and seize opportunities with both hands. Are you ready?
The stages of our application procedure:


Stap 1


Your application
Stap 2


We carefully review your application
Stap 3


We invite you for a 1st (online) interview
Stap 4


Sometimes we want to get to know you even better, then there will be an online assessment and a 2nd interview
Stap 5


Yes! If it’s a match and if you agree, the recruiter will happily discuss your job offer
Want to know more about this job function?
We understand that you might want to know more before taking the next step in your career. Therefore, we encourage you to get in touch with our recruiter, Mark van Dommelen. Whether you have questions about the interview process, the specific tasks and responsibilities of the position, or are simply curious about the company culture, we are ready to answer all your questions.

 **Voor het invullen van deze vacature doen we de werving graag zelf en wensen we niet samen te werken met externe partijen.**

title: Communicatiemedewerker GGD
description:
*"Hé communicatietalent! Wil jij je inzetten om de gezondheid en veiligheid van inwoners in Limburg-Noord te verbeteren? Zet jouw creatieve brein in voor het bedenken van innovatieve campagnes en het creëren van pakkende content die mensen écht raakt. Doe met ons mee en maak impact als onze nieuwe communicatiemedewerker!"*

 **Vacature**

**Communicatiemedewerker GGD** **(24 uur)**

 **Hoe ziet jouw toekomstige werkdag eruit?**  

Je start de werkdag goed met een lekkere kop koffie. Samen met je collega’s praat je bij over het weekend. Maar niet te lang, want aan het begin van de ochtend heb je meteen de weekstart van de GGD. Samen met je communicatiecollega’s bespreek je welke gezondheidsonderwerpen je de komende periode uitlicht. Dit doe je aan de hand van de omgevingsscan waarop je aanhaakt bij de behoefte van de inwoners, de contentplanning en ons jaarplan.


Hierna ga je gelijk aan de slag met het maken van content. De nieuwe social mediacampagne moet namelijk vandaag worden ingepland. Jij weet als geen ander hoe je met creatieve content de doelgroep kan bereiken. Naast je eigen kennis en ervaring, gebruik je hierbij de data en resultaten van eerdere, gelijksoortige campagnes.


De tijd vliegt en voor je het weet is het lunchtijd. Je loopt een rondje met je collega’s om even de benen te strekken. Als je terugkomt start een online meeting met een projectleider over een nieuwe voorlichtingscampagne. Je stelt vragen over doel, doelgroep en adviseert vervolgens over middelen.


Na de meeting neem je de tijd om je mail bij te werken. Je ontving een vraag van een journalist. Samen met de inhoudsdeskundige die de woordvoering doet, formuleer je de antwoorden op de vragen. Later deze week begeleid je het persmoment. Het laatste uur voer je een maandelijkse analyse uit om het gebruikersgedrag op de websites in beeld te brengen. Dit geeft weer nieuwe inzichten om de website te optimaliseren. Voldaan klap je je laptop dicht en verheug je je op morgen. Want morgen is weer een nieuwe dag die totaal anders kan zijn!

**Wat ga je doen?**  

Binnen onze veiligheidsregio hebben we de unieke combinatie van gezondheid (GGD) én veiligheid (Brandweer, Crisisbeheersing). Als communicatiemedewerker richt jij je op operationele taken van de GGD. Jouw werkgebied is breed en omvat afgebakende, uitvoerende werkzaamheden waarbij je nauw samenwerkt en spart met je communicatiecollega's.


Daarnaast zijn we een crisisorganisatie, wat betekent dat je ook bereid bent deel te nemen aan een communicatiepiket tijdens crisissituaties. Gemiddeld ben je 8 tot 10 keer per jaar een week lang bereikbaar en beschikbaar voor communicatieve werkzaamheden tijdens crisissituaties. Dit doe je samen met andere collega's die piket hebben die week.

**Jouw taken:**

* Content creatie: realiseren van boeiend en inspirerende content voor onze online en offline kanalen.
* Verhalen vertellen: complexe info omzetten in begrijpelijke en pakkende verhalen die onze doelgroep raken en betrekken.
* Social media: beheren van social media kanalen, toffe posts maken en interactie aangaan met onze volgers.
* Content organiseren: campagnes plannen en coördineren die ons merk en werk in de spotlight zetten.
* Huisstijl bewaken: bewaken en versterken van onze huisstijl in alle communicatie-uitingen
* Media contacten: opbouwen en onderhouden van relaties met de media, en zorgen voor positieve publiciteit en zichtbaarheid.
* Data checken: communicatiekanalen en communicatiecampagnes analyseren en data gebruiken om onze strategieën te verbeteren.
* Samenwerken: met verschillende teams en vormgever om communicatieprojecten van start tot finish te brengen.

**Wat breng je mee?**

* Diploma in communicatie of een vergelijkbare studie.
* Ervaring met traditionele en moderne communicatiemiddelen en campagnes.
* Top skills voor het maken pakkende teksten en beelden waarmee je onze doelgroep raakt.
* Sterk in vormgeving en bekend met tools, zoals Canva.
* Creatief brein met scherp oog voor detail.
* Sterke verbale en schriftelijke communicatie.
* Zelfstarter met een proactieve mindset.
* Analytisch vermogen om social media en websitedata om te zetten in slimme(re) communicatie.
* Echte teamplayer die graag samenwerkt.
* Passie voor verhalen vertellen en het bouwen van een sterk merk.
* Coachende vaardigheden en het vermogen om collega's te begeleiden en afdelingen te ondersteunen bij hun communicatie.

**Jouw team:**  

Je werkt in een leuk en enthousiast communicatieteam met 12 collega’s. Een team dat grotendeels bestaat uit jonge professionals, maar ook met enkele collega’s die al langer in het vak zitten. We werken hard, maar maken ook graag tijd vrij voor de ander en staan voor elkaar klaar met raad en daad, ongeacht de vraag. We gaan als team niet met elkaar op vakantie, maar een leuke activiteit, samen een hapje eten of een teamborrel vinden we belangrijk.

**Waarom zou je voor deze baan kiezen?**  

Werken voor onze Veiligheidsregio doet ertoe. Of het nu de GGD, Brandweer of Crisisbeheersing is, het gaat ergens om. Inwoners helpen zit in ons DNA. Je komt te werken in een crisisorganisatie vol afwisseling. De coronacrisis, vluchtelingen uit Oekraïne, het hoogwater van de Maas of een grote brand. Wij waren erbij betrokken. Als communicatiemedewerker zit je bij ons nooit stil.


Je kunt je eigen werktijden en werkplek bepalen. Wij werken vanuit vertrouwen waarbij vrijheden en verantwoordelijkheden hand in hand gaan. Er zijn dus volop mogelijkheden om je privé- en werksituatie met elkaar te combineren.


Wij geven je de kans om te werken bij een organisatie met meerdere interessante en uitdagende werkvelden en een divers takenpakket. Binnen ons team zijn verschillende specialisaties aanwezig, waar jij als communicatiemedewerker van kunt leren en aan bij kunt dragen. Je kunt je bij ons helemaal uitleven. Bij ons ben je in goede handen.

**Je krijgt ook:**

* Een aanstelling voor een jaar voor 24 uur per week, met uitzicht op een vaste aanstelling;
* De mogelijkheid om hybride te werken inclusief bijhorende thuiswerkvergoeding;
* Een bruto maandsalaris tussen € 3.010 en € 4.302 (schaal 8) bij een fulltime dienstverband van 36 uur, afhankelijk van ervaring;
* Mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontwikkelen via trainingen, cursussen en opleidingen;
* Alle faciliteiten om goed te kunnen werken, zoals een laptop en een telefoon;
* Een Individueel Keuze Budget (IKB). Het IKB is 18,63% van je brutoloon. Je kunt het IKB maandelijks naar eigen behoefte inzetten. Hiermee kun je korting krijgen bij een sportschool, een fiets aanschaffen of een extra opleiding volgen. Maar je mag het ook uit laten betalen of er extra vakantiedagen mee kopen

**Vragen over de vacature?**  

Je kunt altijd bellen voor meer informatie. Ook als je nog twijfelt! Neem contact op met Silke Hilkens (afdelingshoofd Communicatie) via 06 21 69 94 43.

**Ja, ik wil deze baan!**  

Ben jij de communicatiemedewerker die wij zoeken? Zorg dan dat uiterlijk 11 augustus aanstaande je motivatiebrief en CV in ons bezit is. Klik op “direct solliciteren” om je interesse kenbaar te maken.

**De sollicitatiegesprekken staan gepland op maandag 19 augustus**

 ***Acquisitie stellen wij niet op prijs***


### **Communicatiemedewerker GGD**

**Deadline inschrijving**

description:
